jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD65032 Position Overview Do you have great sales, customer management and business consultancy skills? Are you passionate about engaging your customers and collaborating with everyone you work with? Are you driven to make a difference in the water industry? If this sounds like you, read on! In this role, you are engaging with and selling to municipal and consulting engineering clients to position the Innovyze solutions for the water industry. You will be driving account management and customer relationship development and working with our pre-sales team to provide guidance and support to your clients to grow the coverage of Innovyze solution sales in the US. You will be able to utilize your combination of industry knowledge, business strategy expertise, product knowledge and account management experience to help you customers engage end user clients quickly and gain a competitive advantage in the marketplace. This is an exciting opportunity to influence the knowledge and presence of water industry software solutions and help Autodesk’s goal of achieving a more sustainable water future. Responsibilities Accelerate adoption of new solutions by helping clients understand the market opportunities and support activities that deliver the best outcomes for the end user Lead and own all sales activity for Autodesk’s client market development in your territory through relationship building, product knowledge, planning and execution to ensure adoption of Autodesk solutions from Innovyze Work with both the Autodesk teams to drive market adoption of Innovyze solutions Be the customer's voice and provide feedback to internal teams on how we can better serve our customers Develop a strong cadence of engagement along sales and technical insights with clients in your territory Have a strong and accurate forecasting cadence and grow your pipeline Where applicable, engage with resellers in your territory on lead development activities and provide assistance with their engagements for mutual success Identify recommendations and build compelling internal and external reports and insights Minimum Qualifications Strong sales experience of a complex software technology – preferably within the water/wastewater space A strong sense of ownership with a bias for action and willingness to roll up your sleeves An enthusiastic and dedicated approach to connecting with customers to gain an understanding of their business models, their clients and how they engage the market Ability to thrive in developing deep customer relationships and managing assigned accounts to result in continued revenue generation and high levels of customer satisfaction Bachelor's Degree (preference for IT, Engineering, Business or marketing related degrees) Excellent communication and presentation skills Able to travel across the territory as appropriate Experience in managing multiple complex sales Preferred Qualifications Have worked in a multi-tier sales model (direct and indirect) Have consistently made your annual quota Have worked in an environment where your team is spread across North America Enthusiasm and creativity with the ability to inspire, influence and encourage others, in both relationships with customers and peers Deep understanding of value drivers in recurring revenue business models Strong financial acumen including an analytical and process-focused mindset Understanding of Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) customer management At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It’s disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital artists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.

Job Requisition ID # 21WD48144 Position Overview Autodesk is looking for a passionate and driven individual that wants to be part of a fast-moving company transforming how it delivers value to its customers through connected forecast and planning. We are seeking a highly motivated person to join the Anaplan Forecast and Planning team to help shape the future of connected forecasting and planning. The Anaplan Model Builder is an in key role in Autodesk’s Global Operations and Finance area and is responsible for the successful design, build and implementation of Anaplan-based solutions. The ideal candidate is a team player who possesses strong analytical skills, has experience building financial models and enjoys solving and streamlining complex business problems. A successful candidate enjoys detailed and challenging puzzles, thrives in a fast-paced dynamic environment, and possesses the aptitude to work independently. The ability to ask inquisitive questions to improve financial business processes and solution those with business stakeholders is essential. Responsibilities Translate existing solutions, spreadsheets, and business problems into sophisticated Anaplan multi-dimensional models. Maintain existing Anaplan models with a focus on continuous improvement, incorporating new functionality and fixing issues in production to support business objectives and initiatives. Write model documentation to capture requirements, design solutions, deployment and run state activities. Participate in data integration efforts between internal systems and Anaplan. Monitor and validate data flows to and from Anaplan platform. Provide candid, meaningful feedback, communication and progress updates to the business model owner and project team. Participate and/or lead UAT testing and deployment with project team. Provide hands-on training to end users to facilitate adoption of the Anaplan model. Utilize and share Anaplan model building best practices. Estimate level of effort and prioritize your backlog of work in a way that satisfies stakeholder and team expectations. Minimum Qualifications We’re after a smart model builder who can speak in the language of the business, influence and advise on process optimization opportunities, and develop those improvements in Anaplan. If you’re a good candidate, you will have: Real life experience that turned you into a subject matter expert in planning and modeling for Finance and Sales. Experience working in highly-iterative software-focused work practices - Lean, Agile, Anaplan Way. You understand the principles of them but aren’t married to any particular methodology. Be someone that has walked-the-walk and has a strong finance or sales planning and forecasting background with the technical chops building solutions with Excel, Anaplan, SAP BPC, Planful, Jedox or other cloud solutions. Demonstrate a good “credit history” of paying down technical debt. Forecasting and planning via software that is connected to a variety of different systems and platforms isn’t easy, and you’ve shown you know how to do it. A keen sense for problem solving. Excellent quantitative and analytical skills. High attention to detail and scrutiny of discrepancies that sparks conversations to develop better solutions. Adaptability to work in a large team, small team, independently, remote and in-person. Hungry to learn and adopt Anaplan’s ever-evolving best practices. Learned how to learn. You have an undergrad degree in finance, business, or engineering or have a combination of other education and equivalent work. Excellent communication skills with the ability to switch contexts between highly technical and business-focused topics quickly and easily. Someone that embraces diversity, and values people not just for what they do but who they are. Actively foster an environment where people can bring their authentic selves to work. Speak up with divergent views in productive ways and comes prepared to difficult conversations with solutions in mind. At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It’s disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital artists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.

Job Requisition ID # 21WD48144 Position Overview Autodesk is looking for a passionate and driven individual that wants to be part of a fast-moving company transforming how it delivers value to its customers through connected forecast and planning. We are seeking a highly motivated person to join the Anaplan Forecast and Planning team to help shape the future of connected forecasting and planning. The Anaplan Model Builder is an in key role in Autodesk’s Global Operations and Finance area and is responsible for the successful design, build and implementation of Anaplan-based solutions. The ideal candidate is a team player who possesses strong analytical skills, has experience building financial models and enjoys solving and streamlining complex business problems. A successful candidate enjoys detailed and challenging puzzles, thrives in a fast-paced dynamic environment, and possesses the aptitude to work independently. The ability to ask inquisitive questions to improve financial business processes and solution those with business stakeholders is essential. Responsibilities Translate existing solutions, spreadsheets, and business problems into sophisticated Anaplan multi-dimensional models. Maintain existing Anaplan models with a focus on continuous improvement, incorporating new functionality and fixing issues in production to support business objectives and initiatives. Write model documentation to capture requirements, design solutions, deployment and run state activities. Participate in data integration efforts between internal systems and Anaplan. Monitor and validate data flows to and from Anaplan platform. Provide candid, meaningful feedback, communication and progress updates to the business model owner and project team. Participate and/or lead UAT testing and deployment with project team. Provide hands-on training to end users to facilitate adoption of the Anaplan model. Utilize and share Anaplan model building best practices. Estimate level of effort and prioritize your backlog of work in a way that satisfies stakeholder and team expectations. Minimum Qualifications We’re after a smart model builder who can speak in the language of the business, influence and advise on process optimization opportunities, and develop those improvements in Anaplan. If you’re a good candidate, you will have: Real life experience that turned you into a subject matter expert in planning and modeling for Finance and Sales. Experience working in highly-iterative software-focused work practices - Lean, Agile, Anaplan Way. You understand the principles of them but aren’t married to any particular methodology. Be someone that has walked-the-walk and has a strong finance or sales planning and forecasting background with the technical chops building solutions with Excel, Anaplan, SAP BPC, Planful, Jedox or other cloud solutions. Demonstrate a good “credit history” of paying down technical debt. Forecasting and planning via software that is connected to a variety of different systems and platforms isn’t easy, and you’ve shown you know how to do it. A keen sense for problem solving. Excellent quantitative and analytical skills. High attention to detail and scrutiny of discrepancies that sparks conversations to develop better solutions. Adaptability to work in a large team, small team, independently, remote and in-person. Hungry to learn and adopt Anaplan’s ever-evolving best practices. Learned how to learn. You have an undergrad degree in finance, business, or engineering or have a combination of other education and equivalent work. Excellent communication skills with the ability to switch contexts between highly technical and business-focused topics quickly and easily. Someone that embraces diversity, and values people not just for what they do but who they are. Actively foster an environment where people can bring their authentic selves to work. Speak up with divergent views in productive ways and comes prepared to difficult conversations with solutions in mind. At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. Job Requisition ID # 22WD61478 Position Overview Want to help build the future, faster? Here is an exciting opportunity to work on our flagship product, AutoCAD! We’re in the process of building a new AutoCAD mobile team, setting new processes and best practices, and are looking for a self-starter to come be part of our small but mighty team. If you’re interested in solving challenging engineering problems, are excited to learn, and enjoy mentoring and coaching others, we’d love for you to join us! This position is open to being remote, Pacific Time Zone. In this role, you’ll help build the world-class Android app for AutoCAD. We already have subscribers, but there’s a lot of room for growth and developing new features. Responsibilities Translating designs and product requirements into high-quality code on the Android platform Partnering with cross-functional teams to elaborate, design, and implement new features Designing, building, and maintaining reusable, reliable, high-performance code Ensuring the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of the application Identifying and correcting bottlenecks and fixing bugs Helping maintain code quality, organization, and automatization Building efficient and reusable front-end abstractions and systems Pushing the envelope on cutting-edge mobile technologies and front-end engineering best practices Minimum Qualifications B.S. or M.S. degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field 3+ years of professional software development experience Proficiency in Java or Kotlin Understanding of the Android mobile app development cycle Familiarity with Android libraries, services, and SDKs Understanding of UX/UI standards, performance tuning, threading and offline storage Experience with developing cross-platform software components, test driven development and continuous delivery Preferred Qualifications Published Android apps in the Google Play store Optimization and benchmarking skills Familiarity with CAD software (Architectural, Mechanical, or Civil design) ML/AI operations experience Experience managing software projects across different geos and time zones Software development experience in a web environment Experience building iOS apps Want to learn more? See how we’re building a diverse workforce and a culture of belonging to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and create a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD61478 Position Overview Want to help build the future, faster? Here is an exciting opportunity to work on our flagship product, AutoCAD! We’re in the process of building a new AutoCAD mobile team, setting new processes and best practices, and are looking for a self-starter to come be part of our small but mighty team. If you’re interested in solving challenging engineering problems, are excited to learn, and enjoy mentoring and coaching others, we’d love for you to join us! This position is open to being remote, Pacific Time Zone. In this role, you’ll help build the world-class Android app for AutoCAD. We already have subscribers, but there’s a lot of room for growth and developing new features. Responsibilities Translating designs and product requirements into high-quality code on the Android platform Partnering with cross-functional teams to elaborate, design, and implement new features Designing, building, and maintaining reusable, reliable, high-performance code Ensuring the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of the application Identifying and correcting bottlenecks and fixing bugs Helping maintain code quality, organization, and automatization Building efficient and reusable front-end abstractions and systems Pushing the envelope on cutting-edge mobile technologies and front-end engineering best practices Minimum Qualifications B.S. or M.S. degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field 3+ years of professional software development experience Proficiency in Java or Kotlin Understanding of the Android mobile app development cycle Familiarity with Android libraries, services, and SDKs Understanding of UX/UI standards, performance tuning, threading and offline storage Experience with developing cross-platform software components, test driven development and continuous delivery Preferred Qualifications Published Android apps in the Google Play store Optimization and benchmarking skills Familiarity with CAD software (Architectural, Mechanical, or Civil design) ML/AI operations experience Experience managing software projects across different geos and time zones Software development experience in a web environment Experience building iOS apps Want to learn more? Job Requisition ID # 22WD64937 Position Overview As an Art Director at Autodesk, you will help build the brand strategy and innovation for Autodesk’s brand in construction. You will work closely with the Director of Creative Design on creative output including brand identity, digital and out-of-home creative execution, marketing and social campaign asset development, the marketing website, and on-site experiences for hosted and third-party events including Autodesk University. We’re looking for an Art Director that will be an integral leader to a small team of designers, with the responsibility of leading the development of innovative and compelling creative. You will craft clear, inspiring, and authentic storytelling for our Autodesk Construction Cloud products—from conceptualization to delivery. As a lead member of the Creative team, you will have the opportunity to level-up all our brand within the construction industry, but more importantly provide creative solutions for effective and efficient workflows. We are a big fan of collaboration as you will be working with Autodesk Construction Solutions Marketing team, as well as collaboration with other teams within the Autodesk family. Responsibilities Manage a small team of designers Collaborate with other designers on creative solutions Create regional and global campaigns, social ads, digital ads, event graphics, marketing collateral, executive content, product artwork all within our brand guidelines Review creative briefs from all stakeholders domestic and international Be able to manage and accountable for all creative requests small or large that are assigned to you Build and own effective strategies to address the creative needs for a variety of work including different styles and needs across Marketing as well as Autodesk Construction Solutions organization Energy, drive, passion for details, and enthusiasm to do and be the very best about quality, not quantity Deep knowledge and experience both creatively and technically in following fields: motion graphics, typography, color theory, presentation and publication composition, web, social and event deliverables Outstanding communication and relationship skills, including collaborating cross-functionally within the Creative team and organization An extraordinary sense of taste and an ability to adapt to a variety of visual styles and remain consistent with brand throughout all creative assets Be a brand ambassador of Autodesk Construction Cloud brand standards in all aspects of creative work Minimum Qualifications 10+ years of senior level experience with in-house brand team and agencies Talent to inspire other designers for impactful collaborative work High level of proficiency using design tools including Figma and Adobe Creative Cloud Thrive in a fast-paced environment on multiple tasks with tight deadlines Experience with working with a DAM (Digital Asset Management) system Must have a strong online portfolio At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. Job Requisition ID # 22WD65876 Position Overview Are you passionate about the value of data, data protection, and bringing order to chaos? Do you consider yourself to be a deeply analytical problem-solver and have the excellent written/verbal, process-diagramming, and communication skills to succeed in a complex environment? Do you have a willingness to roll up your sleeves and pitch in to help others to achieve the team's end goals? As a Privacy Operations Specialist, you will help to shape enable the Privacy Program at Autodesk and protect the value of data. Acting as the conduit between the cross-functional business teams, Legal, Privacy, and the development teams, this position is primarily focused on analysis, design, and process documentation. You will contribute to scalability of the Privacy team with documentation and process optimization. Learn, grow, and contribute right away. We trust that you will bring experience and knowledge that will uplift the team. This role reports directly to the Privacy Operations Manager. Responsibilities Business Process Management Map and maintain current and future state processes, data flows/data inventory Drive end-to-end process design and analysis while collaborating with cross-functional teams Make recommendations for process improvements to drive change (e.g., optimize efficiencies, increase compliance efforts) Help identify, measure, and report on key performance metrics that demonstrate the health and effectiveness of the Privacy program Systems Analysis Assist with implementation of privacy tech tools to improve privacy maturity and build scalable processes Serve as the liaison between the business stakeholders and technical teams Understand business problems and translate them into functional and non-functional requirements Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources and reconcile conflicts Dissect high-level information into details and communicate these details in a manner understood by relevant audiences Project Management Lead or assist in project planning and scheduling, managing tasks and coordinating project resources and communication to meet objectives and timelines Work to become a privacy expert, by tracking key projects and timelines to ensure that the Privacy team delivers success to internal teams and stakeholders Provide ongoing direction and support for the privacy training program Work with stakeholders to prioritize process changes and define impact Minimum Qualifications Strong business analysis and process mapping skills Experience collaborating with technical and business teams Previous experience with Cross-functional projects Process analysis Process documentation Requirements gathering Fundamental Project Management Skills Demonstrate ability to think critically and creatively, with superior analytical and problem-solving skills Outstanding organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills (verbal/presentation/written) Experience with common BPM, Project Mgmt. tools Preferred Qualifications Relevant experience in data privacy programs, or another related field Education: Bachelor’s degree and a dedication to ongoing learning Certifications: CIPP/US/E/CIPM or CIPT or other privacy or risk and compliance-related certifications is a plus, but not required Working knowledge of SQL, databases, and BI tools The Ideal Candidate You like to get to the bottom of things; you are not shy about interviewing people in the organization until you understand exactly how their processes work. You know which questions to ask to get clarity and are diligent about your investigation before documenting the definitions and attributes of a process Have an ability to interpret people’s input and visually represent it in a way that can better align and help people understand how a process runs. You can quickly understand where bottlenecks exist, how processes are interrelated to each other, and are able to make recommendations on how to improve a process You are not afraid of documenting your findings. You are extremely detail-oriented and meticulous, knowing that your work will set the foundations of a healthy and efficient organization. You take pride in documenting processes in a way that is easily usable to the larger organization Remote work allowed At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. Job Requisition ID # 22WD64574 Position Overview Autodesk is looking for a passionate individual that wants to be part of a fast-moving company transforming how it delivers value to its customers through new processes and technology. The Senior Business Process Analyst on the Robotic Process Automation team will be responsible for driving process excellence within Autodesk’s Finance and Operations organization, partnering and collaborating with both business and technology teams in a cross-functional way. This role will intake, assess and prioritize new automation opportunities as well as develop requirements to simplify, optimize and automate business processes in our world-wide finance and global operations areas. In addition, this role will serve as an advisor to business units within finance and operations areas to champion and drive process automation initiatives. This is a highly visible role on the leading edge of a dynamic transformation within Autodesk. Responsibilities Work as part of a talented group of process analysts to identify business processes best suited for simplification, optimization and automation Perform structured assessments of business processes to determine fit for automation and forecast ROI Create process design documents and collaborate with the RPA development team to help transform process designs into automations that deliver business value In collaboration with stakeholders, define business outcomes and metrics to determine forecasted and actual ROI Work with business teams in the finance and operations to understand their business value streams and desired outcomes Work with project managers and product owners to provide regular updates to business champions on work in process, work in backlog and potential automation opportunities Collaborate with technology teams within Autodesk, such as our partners in Digital Platforms & Experience, Enterprise Services, Internal Auditing and Information Security to ensure new automations and features are efficiently and safely deployed to production Minimum Qualifications We’re after an experienced analyst who can speak in the language of the business, educate and advise the business on their process optimization and automation opportunities, and effectively communicate with highly technical teams. If you’re a good candidate, you will have: Experience in business process improvement, systems analysis, and robotic process automation technologies Amazing critical thinking skills with the ability to take abstract concepts and ideas, distill them down, and make them real both visually and in writing. You want to understand not only the what and why of something that needs to be done, but how you can help your team get there A keen sense for problem-solving - sniffing out process opportunities and automation challenges as we mobilize on our transformation, having a clear view of cause-and-effect so that you can help both the business you’re your team prioritize effectively Excellent communication skills with the ability to switch contexts between highly technical and business-focused topics quickly and easily. Excellent facilitation skills suited for in-person and virtual meetings We’re looking for somebody with experience (prior professional experience in process and systems analysis role), 5+ years business process improvement and process automation) that has learned, sometimes the hard way, how to be a fantastic business process analyst An individual who has learned how to learn. You have an undergrad degree in engineering or business operations or have a combination of other education and equivalent work Lots of experience working in highly iterative development processes. You understand the principles of lean and agile frameworks but aren’t married to any particular methodology or technology Somebody prepared to deal with the boring and the tough. Every minute of every day in a business process analyst role isn’t always working with teams to deploy new automations. A process analyst in this role must also be willing and able to take on things like sifting through process recordings, creating value stream maps, documenting processes and being data driven in both process improvement and prioritization of potential automation opportunities Preferred Qualifications If you can check all the boxes above and still want to stand out from the crowd, our preferred candidate will also: Be someone that has walked-the-walk and has a strong analytical background in systems analysis, process improvement and business analysis Prior experience with robotic process automation tools and techniques that has delivered measurable business improvements via process automation A healthy background in Lean, Agile, and other empirical processes that drive continuous improvement. You know your way around a Kanban or Scrum board and can speak fluently to value streams and optimizing flow while reducing waste. Jira and BPM are more to you than just words and acronyms. Six Sigma is far more to you than just the color of a belt Significant experience as an analyst in complex systems integration. You’ve not only drawn the lines on a Visio diagram, you’ve created requirements documents, know the difference between a functional and non-functional requirement, and delivered presentations to technical and non-technical teams Bring experience working in business and stakeholder management, providing expert insight into strategic and tactical opportunities for improvement in partner/client organizations Have a portfolio of successful high-risk, high-visibility projects. You’ve worked on teams that drove big initiatives over the line while meeting tight commitments to do so An understanding of the Lean principles of product development. One-piece flow, visual management, context switching, and simplification have become a way-of-life for you. You know that product development is a different animal than manufacturing and repetitive processes, and you think of automation development as a product that moves through a product development value stream Target Pay for this Position (Colorado): 90 - 115K At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. Job Requisition ID # 22WD64574 Position Overview Autodesk is looking for a passionate individual that wants to be part of a fast-moving company transforming how it delivers value to its customers through new processes and technology. The Senior Business Process Analyst on the Robotic Process Automation team will be responsible for driving process excellence within Autodesk’s Finance and Operations organization, partnering and collaborating with both business and technology teams in a cross-functional way. This role will intake, assess and prioritize new automation opportunities as well as develop requirements to simplify, optimize and automate business processes in our world-wide finance and global operations areas. In addition, this role will serve as an advisor to business units within finance and operations areas to champion and drive process automation initiatives. This is a highly visible role on the leading edge of a dynamic transformation within Autodesk. Responsibilities Work as part of a talented group of process analysts to identify business processes best suited for simplification, optimization and automation Perform structured assessments of business processes to determine fit for automation and forecast ROI Create process design documents and collaborate with the RPA development team to help transform process designs into automations that deliver business value In collaboration with stakeholders, define business outcomes and metrics to determine forecasted and actual ROI Work with business teams in the finance and operations to understand their business value streams and desired outcomes Work with project managers and product owners to provide regular updates to business champions on work in process, work in backlog and potential automation opportunities Collaborate with technology teams within Autodesk, such as our partners in Digital Platforms & Experience, Enterprise Services, Internal Auditing and Information Security to ensure new automations and features are efficiently and safely deployed to production Minimum Qualifications We’re after an experienced analyst who can speak in the language of the business, educate and advise the business on their process optimization and automation opportunities, and effectively communicate with highly technical teams. If you’re a good candidate, you will have: Experience in business process improvement, systems analysis, and robotic process automation technologies Amazing critical thinking skills with the ability to take abstract concepts and ideas, distill them down, and make them real both visually and in writing. You want to understand not only the what and why of something that needs to be done, but how you can help your team get there A keen sense for problem-solving - sniffing out process opportunities and automation challenges as we mobilize on our transformation, having a clear view of cause-and-effect so that you can help both the business you’re your team prioritize effectively Excellent communication skills with the ability to switch contexts between highly technical and business-focused topics quickly and easily. Excellent facilitation skills suited for in-person and virtual meetings We’re looking for somebody with experience (prior professional experience in process and systems analysis role), 5+ years business process improvement and process automation) that has learned, sometimes the hard way, how to be a fantastic business process analyst An individual who has learned how to learn. You have an undergrad degree in engineering or business operations or have a combination of other education and equivalent work Lots of experience working in highly iterative development processes. You understand the principles of lean and agile frameworks but aren’t married to any particular methodology or technology Somebody prepared to deal with the boring and the tough. Every minute of every day in a business process analyst role isn’t always working with teams to deploy new automations. A process analyst in this role must also be willing and able to take on things like sifting through process recordings, creating value stream maps, documenting processes and being data driven in both process improvement and prioritization of potential automation opportunities Preferred Qualifications If you can check all the boxes above and still want to stand out from the crowd, our preferred candidate will also: Be someone that has walked-the-walk and has a strong analytical background in systems analysis, process improvement and business analysis Prior experience with robotic process automation tools and techniques that has delivered measurable business improvements via process automation A healthy background in Lean, Agile, and other empirical processes that drive continuous improvement. You know your way around a Kanban or Scrum board and can speak fluently to value streams and optimizing flow while reducing waste. Jira and BPM are more to you than just words and acronyms. Six Sigma is far more to you than just the color of a belt Significant experience as an analyst in complex systems integration. You’ve not only drawn the lines on a Visio diagram, you’ve created requirements documents, know the difference between a functional and non-functional requirement, and delivered presentations to technical and non-technical teams Bring experience working in business and stakeholder management, providing expert insight into strategic and tactical opportunities for improvement in partner/client organizations Have a portfolio of successful high-risk, high-visibility projects. You’ve worked on teams that drove big initiatives over the line while meeting tight commitments to do so An understanding of the Lean principles of product development. One-piece flow, visual management, context switching, and simplification have become a way-of-life for you. You know that product development is a different animal than manufacturing and repetitive processes, and you think of automation development as a product that moves through a product development value stream Target Pay for this Position (Colorado): 90 - 115K At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. You understand the principles of lean and agile frameworks but aren’t married to any particular methodology or technology Somebody prepared to deal with the boring and the tough. You know your way around a Kanban or Scrum board and can speak fluently to value streams and optimizing flow while reducing waste. Jira and BPM are more to you than just words and acronyms. Six Sigma is far more to you than just the color of a belt Significant experience as an analyst in complex systems integration. Job Requisition ID # 22WD64574 Position Overview Autodesk is looking for a passionate individual that wants to be part of a fast-moving company transforming how it delivers value to its customers through new processes and technology. The Senior Business Process Analyst on the Robotic Process Automation team will be responsible for driving process excellence within Autodesk’s Finance and Operations organization, partnering and collaborating with both business and technology teams in a cross-functional way. This role will intake, assess and prioritize new automation opportunities as well as develop requirements to simplify, optimize and automate business processes in our world-wide finance and global operations areas. In addition, this role will serve as an advisor to business units within finance and operations areas to champion and drive process automation initiatives. This is a highly visible role on the leading edge of a dynamic transformation within Autodesk. Responsibilities Work as part of a talented group of process analysts to identify business processes best suited for simplification, optimization and automation Perform structured assessments of business processes to determine fit for automation and forecast ROI Create process design documents and collaborate with the RPA development team to help transform process designs into automations that deliver business value In collaboration with stakeholders, define business outcomes and metrics to determine forecasted and actual ROI Work with business teams in the finance and operations to understand their business value streams and desired outcomes Work with project managers and product owners to provide regular updates to business champions on work in process, work in backlog and potential automation opportunities Collaborate with technology teams within Autodesk, such as our partners in Digital Platforms & Experience, Enterprise Services, Internal Auditing and Information Security to ensure new automations and features are efficiently and safely deployed to production Minimum Qualifications We’re after an experienced analyst who can speak in the language of the business, educate and advise the business on their process optimization and automation opportunities, and effectively communicate with highly technical teams. If you’re a good candidate, you will have: Experience in business process improvement, systems analysis, and robotic process automation technologies Amazing critical thinking skills with the ability to take abstract concepts and ideas, distill them down, and make them real both visually and in writing. You want to understand not only the what and why of something that needs to be done, but how you can help your team get there A keen sense for problem-solving - sniffing out process opportunities and automation challenges as we mobilize on our transformation, having a clear view of cause-and-effect so that you can help both the business you’re your team prioritize effectively Excellent communication skills with the ability to switch contexts between highly technical and business-focused topics quickly and easily. Excellent facilitation skills suited for in-person and virtual meetings We’re looking for somebody with experience (prior professional experience in process and systems analysis role), 5+ years business process improvement and process automation) that has learned, sometimes the hard way, how to be a fantastic business process analyst An individual who has learned how to learn. You have an undergrad degree in engineering or business operations or have a combination of other education and equivalent work Lots of experience working in highly iterative development processes. You understand the principles of lean and agile frameworks but aren’t married to any particular methodology or technology Somebody prepared to deal with the boring and the tough. Every minute of every day in a business process analyst role isn’t always working with teams to deploy new automations. A process analyst in this role must also be willing and able to take on things like sifting through process recordings, creating value stream maps, documenting processes and being data driven in both process improvement and prioritization of potential automation opportunities Preferred Qualifications If you can check all the boxes above and still want to stand out from the crowd, our preferred candidate will also: Be someone that has walked-the-walk and has a strong analytical background in systems analysis, process improvement and business analysis Prior experience with robotic process automation tools and techniques that has delivered measurable business improvements via process automation A healthy background in Lean, Agile, and other empirical processes that drive continuous improvement. You know your way around a Kanban or Scrum board and can speak fluently to value streams and optimizing flow while reducing waste. Jira and BPM are more to you than just words and acronyms. Job Requisition ID # 22WD65227 Position Overview Autodesk is looking for a Business Systems Analyst for our Enterprise Data Management team with a focus on understanding systems, processes, and business capabilities that impact our customer’s lifecycle. Would you enjoy collaborating with people from across the company to drive improvements in customer data quality and integration patterns? Job Requisition ID # 22WD61507 “Unified Design” @ Autodesk At Autodesk, we are obsessed with building tools for people who imagine, design, and make a better world for the 10 billion people living on our planet. According to the UN, more than 90% of future population growth will occur in cities. This creates an ever-growing pressure to build more densely. At the same time, we become increasingly aware of the importance of sustainability and living qualities like daylight, microclimate, and noise. If the cities of tomorrow are to be both affordable, sustainable, and pleasant places to live, we need to give architects and city planners super-powers to handle this rising complexity. That is our goal in the Unified Design product group at Autodesk: Put the power of analysis, generative design, data, and seamless collaboration in the hands of our customers, to help them build better cities. Position Overview Reporting to the Vice President of the Unified Design Product group, the successful candidate will be a highly strategic, analytical, organized, motivated and adaptable leader. They will support our leadership team to build a highly agile organization, design operational models and cross-team processes that enable the organization to achieve its mission and execute against key priorities. In the Unified Design Product group, we are on a journey to disrupt the Architecture, Engineering and Construction (AEC) industry and help the world design and build better cities and spaces. The need for change is pressing, and the challenge is huge. We are innovating, experimenting and moving quickly to enable this transformation and as a result, our team is in a state of constant change. The Unified Design Chief of Staff is critical to our success, as we need to actively manage the change, support our team in delivering on goals, and constantly optimize our operations to adapt. You’ll be a pivotal player with broad impact. Tasked with using your creativity and initiative, you will tackle issues and resolve challenges, ensuring the team is well positioned to execute. You will also focus on relentlessly raising the performance level of the leadership team and the organization as a whole. Responsibilities Strategic Planning Plan and coordinate Unified Design strategy and planning cycles, connecting and leveraging different points of view to help leadership and product teams plan with the best possible business context. This includes development of timelines and process for the organization, supporting teams to completion of associated deliverables, and working collaboratively with the team to prepare presentations Plan and facilitate executive meetings/workshops with broader organization (Industry strategy, sales, marketing, customer success). This can include formulating the topics to cover, building and advising agendas, guiding and facilitating the discussion, bringing together notes and action items, and following up as appropriate Designing and guiding outcome oriented strategic and tactical team meetings. This could include team building sessions, organizational reviews, strategy discussions, and other topics for team meetings. Ability to frame problems and find structures/models that help people better understand the problem and trade-offs required Tracking & Follow Up Track and communicate organization OKRs. This includes Autodesk objectives and strategic intent metrics assigned to Unified Design, as well as internal Unified Design priorities, goals and metrics. Support the organization in discovering gaps in objectives and priorities across teams and products Project Management Lead special projects and programs. This includes key strategic initiatives that impact the overall success of the company as well as team culture initiatives to help support a healthy organization. Some projects will span beyond the scope of the group, requiring cross-company collaboration Trusted Counsel Act as a ‘trusted counsel’ to the executive and senior leaders. Provide insight and analysis on the organization’s operations, key decisions and other business areas as well as represent the executive in certain meetings he/she is unable to attend. Partner closely with other functions relevant to the team, including Finance, HR, Product Management, Marketing, Support and Sales Communication Manage communications. These can be internal team communications as well as communications out to the wider Autodesk organization Support development of presentation content. This can include presentations for executive meetings, customer meetings and other high value events Champion a spirit of collaboration and open communications. Work across teams to advance organizational goals and engender trust, including work with other Chief’s of Staff across the company, sharing and developing best practices Minimum Qualifications GSD – “Get stuff done” attitude: Can solve any task that needs solving Break new ground: Comfortable navigating in a big organization, identifying and engaging with teams and stakeholders as necessary to get results Agile mindset: Embody attitudes supporting an agile working environment. These include respect, collaboration, improvement and learning cycles, pride in ownership, focus on delivering value, the ability to adapt to change and the drive for continuous improvement Starter and finisher: See where improvements can be made and take action to make sure it gets solved. Great at taking responsibility through the whole process from A to B Organized: Structured and organized persona that follows up and makes sure nothing falls through the cracks “Allrounder”: Should be able to step in as “acting” when needed for colleagues on leave Courageous: Dare to challenge consensus and established process Project Management: demonstrated success leading complex projects and / or programs across teams or organizations Education: Bachelor’s degree or higher. MBA may be an advantage, but not required Business minded: Solid business acumen, critical thinking, problem solving, and organizational skills Networker: Versatile self-starter with a team-oriented work style. Ability to build credibility and relationships quickly across functions and levels Communication skills: Excellent written and oral communication skills, particularly in English. Ability to communicate complex concepts concisely, clearly and effectively across multiple levels including executive leadership team, peers, managers and junior staff Servant Leader: Ability to lead and support teams with empathy, and inclusion, empowering teams and individuals to create desired results with psychological safety Integrity: Highest level of integrity and management of confidential information Sounding board: A good sounding board for others, with a low ego and ability to anticipate the needs of a busy executive SaaS: Experience working in a SaaS environment Customer Facing: Experience working in Customer facing roles Product Organization: Experience working in a Product Organization At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD61507 “Unified Design” @ Autodesk At Autodesk, we are obsessed with building tools for people who imagine, design, and make a better world for the 10 billion people living on our planet. According to the UN, more than 90% of future population growth will occur in cities. This creates an ever-growing pressure to build more densely. At the same time, we become increasingly aware of the importance of sustainability and living qualities like daylight, microclimate, and noise. If the cities of tomorrow are to be both affordable, sustainable, and pleasant places to live, we need to give architects and city planners super-powers to handle this rising complexity. That is our goal in the Unified Design product group at Autodesk: Put the power of analysis, generative design, data, and seamless collaboration in the hands of our customers, to help them build better cities. Position Overview Reporting to the Vice President of the Unified Design Product group, the successful candidate will be a highly strategic, analytical, organized, motivated and adaptable leader. They will support our leadership team to build a highly agile organization, design operational models and cross-team processes that enable the organization to achieve its mission and execute against key priorities. In the Unified Design Product group, we are on a journey to disrupt the Architecture, Engineering and Construction (AEC) industry and help the world design and build better cities and spaces. The need for change is pressing, and the challenge is huge. We are innovating, experimenting and moving quickly to enable this transformation and as a result, our team is in a state of constant change. The Unified Design Chief of Staff is critical to our success, as we need to actively manage the change, support our team in delivering on goals, and constantly optimize our operations to adapt. You’ll be a pivotal player with broad impact. Tasked with using your creativity and initiative, you will tackle issues and resolve challenges, ensuring the team is well positioned to execute. You will also focus on relentlessly raising the performance level of the leadership team and the organization as a whole. Responsibilities Strategic Planning Plan and coordinate Unified Design strategy and planning cycles, connecting and leveraging different points of view to help leadership and product teams plan with the best possible business context. This includes development of timelines and process for the organization, supporting teams to completion of associated deliverables, and working collaboratively with the team to prepare presentations Plan and facilitate executive meetings/workshops with broader organization (Industry strategy, sales, marketing, customer success). This can include formulating the topics to cover, building and advising agendas, guiding and facilitating the discussion, bringing together notes and action items, and following up as appropriate Designing and guiding outcome oriented strategic and tactical team meetings. This could include team building sessions, organizational reviews, strategy discussions, and other topics for team meetings. Ability to frame problems and find structures/models that help people better understand the problem and trade-offs required Tracking & Follow Up Track and communicate organization OKRs. This includes Autodesk objectives and strategic intent metrics assigned to Unified Design, as well as internal Unified Design priorities, goals and metrics. Support the organization in discovering gaps in objectives and priorities across teams and products Project Management Lead special projects and programs. This includes key strategic initiatives that impact the overall success of the company as well as team culture initiatives to help support a healthy organization. Some projects will span beyond the scope of the group, requiring cross-company collaboration Trusted Counsel Act as a ‘trusted counsel’ to the executive and senior leaders. Provide insight and analysis on the organization’s operations, key decisions and other business areas as well as represent the executive in certain meetings he/she is unable to attend. Partner closely with other functions relevant to the team, including Finance, HR, Product Management, Marketing, Support and Sales Communication Manage communications. These can be internal team communications as well as communications out to the wider Autodesk organization Support development of presentation content. This can include presentations for executive meetings, customer meetings and other high value events Champion a spirit of collaboration and open communications. Work across teams to advance organizational goals and engender trust, including work with other Chief’s of Staff across the company, sharing and developing best practices Minimum Qualifications GSD – “Get stuff done” attitude: Can solve any task that needs solving Break new ground: Comfortable navigating in a big organization, identifying and engaging with teams and stakeholders as necessary to get results Agile mindset: Embody attitudes supporting an agile working environment. These include respect, collaboration, improvement and learning cycles, pride in ownership, focus on delivering value, the ability to adapt to change and the drive for continuous improvement Starter and finisher: See where improvements can be made and take action to make sure it gets solved. Great at taking responsibility through the whole process from A to B Organized: Structured and organized persona that follows up and makes sure nothing falls through the cracks “Allrounder”: Should be able to step in as “acting” when needed for colleagues on leave Courageous: Dare to challenge consensus and established process Project Management: demonstrated success leading complex projects and / or programs across teams or organizations Education: Bachelor’s degree or higher. MBA may be an advantage, but not required Business minded: Solid business acumen, critical thinking, problem solving, and organizational skills Networker: Versatile self-starter with a team-oriented work style. Ability to build credibility and relationships quickly across functions and levels Communication skills: Excellent written and oral communication skills, particularly in English. Ability to communicate complex concepts concisely, clearly and effectively across multiple levels including executive leadership team, peers, managers and junior staff Servant Leader: Ability to lead and support teams with empathy, and inclusion, empowering teams and individuals to create desired results with psychological safety Integrity: Highest level of integrity and management of confidential information Sounding board: A good sounding board for others, with a low ego and ability to anticipate the needs of a busy executive SaaS: Experience working in a SaaS environment Customer Facing: Experience working in Customer facing roles Product Organization: Experience working in a Product Organization At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Job Requisition ID # 22WD64886 Position Overview Autodesk’s Marketing organization is seeking a highly strategic, consultative, analytical, organized, and motivated individual to work as Chief of Staff for the company’s Chief Marketing Officer. In this role you will partner closely with the Marketing leadership team, acting as an enabler for strategic initiatives, and ensuring execution of key priorities. You will be charged with building alignment on strategic initiatives with the senior leadership team and broader organization to include planning, communicating, and operationalizing strategic programs for the group. This role is a pivotal player requiring influence, initiative, creativity, and resolve to ensure the CMO and team is well positioned to execute. Responsibilities Strategy Manage the organization’s strategic roadmap by tracking all initiatives and verifying execution and updating dashboards as needed, conferring with leadership in determining key performance indicators, scope, and structure of the process Serve as a trusted advisor to elevate and amplify the CMO’s capacity, capability, and effectiveness. The Chief of Staff will act as a sounding board, serve as liaison or proxy when needed, and manage executive communications for the leader being supported Create, plan, and facilitate staff meetings to accomplish clear and effective decision making, tracking, and reporting on follow-up actions required, providing appropriate messaging both written & spoken to provide an overall view across teams to help collaboration across the organization Coordinate opportunities for efficiency by conducting research, benchmarking & analytics, propose new systems/processes to streamline as needed Oversee the process to ensure appropriate capture and cataloging of the WWM’s knowledge base – establishing an information protocol across the team Operational Needs Identify and execute initiatives that contribute to long-term operational excellence, ensuring key projects have clear milestones, success measures and operational plans Manage the process to connect the extended leadership team and directs – ensuring regular cadence of engagement and leveraging appropriate strategic assets across the team as it relates to the strategy process Plan and build content for internal communications, all-hands meetings, and operational reviews Create clarity around emerging areas so the team can prioritize and resource them Manage and coordinate high value, cross-functional initiatives, and projects, as well as the execution in support of special programs/projects across WWM, COO and Autodesk Financial Management Maintain and oversee team budgeting process, establishing a clear link between strategic goals and budget allocation/ROI Coordinate budget issues among and across the team to ensure actuals meet targets and liaising with the team’s finance business partner to ensure accuracy The Ideal candidate Minimum of 10+ years of experience of progressively expansive responsibilities, with experience in program and/or process management, corporate innovation, strategy development or the like Familiarity with Marketing practices, with knowledge of appropriate research, trends, and technology innovation – particularly those with relevance to software industries Persuasive leader with experience driving initiatives with demonstrable outcomes, engaging with executives, and supporting others to articulate a vision Deep analytical and problem-solving skills. Comfortable using a data-driven approach to assess markets, industries, financial and business models Strong written and verbal communication skills Target Pay for this Position (Colorado): 190 - 220K At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD64886 Position Overview Autodesk’s Marketing organization is seeking a highly strategic, consultative, analytical, organized, and motivated individual to work as Chief of Staff for the company’s Chief Marketing Officer. In this role you will partner closely with the Marketing leadership team, acting as an enabler for strategic initiatives, and ensuring execution of key priorities. You will be charged with building alignment on strategic initiatives with the senior leadership team and broader organization to include planning, communicating, and operationalizing strategic programs for the group. This role is a pivotal player requiring influence, initiative, creativity, and resolve to ensure the CMO and team is well positioned to execute. Responsibilities Strategy Manage the organization’s strategic roadmap by tracking all initiatives and verifying execution and updating dashboards as needed, conferring with leadership in determining key performance indicators, scope, and structure of the process Serve as a trusted advisor to elevate and amplify the CMO’s capacity, capability, and effectiveness. The Chief of Staff will act as a sounding board, serve as liaison or proxy when needed, and manage executive communications for the leader being supported Create, plan, and facilitate staff meetings to accomplish clear and effective decision making, tracking, and reporting on follow-up actions required, providing appropriate messaging both written & spoken to provide an overall view across teams to help collaboration across the organization Coordinate opportunities for efficiency by conducting research, benchmarking & analytics, propose new systems/processes to streamline as needed Oversee the process to ensure appropriate capture and cataloging of the WWM’s knowledge base – establishing an information protocol across the team Operational Needs Identify and execute initiatives that contribute to long-term operational excellence, ensuring key projects have clear milestones, success measures and operational plans Manage the process to connect the extended leadership team and directs – ensuring regular cadence of engagement and leveraging appropriate strategic assets across the team as it relates to the strategy process Plan and build content for internal communications, all-hands meetings, and operational reviews Create clarity around emerging areas so the team can prioritize and resource them Manage and coordinate high value, cross-functional initiatives, and projects, as well as the execution in support of special programs/projects across WWM, COO and Autodesk Financial Management Maintain and oversee team budgeting process, establishing a clear link between strategic goals and budget allocation/ROI Coordinate budget issues among and across the team to ensure actuals meet targets and liaising with the team’s finance business partner to ensure accuracy The Ideal candidate Minimum of 10+ years of experience of progressively expansive responsibilities, with experience in program and/or process management, corporate innovation, strategy development or the like Familiarity with Marketing practices, with knowledge of appropriate research, trends, and technology innovation – particularly those with relevance to software industries Persuasive leader with experience driving initiatives with demonstrable outcomes, engaging with executives, and supporting others to articulate a vision Deep analytical and problem-solving skills. Job Requisition ID # 22WD60340 Position Overview The Chief Trust Officer helps Autodesk fulfill its promises to customers and stakeholders on security, privacy, data ethics, and ESG matters by examining them through a trust-centric lens. The CTrO will transform our organization’s relationship by protecting data and customer choice as a business differentiator— for customers, employees, partners, and the public at large. Responsibilities Defines Autodesk long term trust objectives and practices such as data ethics and data reciprocity; advocates for trust-centric decisions at the executive level Develops outreach plans to influence customer perception and understanding of data usage, to help customers better understand how we will handle their data securely and ethically Communicates the benefits to the customer, including the value exchange that occurs when they do share their data Trust thought leader, ensures expertise in data, security & privacy laws and accreditation standards Develops privacy, security, ethics organizations within the company to build and deepen bonds with customers, employees, and partners, including organizations to: Build strategic and comprehensive plans to define, develop, maintain, and implement policies and processes that enable consistent, effective data security practices to minimize risk and ensure the confidentiality of information and product data Develop data and security breach preparation and response practices, to create alignment across Autodesk’s values, policies, and establishes plans for action well before any crisis may occur Establish governance for Data Trust, including ethics, security, privacy and resiliency programs Develop and deliver initial and ongoing training to the workforce, to foster information privacy and security awareness within the organization and related entities Establish and administer a process for investigating and acting on privacy and security complaints Works across the organization’s administration, legal counsel, and other related parties to represent the organization’s information privacy interests with external parties Serves as information trust resource to the organization regarding release of information and to all departments for trust related issues Minimum Qualifications BS degree in information management or a related security or engineering field 10+ years knowledge and experience in global information privacy laws, including extensive familiarity with security legislation and standards for the protection of data 10+ years demonstrated organizational leadership, facilitation, communication, and presentation skills Previous experience running a Privacy, Security or Data Governance organization A high level of integrity and trust At Autodesk, we're Job Requisition ID # 22WD62029 Position Overview Are you interested in supporting the design and delivery of compensation programs in a software design and services company that is truly shaping the world? As a Compensation Analyst, you will collaborate with and support internal Comp Partners and Leaders by creating the tools, analytics, and communication materials that reinforce our Compensation programs. We have two available Compensation Analyst positions: One will primarily focus on broad-based compensation and the other on executive compensation. Responsibilities Participate in compensation surveys to collect and analyze competitive salary information to ensure company's competitive position Apply sound compensation theory in the development of competitive salary structures based on relevant local salary surveys, competitive environment, economic trends, and local HR input to aid in recruiting and retention Provide coaching to Managers and HR staff on compensation matters Recommend corrective or alternative actions to resolve compensation-related issues. Counsel on the interpretation of various compensation programs on case by case basis Provide compensation related tools and training to HR Business Partners and Managers with the ultimate goal of self-sufficiency in leveling and pay decisions Work independently or as part of a cross-functional team to prepare analyses and recommendations Manage or participate in various administrative compensation functions, like job code setup and compensation tool configuration Support business aligned Compensation partners with analytics and insight, providing direct consultation to their clients where appropriate Minimum Qualifications 4-6 years of compensation analytics experience Strong Microsoft Excel skills and commitment to accuracy Strong project management and follow through Ability to manage multiple competing priorities At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD65489 Position Overview Are you interested in building the design and delivery of compensation programs in a software design and services company that is truly shaping the world? As a Compensation Business Partner, you will collaborate and support HR and Management in implementing compensation programs and analysis. You will have the opportunity to help deliver and influence key initiatives on our exciting roadmap of transforming compensation at Autodesk. Responsibilities Provide compensation consulting expertise to aligned business areas, advising on how best to optimize pay components Contribute to the design and delivery of base pay, annual incentives, equity and recognition programs Support the successful completion of the annual compensation cycle, which includes the delivery of promotions, base pay adjustments and incentives Support annual review of base pay and equity ranges, along with the creation and rollout of guidelines and delivery of compensation decision making tools and processes Provide guidance to HR and management on compensation decision making Analyze HR and business data related to key workforce issues Exercise judgment in selecting techniques and evaluation criteria in completing analysis and developing solutions/recommendations Assist in developing education and communication materials, working with internal or external resources Leverage our compensation benchmarking tool (MarketPay) and other resources to analyze the competitiveness of the company’s compensation against external labor markets where we compete for talent Apply sound compensation theory in the review and in suggesting compensation program improvements Ensure competitiveness of programs using local market surveys and develop ad hoc surveys as needed Contribute to the talent strategy to help drive achievement of business goals and to improve the employee experience Minimum Qualifications 7+ years experience providing compensation consulting/support to client groups within an organization Expert knowledge in market pricing, job leveling, and HR policy Ability to work in a team-oriented and fast-paced environment Ability to influence, problem solve, and successfully collaborate and communicate with stakeholders of various levels Excellent attention to detail, confidentiality, time management, organization, decision-making, and planning skills Expertise in costing analysis, statistical analysis, and modeling Expertise in Excel & PowerPoint Ability to prioritize and work on multiple projects simultaneously Preferred Qualifications Global compensation experience Workday experience At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD66045 Position Overview Do you want the opportunity to be part of a startup-like environment and have a big impact on a brand-new product? Are you looking to be at the forefront of innovative new technology that will ultimately help people imagine, design, and make a better world? If so, come join the Autodesk Tandem team! Our mission is to create Digital Twin technology and solutions that will transform how buildings are designed, built, and operated. We are seeking a Customer Adoption Specialist who has extensive experience with building automation systems and/or building management systems. To be successful in this role you need to be passionate about AEC-O and the transformation that Digital Twin technologies will bring to the industry. You are a relentless advocate for customer needs and have the desire to build product and technology awareness among customers, partners, and stakeholders.
