jobTitle: Customer Success Advisor, MidMarket - Product Design & Manufacturing
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD64086 Position Overview In the Customer Success organization, we relentlessly focus on earning customer loyalty. Our passion is delighting and retaining our customers. We do this by ensuring customers are successfully using their Autodesk software and deriving the maximum benefit from their Autodesk investment. The Customer Success Advisor (CSA) is an integral and impactful role in Autodesk’s Commercial Customer Success organization. In collaboration with our Mid-Market Sales Executives and Partners, the Customer Success Advisor will drive onboarding and adoption engagements with our customers. Autodesk depends on our team to drive customer adoption to earn customer loyalty, renewals, and future growth. The CSA mission is to create customer loyalty and growth through irresistible customer experiences. We do this by helping our customers achieve their desired outcomes and quantifying the resulting value. We strive to make our customers champions of our products. We build relationships with internal and external stakeholders and are advocates for our customers. Responsibilities Assist customers by providing guidance and resources directly to assist with onboarding new solutions and to identify and assist at-risk customers who have low adoption of products to increase the value they receive toward meeting their business goals Partner with sales teams, the reseller partner ecosystem, technical support, client services, and others to drive customer success motions Participate in Account Planning processes with Sales and Technical Sales teams, identifying targeted accounts to drive success planning activities, enagement strategies, and establish business outcome alignment Monitor customer usage data and other health indicators and translate into strategies for success, together with reseller partners and internal sales teams Co-Create Success Plans for select customers based on Business Outcome alignment, pre-sales implementation planning activities, and Account Planning processes Deliver operational and executive Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs) Engage comfortably throughout all levels and personas within customer organizations, including contract management, IT administration, end-users, user management, and customer leadership/decision-makers While engaging throughout the lifecycle, be able to identify opportunities for expanding the business relationship and support the sales team in pursuit of the expansion opportunity Respond to customer inquiries through e-mail, chat and/or phone (either direct or queue system). If unable to resolve customer inquiries, escalate to appropriate staff or management and respond back to partner/customer with solutions provided by escalations Educate customers/partners on resources available and promote the self-service tools Proficient in all technology platforms a partners/customer interacts with to access our products Working in Salesforce.com to document all activity and maintain customer data Generate and analyze regular and ad hoc reports for management, sales representatives and/or channel partners Is independent, accountable, and self-motivated to drive best-in-class onboarding and adoption engagements Applies Customer Success and Sales skills associated with our onboarding and adoption processes; strong verbal and written skills required Respond to customer and Partners inquiries in a professional and prompt manner Minimum Qualifications At least 4 years of work experience on a customer success, professional inside-sales, technical sales, or renewals team Previous experience or knowledge of Engineering, Product Design or Manufacturing industry Understanding of customer success principles, approaches and considerations Highly proficient computer skills including internet, email, MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. English language - verbal and written skills required The Ideal Candidate You have previous experience in software (SaaS) sales, renewals or customer success position You have previous experience or knowledge of the Product Design & Manufacturing industry Experience driving [software] user onboarding and/or adoption You are enthusiastic and creative with the ability to inspire, influence, and encourage others, in both relationships with partners and peers Have a collaborative and consultative work style and the ability to thrive in a highly dynamic work environment You are seeking a great company culture with career advancement opportunities You are goal-oriented and have previous success in a technology sales position You have the ability and experience to contribute thought leadership and best practices to our team Target Salary Range For This Role (Colorado): $90,000 - $100,000 Click below to learn more about our benefits in the US. https://benefits.autodesk.com/ At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. Job Requisition ID # 21WD53162 NOTE: This is NOT an open position. Please submit your CV here for future consideration. Position Overview Autodesk has fully reimagined the construction business for the digital age, enabling companies to address the most important challenges they face today while preparing for new ways of working in the future. The Autodesk Construction Solutions (ACS) portfolio connects the office, trailer and field so customers can move seamlessly through each phase of a building’s lifecycle — from design and preconstruction to construction, turnover and operations — with best-in-class solutions that include Assemble Systems, BIM 360, BuildingConnected and PlanGrid. General contractors, subcontractors, and owners around the world rely on ACS to win more work, enhance collaboration, speed decision-making, reduce risk, and improve overall project outcomes. We are looking for a passionate and dedicated individual to join our 4-time Stevie award-winning Customer Support Team! We are a team of amazing support specialists who not only provides front-line service to our users, but also works across multiple internal organizations in order to better provide for the entire customer experience. As a Customer Support Associate, you will support our users throughout their day-to-day operations with agility and zen-like calm. This is an incredibly exciting time at Autodesk and this role will give you the opportunity to be at the front line - you’ll be making a direct impact on our users’ experience every day. Responsibilities Support customers and internal users who use ACS in different platforms. Our channels of communication are live chat, email, and phone. Interactions include but are not limited to: troubleshooting technical issues, product usage questions, onboarding and set up, and subscription inquiries Perform extensive front line investigations into technical issues, and log cases with accurate information to provide a full record of each issue and resolution. Ensure every interaction is of the highest quality Manage requests and act as a liaison with internal stakeholders (Sales, Customer Success, Engineering, Operations, Marketing, Finance) Communicate daily with the Tier 2 Support team and leadership to report support issues, bugs, and important user concerns Take part in interesting and challenging support-related projects that will allow you to utilize your unique skill set and make an impact on our team Minimum Qualifications Passion for incredible customer service, exceptional communication (verbal and written) including top notch grammar and spelling, and excellent people skills. Are a master on breaking down complex concepts into day to day terminology to help customers of all technical proficiencies Attention to detail with an analytic and technical mindset that helps you meticulously troubleshoot and evaluate issues quickly, efficiently and accurately Resourceful and not afraid to tackle difficult cases on your own; driven to work hard with minimum supervision A ninja with your keyboard with fast and accurate typing and have unparalleled phone skills Master multi-tasker nailing the art of juggling multiple chats at once, while handling emails, and supporting your peers Empathic and composed. You really enjoy learning from and talking to our customers. You have amazing composure are very patient Understand the basic functionality of Apple iOS, Android, and Windows platforms as well as cloud-based software like Dropbox, Google Docs, Box, One Drive, etc. A team player, adaptable and have an amazing work ethic. You can identify where help is needed and are motivated to pitch in, coach, and train your peers Preferred Qualifications Previous experience in technical support Familiarity with Service Cloud, Zendesk and other CRM systems Experience with chat systems Familiarity with the construction industry Proficiency in a second language Salary Midpoint for this Position (Colorado): 54k-61k About Autodesk Construction Solutions Autodesk has fully reimagined the construction business for the digital age, enabling companies to address the most important challenges they face today while preparing for new ways of working in the future. The Autodesk Construction Solutions (ACS) portfolio connects the office, trailer and field so customers can move seamlessly through each phase of a building’s lifecycle — from design and preconstruction to construction, turnover and operations — with best-in-class solutions that include Assemble Systems, BIM 360, BuildingConnected and PlanGrid. General contractors, subcontractors, and owners around the world rely on ACS to win more work, enhance collaboration, speed decision-making, reduce risk, and improve overall project outcomes. #ACSCareers Click below to learn more about our benefits in the US. https://benefits.autodesk.com/ At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. It’s disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Job Requisition ID # 22WD61586 Autodesk is looking for a Data Architect that can design the models and system flows that define how data persists and moves between several enterprise systems and be a trusted advisor to solution architects and engineering teams. Keeping a keen eye on the bigger picture, you will define and maintain high-level conceptual models, logical models, and ensure proper implementaion across operational and analytical domains in collaboration with Product & Engineering Managers. You will influence the handling of data across end-to-end flows that traverse various processes and systems to ensure that it arrives fit for purpose and to serve its intended business use cases. Staying on top of the latest innovations around data principles like data mesh and tools that help orchestrate data pipelines must be a passion of yours. As part of a larger enterprise ecosystem, our engineering teams will look to you for guidance on how to build modern cloud-based, event driven data systems and common data services that scale to meet the needs of our business. You will be joining a team of architects who is tasked with taking Autodesk through a digital transformation that focuses on a taking existing and new business models to a new modern tech stack. The teams you will engage with are geographically dispersed, and value transparent, collaborative communication and cooperation. At times you will need to flex your schedule to accommodate global timezones. Responsibilities Build and maintain data models, conceptual & logical, in partnership with business and systems architects Collaborate with systems architects and engineering to design data integrations ensuring data accuracy & completeness Work closely with stakeholders and other architects to adequately understand requirements for collecting, storing and sharing data across the organization Influence architecture decisions and direction according to business drivers and application of modern technologies and methodologies Work with product managers to build requiremens and guide engineering teams to implement solution based on DataOps principles Engage with operational and analyitcal engineering teams to ensure proper translation of logical models into physical models Review integrations to ensure proper implementation of data contracts based on logical data models Guide data product managers to build proper analytical models for BI, M/L and personalization use cases Maintaining a vision and strategy for applying best practices from the industry to improve the quality of data and the way it is consumed Validate end-to-end data flows as data moves through enterprise systems Work closely with product management and eng teams to address any defects or gaps resultig in poor data quality Provide research and business analysis to assist business architects to realize upcoming initiatives Ensure non-functional requirements such as availability, scalability, reliability, security, compliance, governance are all in place. Basic Qualifications 10+ years' experience delivering software with a strong focus on data Experience working with a cross-section of data integrations (APIs, front-end, backend, security, data, service, persistence layers, automated testing, etc.) Familiar with various methods of Data Modeling, from conceptual to logical to physical Understanding of various data persistence formats, structured, unstructured, operational & analytical Domain knowledge of eCommerce, Data Warehousing, Financial, Account CRM, and Financial ERP systems would be a strong plus Operational/Analytical Master Data Management experience Preferred Qualifications Demonstrable experience as an architect for a large organization in major software domains Expertise in information and integration architecture and technologies such as API (REST/SOAP) and Pub/Sub architecture implementations at scale Experience with Hadoop (HBase, Casandra), AWS (RDS, Redshift, DynamoDB), SQL (SQL Server, PostgreSQL), Snowflake, and ingestion transform tools like Fivetran, DBT Experience serving as architect for applications on cloud infrastructure Strong leadership, problem solving, communication, and influencing skills Comfortable working both individually and as part of a highly collaborative team Experience with Compliance and Data governance (GDPR, SOX, etc.) Outstanding organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills (verbal/presentation/written) Ability to facilitate dynamic meetings and discussions Strong Business Acumen About Autodesk With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. It’s disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital artists, students and hobbyists. Job Requisition ID # 22WD61586 Autodesk is looking for a Data Architect that can design the models and system flows that define how data persists and moves between several enterprise systems and be a trusted advisor to solution architects and engineering teams. Keeping a keen eye on the bigger picture, you will define and maintain high-level conceptual models, logical models, and ensure proper implementaion across operational and analytical domains in collaboration with Product & Engineering Managers. You will influence the handling of data across end-to-end flows that traverse various processes and systems to ensure that it arrives fit for purpose and to serve its intended business use cases. Staying on top of the latest innovations around data principles like data mesh and tools that help orchestrate data pipelines must be a passion of yours. As part of a larger enterprise ecosystem, our engineering teams will look to you for guidance on how to build modern cloud-based, event driven data systems and common data services that scale to meet the needs of our business. You will be joining a team of architects who is tasked with taking Autodesk through a digital transformation that focuses on a taking existing and new business models to a new modern tech stack. The teams you will engage with are geographically dispersed, and value transparent, collaborative communication and cooperation. At times you will need to flex your schedule to accommodate global timezones. Responsibilities Build and maintain data models, conceptual & logical, in partnership with business and systems architects Collaborate with systems architects and engineering to design data integrations ensuring data accuracy & completeness Work closely with stakeholders and other architects to adequately understand requirements for collecting, storing and sharing data across the organization Influence architecture decisions and direction according to business drivers and application of modern technologies and methodologies Work with product managers to build requiremens and guide engineering teams to implement solution based on DataOps principles Engage with operational and analyitcal engineering teams to ensure proper translation of logical models into physical models Review integrations to ensure proper implementation of data contracts based on logical data models Guide data product managers to build proper analytical models for BI, M/L and personalization use cases Maintaining a vision and strategy for applying best practices from the industry to improve the quality of data and the way it is consumed Validate end-to-end data flows as data moves through enterprise systems Work closely with product management and eng teams to address any defects or gaps resultig in poor data quality Provide research and business analysis to assist business architects to realize upcoming initiatives Ensure non-functional requirements such as availability, scalability, reliability, security, compliance, governance are all in place. Basic Qualifications 10+ years' experience delivering software with a strong focus on data Experience working with a cross-section of data integrations (APIs, front-end, backend, security, data, service, persistence layers, automated testing, etc.) Familiar with various methods of Data Modeling, from conceptual to logical to physical Understanding of various data persistence formats, structured, unstructured, operational & analytical Domain knowledge of eCommerce, Data Warehousing, Financial, Account CRM, and Financial ERP systems would be a strong plus Operational/Analytical Master Data Management experience Preferred Qualifications Demonstrable experience as an architect for a large organization in major software domains Expertise in information and integration architecture and technologies such as API (REST/SOAP) and Pub/Sub architecture implementations at scale Experience with Hadoop (HBase, Casandra), AWS (RDS, Redshift, DynamoDB), SQL (SQL Server, PostgreSQL), Snowflake, and ingestion transform tools like Fivetran, DBT Experience serving as architect for applications on cloud infrastructure Strong leadership, problem solving, communication, and influencing skills Comfortable working both individually and as part of a highly collaborative team Experience with Compliance and Data governance (GDPR, SOX, etc.) Outstanding organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills (verbal/presentation/written) Ability to facilitate dynamic meetings and discussions Strong Business Acumen About Autodesk With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. jobTitle: Data Platform Product Specialist Sales Executive, PLM
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD65850 Position Overview Autodesk is seeking a dynamic, high-energy Sales Executive with sound business acumen, natural sales instincts and strong commercial and technical aptitude to shape and grow our North America Design & Manufacturing Data Platform business unit. This individual will play an integral role in helping to develop new Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) business opportunities and drive sales engagements across our North American sales organization. This is a “hunter” sales role and requires an individual who demonstrate success in leading cross-functional sales resources on enterprise sales engagements. Responsibilities Proactively engage target accounts and respective account teams with enterprise sales methodologies Conduct discovery activities & value assessments for Autodesk prospects & customers Create compelling executive level presentations articulating a clear understanding of opportunities for business improvement Collect and measure key industry metrics to establish trends and benchmarking Assistance in development of demonstration & presentation storyboards Participation in customer/prospect facing events supporting presentations and demonstrations Assistance in demand generation activities such as webinars, seminars, and roadshows Partner collaboratively with channel partners in order to understand their business, creatively adopt programs to drive new revenue, lead the co-selling process to Autodesk customers, and expand business partner relationships Reach out and provide regular customer feedback to the product, industry & strategic marketing teams to help identify product strengths and areas of improvement Develop and manage a 5 quarter rolling pipeline to meet or exceed assigned pipeline volume target Deliver an accurate weekly, monthly & quarterly forecast of business Negotiate deals and contracts at various levels within the targeted account, with primary focus/importance on “C” and enterprise-level negotiations Minimum Requirements 5-7+ years of experience Ability to concurrently manage multiple opportunities and/or projects Strong active listening skills Strong consultative sales process experience with the ability to lead people in discussions to uncover business problems, aligned customer initiatives and prioritize desired outcomes Exceptional communication and presentation skills to clarify and summarize complex issues for C-level executives and business leaders Strong background and understanding of how software solutions address customer business objectives Strong knowledge of Cloud enabled technologies, SaaS, AWS Solid understanding of the design & manufacturing product development process Strong knowledge of PLM solutions and PLM competitive landscape Ability to facilitate discovery and requirements gathering meetings among cross-functional teams Great storyteller and effortlessly adapt your communication style depending on the audience Solid understanding of the design & manufacturing product development process An innovative mindset that is attuned to a manufacturers process landscape Must understand how information, content, and documents flow across a manufacturing organization in the context of a business process 5+ years of experience of enterprise sales experience At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. jobTitle: Data Platform Product Specialist Sales Executive, PLM
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD65850 Position Overview Autodesk is seeking a dynamic, high-energy Sales Executive with sound business acumen, natural sales instincts and strong commercial and technical aptitude to shape and grow our North America Design & Manufacturing Data Platform business unit. This individual will play an integral role in helping to develop new Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) business opportunities and drive sales engagements across our North American sales organization. This is a “hunter” sales role and requires an individual who demonstrate success in leading cross-functional sales resources on enterprise sales engagements. Responsibilities Proactively engage target accounts and respective account teams with enterprise sales methodologies Conduct discovery activities & value assessments for Autodesk prospects & customers Create compelling executive level presentations articulating a clear understanding of opportunities for business improvement Collect and measure key industry metrics to establish trends and benchmarking Assistance in development of demonstration & presentation storyboards Participation in customer/prospect facing events supporting presentations and demonstrations Assistance in demand generation activities such as webinars, seminars, and roadshows Partner collaboratively with channel partners in order to understand their business, creatively adopt programs to drive new revenue, lead the co-selling process to Autodesk customers, and expand business partner relationships Reach out and provide regular customer feedback to the product, industry & strategic marketing teams to help identify product strengths and areas of improvement Develop and manage a 5 quarter rolling pipeline to meet or exceed assigned pipeline volume target Deliver an accurate weekly, monthly & quarterly forecast of business Negotiate deals and contracts at various levels within the targeted account, with primary focus/importance on “C” and enterprise-level negotiations Minimum Requirements 5-7+ years of experience Ability to concurrently manage multiple opportunities and/or projects Strong active listening skills Strong consultative sales process experience with the ability to lead people in discussions to uncover business problems, aligned customer initiatives and prioritize desired outcomes Exceptional communication and presentation skills to clarify and summarize complex issues for C-level executives and business leaders Strong background and understanding of how software solutions address customer business objectives Strong knowledge of Cloud enabled technologies, SaaS, AWS Solid understanding of the design & manufacturing product development process Strong knowledge of PLM solutions and PLM competitive landscape Ability to facilitate discovery and requirements gathering meetings among cross-functional teams Great storyteller and effortlessly adapt your communication style depending on the audience Solid understanding of the design & manufacturing product development process An innovative mindset that is attuned to a manufacturers process landscape Must understand how information, content, and documents flow across a manufacturing organization in the context of a business process 5+ years of experience of enterprise sales experience At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD65776 Position Overview Do you want the opportunity to be part of a startup-like environment within an industry leading company? Autodesk Tandem is pioneering the use of BIM data to establish a robust digital hub for building owners. The Tandem Platform will be the center of that digital hub and will support extensions and integrations with other systems. This role will work closely with developer partners and internal engineering teams to drive the creation of an ecosystem around the Tandem Platform. Job Requisition ID # 22WD61494 Go-To-Market Finance is seeking an extraordinary Marketing Finance Director to partner with our Worldwide Marketing (WWM) team and play a critical part in helping us continue to scale. The position reports to the Senior Director of WWM Finance and has frequent interactions with several members of the leadership team. The WWM organization mission is to build preference and drive demand for Autodesk through personalized marketing experiences that engage and inspire innovators, in their school years and throughout their careers. This role will be a key member of the Product Marketing leadership team as well as the WWM Finance leadership team and will help drive success for both organizations. The right candidate for this role will demonstrate a strategic mindset, collaboration skills, financial aptitude, excellent business intuition, and the capability to work at multiple levels, including high level strategy and day-to-day financial details. Location: San Francisco or remote Responsibilities Be the key financial advisor to the Product Marketing and their leadership team to aid in business decision-making and strategic planning Refine, develop, and update framework for performance insights including LTV, CAC, ROI Establish measurement framework for new growth initiatives Manage close, forecast, reporting models, and planning models for all marketing activities Build a high-performing team through hiring, mentoring, and development talent Use financial metrics to measure business goals and use data to tell compelling stories that will drive business decisions Drive continuous process improvements to achieve better results Help to enforce controls to fulfill fiduciary responsibilities, including required approvals Drive global finance initiatives involving broad cross functional teams. Be a part of the future of finance at Autodesk- help us realize our vision to be the best finance team in the industry! Minimum Qualifications Experienced leader and financial executive with 10+ years of broad, results–driven finance experience, ideally in a large public software company, with Marketing experience Energetic, forward thinking as well as creativity with the highest ethical standards Strong accounting and finance skills Strong record of accomplishments Focus on process improvement/automation Results orientation Strong people leader who manages with empathy, Passion for people development across the team Good communication skills with the ability to influence effectively MBA and/or CPA certification   At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Location: San Francisco or remote Responsibilities Be the key financial advisor to the Product Marketing and their leadership team to aid in business decision-making and strategic planning Refine, develop, and update framework for performance insights including LTV, CAC, ROI Establish measurement framework for new growth initiatives Manage close, forecast, reporting models, and planning models for all marketing activities Build a high-performing team through hiring, mentoring, and development talent Use financial metrics to measure business goals and use data to tell compelling stories that will drive business decisions Drive continuous process improvements to achieve better results Help to enforce controls to fulfill fiduciary responsibilities, including required approvals Drive global finance initiatives involving broad cross functional teams. Be a part of the future of finance at Autodesk- help us realize our vision to be the best finance team in the industry! Job Requisition ID # 22WD63575 The Director, M&A People and Places leads the People M&A strategy and team for People & Places and will Act as the Steward of the Acquired Employee Experience in support of the Company’s growth goals. They will lead the end-to-end People M&A processes, navigating the team through a fast-paced and rapidly changing work environment across multiple transactions while engaging with key governance bodies and cross-functional workstreams throughout the lifecycle of a deal – from deal concept through to integration completion. This individual will do so by partnering closely with Corporate Development, Business Leaders, People Business Partners, People and Places Functions and Cross Functional leads to navigate, understand, and integrate these transactions into (or out of) the business. They will represent all People and Places interests in the process, advocate for and design the Acquired Employee Experience. This is a highly visible position and a great opportunity to demonstrate leadership, gain exposure to all parts of the organization, represent the People & Places function, and get critical work done. Responsibilities Act as M&A People and Places (PPL) Partner and the single point of contact for PPL on end-to-end transaction process to identify, scope and manage people and culture matters related to transactions. Beginning with pre-close (deal) activities all the way through post-close integration. Develop and engage internal stakeholders effectively throughout deal lifecycle to enable the desired Employee Experience and drive clarity in support of the Acquired Employee Experience Engage with senior leaders across the business to influence & advocate for the Acquired Employee Experience, implementing final decisions on approaches to the integration. Act as Steward and Leader of practices and processes for managing client and stakeholder expectations integrating external trends and best practices where relevant. Maintain an active external network of relevant integration peers; providing advice and recommendations to PPL leadership Manage internal People and Places M&A team and external partners inclusive of ongoing performance management and resource allocation. Provide leadership on People and Places M&A initiatives and Act as Acquired Employee Advocate in relevant forums. Qualifications 8-10 Years work experience in HR with HR M&A/Deal experience preferred Preferred areas of HR experience include HR (People) M&A / Deals HR (People) Business Leadership Assessment and Development Global Employment Practices Change Management and Communications Tech industry experience a must Demonstrated global program/management capability BA/BS Required Collaborative Mindset with Strong Relationship Management Comfort with ambiguity and motivated to solve complex problems Excellent communication and presentation skills with a variety of audiences including senior leadership and global employee populations Ability to work independently AND with a team Demonstrated leadership experience with a human centered approach At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. jobTitle: Director, Named Accounts Technical Solutions, AMER
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD65816 Position Overview An exciting opportunity to lead the Americas Technical Solution Executives Organization supporting Autodesk’s Named Account (Enterprise) Sales serving customers in the AEC, Manufacturing and Media/Entertainment industries. The Technical Solutions team’s mission is to translate customer’s business challenges into technical solutions that deliver business outcomes for our customers through technical expansion selling. They do this by leading customer technical discovery, quantifying impact of technical solutions on customer’s software consumption (tokens) & customer whitespace analysis. The team also works on solution concept design which involves vision creation for customer’s technical solution, development of compelling technical solution concept designs & validation of technical solution and implementation plans. The team is responsible for building technical relationships with both internal and external stakeholders. This team is an integral part of the Named Accounts Sales organization and contributes not only to customer outcomes and Autodesk business results, but constantly innovates to improve how we serve our customers and our company better. The Director of AMER Technical Solutions leads this team of about 50 professionals to accomplish the mission outlined above. The role reports to the Vice President of Technical Solutions & Inside Sales for Named Accounts, and is a key member of that leadership team. Responsibilities Manage a team of Technical Solutions Executives (Technical Sales Engineers) in the United States and Canada Select, develop and build the capability of the team by recruiting team members, defining staff development areas and providing ongoing feedback, coaching, training, and development Evaluate performance and promote ongoing development of the front line managers, and ensure they are doing the same for the individual contributors Motivate and develop the team to achieve company goals and objectives, and accomplish the mission of driving customer outcomes and increased software consumption for Autodesk Continually evaluate organization structure and activities to ensure success through alignment with Sales and Customer Success teams; Outstanding collaboration is a key to success Keep Technical Solutions team operating expenses within budget Establish strong working relationships across Regions, Sales, Consulting, Customer Success, and other groups in an effort to gain insight and appropriately guide teams Direct the team to provide input to corporate product groups Provide guidance to product groups on new product enhancements and prioritization of new features; May be involved in supporting the launching new products Participate in forecast calls, account planning, and other management meetings either virtually or in person Develop and execute an annual business plan to support the Named Accounts Business plan Review and recommend sales quota alignment with sales compensation plan design in order to drive appropriate behavior Drive effective use of sales processes, tools and methodologies within the team Contribute regularly to the longer term strategy development of the larger Named Accounts organization with insights, suggestions, and ideas Minimum Qualifications 7+ years of Senior Management experience in Sales or Technical Sales Ability to lead through constant innovation and ability to be adaptable to changing business needs Demonstrated ability to operate at a Senior level to communicate strategies and influence through thought leadership Proven experience of leading a successful sales or technical sales team in a B2B environment offering complex business solutions Demonstrate a high degree of collaboration with all stakeholders both internal and external to the company The Ideal Candidate Adaptable - Guides their team to approach roadblocks as opportunities to approach work in new ways Innovative - Provides support for their team as they take calculated risks Impactful - Coaches their team on what is going well and what can be improved to increase their impact Inclusive - Encourages their team to teach, listen, and grow from each other Pragmatic - Empowers their team to identify work assignments that do not support key priorities Accountable - Holds themselves and their team accountable for executing their part of the company’s strategy Courageous – Not afraid to have hard conversations to drive better outcomes, but in a highly professional and respectful way At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? jobTitle: Director of Product Management, Asset Management
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD65927 We are seeking a Director of Product Management to join our Entertainment & Media Solutions (EMS) team and who'll focus on our Asset Management and the Media Information Model solutions. Our solutions provide users the ability to manage assets throughout the entire creative production process. This will be the first cloud product available on Autodesk Flow, the industry cloud for Media & Entertainment! This opportunity is for you if you're currently working on large scale & complex productions within Film, TV or Games industries and you possess hands-on experience and deep understanding of studio production pipeline processes. You also have working knowledge of how digital content creation tools, data flows, and related tooling all contribute to the final product. You are effective at representing the voice of our customers when devising and executing product strategies and roadmaps. Experience within a previous Product Manager role or similar is valuable but not required as training will be provided. As Director of Product Management in Autodesk's EMS group, you will be at the forefront of defining, designing, and building the next generation of solutions and services for film, tv, and game-based workflows. You will meet with customers and our partners regularly to inform and validate our product strategy and roadmap. You will also lead and partner closely with internal teams to execute against our product strategy, ensuring we are prioritizing the workflows that will deliver the most impact to our customers. Primary Responsibilities Leverage your film/tv/games production pipeline domain experience to define, champion and execute a holistic product vision for our Media Information Model and Asset Management Be the customer-facing leader to learn and document what our customers need and how we can make them successful via our Media Information Model and Asset Management Create and manage a product roadmap; clearly define and communicate priority workflows and enhancements and manage risks and dependencies Translate problem statements and customer needs into story maps that will inform development priorities and plans Work with a cross functional team made up of Product Owners, Scrum Masters, UX designers, developers and other key stakeholders to execute our product vision Provide learnings from continuous customer discovery and validation that supports iterative development Balance long-term vision and big picture thinking with guidance and support of work currently in flight Work with your cross functional team and executive leadership to set expectations and manage risks, dependencies, and tradeoffs Demonstrate collaborative leadership with leaders across multiple cross-product initiatives Maintain current film/tv/games industry and competitive knowledge and knowledge of emerging technologies and trends Engage customers and the industry through engagements such as customer councils, executive briefings, industry events, media support Minimum Qualifications At least 7-10 years of experience in Film/TV or Games production studio, working closely with various stakeholders such as technical directors, production managers and artists, etc. to drive projects from conception to delivery Has an intimate understanding and point of view on customer problems related to the production pipeline and can effectively define solutions Experience with USD in VFX, Animation, or Game pipelines, and be familiar with the concept of USD workflows Proven ability to lead cross functional teams on sizeable productions and/or projects Strong cross-team collaboration skills Ability to take and analyze data from lots of sources and made hard trade-offs Excellent verbal, written communication and presentation abilities both with internally with executives and externally with customers Able to take very complex ideas and convey them in a concise and impactful manner At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Nous sommes à la recherche d’un(e) directeur(trice) de la gestion des produits pour rejoindre notre équipe Solutions pour le secteur des médias et des divertissements (EMS) et qui se concentrera sur nos solutions de gestion des actifs et de modèle d’information sur les médias. Nos solutions offrent aux utilisateurs la possibilité de gérer les actifs tout au long du processus de production créative. Ce sera le premier produit en nuage disponible sur Autodesk Flow, la solution en nuage pour le secteur des médias et du divertissement! Ce poste vous convient si vous travaillez actuellement sur des productions complexes et à grande échelle dans les secteurs du cinéma, de la télévision ou des jeux et que vous possédez une expérience pratique et une compréhension approfondie des processus de pipeline de production en studio. Vous avez également une connaissance pratique de la façon dont les outils de création de contenu numérique, les flux de données et les outils connexes contribuent tous au produit final. Vous êtes efficace pour représenter la voix de nos clients lors de la conception et de l’exécution de stratégies et de feuilles de route pour les produits. Une expérience antérieure dans un poste de gestionnaire de produits ou un poste similaire est précieuse, mais n’est pas requise, car une formation sera fournie. En tant que directeur(rice) de la gestion des produits au sein du groupe EMS d’Autodesk, vous serez en première ligne pour définir, concevoir et construire la prochaine génération de solutions et de services pour les flux de travail basés sur les films, la télévision et les jeux. Vous rencontrerez régulièrement les clients et nos partenaires pour améliorer et valider notre stratégie et notre feuille de route en matière de produits. Vous dirigerez également les équipes internes et travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec elles pour mettre en œuvre notre stratégie de produits, en veillant à ce que nous donnions la priorité aux flux de travail qui auront une forte incidence sur nos clients. Principales responsabilités Tirer parti de votre expérience dans le domaine du pipeline de production de films, de séries télévisées et de jeux pour définir, défendre et mettre en œuvre une vision holistique des produits pour notre modèle d’information sur les médias et notre gestion des actifs Servir de point de contact avec les clients pour découvrir quels sont leurs besoins et les documenter, et apprendre comment nous pouvons les aider à réussir grâce à notre modèle d’information sur les médias et à la gestion des actifs Créer et gérer une feuille de route pour les produits; définir et communiquer clairement les flux de travail prioritaires et les améliorations et gérer les risques et les dépendances Traduire les énoncés de problèmes et les besoins des clients en cartes récits qui permettront de déterminer les priorités et les plans de développement Travailler avec une équipe interfonctionnelle composée de responsables de produits, de chefs de mêlée, de concepteurs(trices) d’expérience utilisateur, de développeurs(euses) et d’autres parties prenantes clés pour mettre en œuvre notre vision du produit Fournir des enseignements à partir de la découverte et de la validation continues des clients qui soutiennent le développement itératif Trouver un équilibre entre la vision à long terme et la vision d’ensemble d’une part, et l’orientation et le soutien du travail en cours d’autre part Travailler avec votre équipe interfonctionnelle et avec la haute direction pour définir les attentes et gérer les risques, les dépendances et les com

Vous dirigerez également les équipes internes et travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec elles pour mettre en œuvre notre stratégie de produits, en veillant à ce que nous donnions la priorité aux flux de travail qui auront une forte incidence sur nos clients. Principales responsabilités Tirer parti de votre expérience dans le domaine du pipeline de production de films, de séries télévisées et de jeux pour définir, défendre et mettre en œuvre une vision holistique des produits pour notre modèle d’information sur les médias et notre gestion des actifs Servir de point de contact avec les clients pour découvrir quels sont leurs besoins et les documenter, et apprendre comment nous pouvons les aider à réussir grâce à notre modèle d’information sur les médias et à la gestion des actifs Créer et gérer une feuille de route pour les produits; définir et communiquer clairement les flux de travail prioritaires et les améliorations et gérer les risques et les dépendances Traduire les énoncés de problèmes et les besoins des clients en cartes récits qui permettront de déterminer les priorités et les plans de développement Travailler avec une équipe interfonctionnelle composée de responsables de produits, de chefs de mêlée, de concepteurs(trices) d’expérience utilisateur, de développeurs(euses) et d’autres parties prenantes clés pour mettre en œuvre notre vision du produit Fournir des enseignements à partir de la découverte et de la validation continues des clients qui soutiennent le développement itératif Trouver un équilibre entre la vision à long terme et la vision d’ensemble d’une part, et l’orientation et le soutien du travail en cours d’autre part Travailler avec votre équipe interfonctionnelle et avec la haute direction pour définir les attentes et gérer les risques, les dépendances et les com

jobTitle: Director of Product Management, Asset Management
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD65927 We are seeking a Director of Product Management to join our Entertainment & Media Solutions (EMS) team and who'll focus on our Asset Management and the Media Information Model solutions. Our solutions provide users the ability to manage assets throughout the entire creative production process. This will be the first cloud product available on Autodesk Flow, the industry cloud for Media & Entertainment! This opportunity is for you if you're currently working on large scale & complex productions within Film, TV or Games industries and you possess hands-on experience and deep understanding of studio production pipeline processes. You also have working knowledge of how digital content creation tools, data flows, and related tooling all contribute to the final product. You are effective at representing the voice of our customers when devising and executing product strategies and roadmaps. Experience within a previous Product Manager role or similar is valuable but not required as training will be provided. As Director of Product Management in Autodesk's EMS group, you will be at the forefront of defining, designing, and building the next generation of solutions and services for film, tv, and game-based workflows. You will meet with customers and our partners regularly to inform and validate our product strategy and roadmap. You will also lead and partner closely with internal teams to execute against our product strategy, ensuring we are prioritizing the workflows that will deliver the most impact to our customers. Primary Responsibilities Leverage your film/tv/games production pipeline domain experience to define, champion and execute a holistic product vision for our Media Information Model and Asset Management Be the customer-facing leader to learn and document what our customers need and how we can make them successful via our Media Information Model and Asset Management Create and manage a product roadmap; clearly define and communicate priority workflows and enhancements and manage risks and dependencies Translate problem statements and customer needs into story maps that will inform development priorities and plans Work with a cross functional team made up of Product Owners, Scrum Masters, UX designers, developers and other key stakeholders to execute our product vision Provide learnings from continuous customer discovery and validation that supports iterative development Balance long-term vision and big picture thinking with guidance and support of work currently in flight Work with your cross functional team and executive leadership to set expectations and manage risks, dependencies, and tradeoffs Demonstrate collaborative leadership with leaders across multiple cross-product initiatives Maintain current film/tv/games industry and competitive knowledge and knowledge of emerging technologies and trends Engage customers and the industry through engagements such as customer councils, executive briefings, industry events, media support Minimum Qualifications At least 7-10 years of experience in Film/TV or Games production studio, working closely with various stakeholders such as technical directors, production managers and artists, etc. to drive projects from conception to delivery Has an intimate understanding and point of view on customer problems related to the production pipeline and can effectively define solutions Experience with USD in VFX, Animation, or Game pipelines, and be familiar with the concept of USD workflows Proven ability to lead cross functional teams on sizeable productions and/or projects Strong cross-team collaboration skills Ability to take and analyze data from lots of sources and made hard trade-offs Excellent verbal, written communication and presentation abilities both with internally with executives and externally with customers Able to take very complex ideas and convey them in a concise and impactful manner At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Nous sommes à la recherche d’un(e) directeur(trice) de la gestion des produits pour rejoindre notre équipe Solutions pour le secteur des médias et des divertissements (EMS) et qui se concentrera sur nos solutions de gestion des actifs et de modèle d’information sur les médias. Nos solutions offrent aux utilisateurs la possibilité de gérer les actifs tout au long du processus de production créative. Ce sera le premier produit en nuage disponible sur Autodesk Flow, la solution en nuage pour le secteur des médias et du divertissement! Ce poste vous convient si vous travaillez actuellement sur des productions complexes et à grande échelle dans les secteurs du cinéma, de la télévision ou des jeux et que vous possédez une expérience pratique et une compréhension approfondie des processus de pipeline de production en studio. Vous avez également une connaissance pratique de la façon dont les outils de création de contenu numérique, les flux de données et les outils connexes contribuent tous au produit final. Vous êtes efficace pour représenter la voix de nos clients lors de la conception et de l’exécution de stratégies et de feuilles de route pour les produits. Une expérience antérieure dans un poste de gestionnaire de produits ou un poste similaire est précieuse, mais n’est pas requise, car une formation sera fournie. En tant que directeur(rice) de la gestion des produits au sein du groupe EMS d’Autodesk, vous serez en première ligne pour définir, concevoir et construire la prochaine génération de solutions et de services pour les flux de travail basés sur les films, la télévision et les jeux. Vous rencontrerez régulièrement les clients et nos partenaires pour améliorer et valider notre stratégie et notre feuille de route en matière de produits. Vous dirigerez également les équipes internes et travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec elles pour mettre en œuvre notre stratégie de produits, en veillant à ce que nous donnions la priorité aux flux de travail qui auront une forte incidence sur nos clients. Principales responsabilités Tirer parti de votre expérience dans le domaine du pipeline de production de films, de séries télévisées et de jeux pour définir, défendre et mettre en œuvre une vision holistique des produits pour notre modèle d’information sur les médias et notre gestion des actifs Servir de point de contact avec les clients pour découvrir quels sont leurs besoins et les documenter, et apprendre comment nous pouvons les aider à réussir grâce à notre modèle d’information sur les médias et à la gestion des actifs Créer et gérer une feuille de route pour les produits; définir et communiquer clairement les flux de travail prioritaires et les améliorations et gérer les risques et les dépendances Traduire les énoncés de problèmes et les besoins des clients en cartes récits qui permettront de déterminer les priorités et les plans de développement Travailler avec une équipe interfonctionnelle composée de responsables de produits, de chefs de mêlée, de concepteurs(trices) d’expérience utilisateur, de développeurs(euses) et d’autres parties prenantes clés pour mettre en œuvre notre vision du produit Fournir des enseignements à partir de la découverte et de la validation continues des clients qui soutiennent le développement itératif Trouver un équilibre entre la vision à long terme et la vision d’ensemble d’une part, et l’orientation et le soutien du travail en cours d’autre part Travailler avec votre équipe interfonctionnelle et avec la haute direction pour définir les attentes et gérer les risques, les dépendances et les com

Job Requisition ID # 22WD65816 Position Overview An exciting opportunity to lead the Americas Technical Solution Executives Organization supporting Autodesk’s Named Account (Enterprise) Sales serving customers in the AEC, Manufacturing and Media/Entertainment industries. The Technical Solutions team’s mission is to translate customer’s business challenges into technical solutions that deliver business outcomes for our customers through technical expansion selling. They do this by leading customer technical discovery, quantifying impact of technical solutions on customer’s software consumption (tokens) & customer whitespace analysis. The team also works on solution concept design which involves vision creation for customer’s technical solution, development of compelling technical solution concept designs & validation of technical solution and implementation plans. The team is responsible for building technical relationships with both internal and external stakeholders. This team is an integral part of the Named Accounts Sales organization and contributes not only to customer outcomes and Autodesk business results, but constantly innovates to improve how we serve our customers and our company better. The Director of AMER Technical Solutions leads this team of about 50 professionals to accomplish the mission outlined above. The role reports to the Vice President of Technical Solutions & Inside Sales for Named Accounts, and is a key member of that leadership team. Responsibilities Manage a team of Technical Solutions Executives (Technical Sales Engineers) in the United States and Canada Select, develop and build the capability of the team by recruiting team members, defining staff development areas and providing ongoing feedback, coaching, training, and development Evaluate performance and promote ongoing development of the front line managers, and ensure they are doing the same for the individual contributors Motivate and develop the team to achieve company goals and objectives, and accomplish the mission of driving customer outcomes and increased software consumption for Autodesk Continually evaluate organization structure and activities to ensure success through alignment with Sales and Customer Success teams; Outstanding collaboration is a key to success Keep Technical Solutions team operating expenses within budget Establish strong working relationships across Regions, Sales, Consulting, Customer Success, and other groups in an effort to gain insight and appropriately guide teams Direct the team to provide input to corporate product groups Provide guidance to product groups on new product enhancements and prioritization of new features; May be involved in supporting the launching new products Participate in forecast calls, account planning, and other management meetings either virtually or in person Develop and execute an annual business plan to support the Named Accounts Business plan Review and recommend sales quota alignment with sales compensation plan design in order to drive appropriate behavior Drive effective use of sales processes, tools and methodologies within the team Contribute regularly to the longer term strategy development of the larger Named Accounts organization with insights, suggestions, and ideas Minimum Qualifications 7+ years of Senior Management experience in Sales or Technical Sales Ability to lead through constant innovation and ability to be adaptable to changing business needs Demonstrated ability to operate at a Senior level to communicate strategies and influence through thought leadership Proven experience of leading a successful sales or technical sales team in a B2B environment offering complex business solutions Demonstrate a high degree of collaboration with all stakeholders both internal and external to the company The Ideal Candidate Adaptable - Guides their team to approach roadblocks as opportunities to approach work in new ways Innovative - Provides support for their team as they take calculated risks Impactful - Coaches their team on what is going well and what can be improved to increase their impact Inclusive - Encourages their team to teach, listen, and grow from each other Pragmatic - Empowers their team to identify work assignments that do not support key priorities Accountable - Holds themselves and their team accountable for executing their part of the company’s strategy Courageous – Not afraid to have hard conversations to drive better outcomes, but in a highly professional and respectful way

Job Requisition ID # 22WD64406 Position Overview Do you love sitting at the intersection of data, technology, and people? Are you a big data expert and have experience building petabyte scale data lakes and data warehouses? Do you enjoy working within the AWS ecosystem and other cutting-edge technologies? Most importantly, do you challenge yourself to make it dead simple for people to derive insights from data, no matter the scale? Autodesk is seeking a Distinguished Architect to lead our big data platform efforts, design our next generation data lake, and help our employees easily leverage data analytics and machine learning to create better outcomes for our customers.  Staying on top of the latest innovations around data systems and flows must be a passion of yours. As part of a larger enterprise ecosystem, our engineering teams will look to you for guidance on how to build modern cloud-based data systems and services that scale to meet the needs of our business. Our team is versatile, polyglot, and cross-functional. We work in Python, AWS, Snowflake, SQL, C++, Presto, Spark, Kafka, flink and much more. The team is geographically dispersed, and values transparent, collaborative communication and cooperation.   This is a Director-level role within the Analytics Data leadership team and provides a unique opportunity to drive innovation and transformational change with our employees and how they create value from data. A successful candidate will not only have the technical expertise to craft a compelling big data strategy but will also possess the business acumen and gravitas to inspire people to bring that strategy to life.  Responsibilities  Ownership of platform and domain architecture for Analytics Data systems and related components of the Analytics Data Platform Consulting and collaborating with stakeholders and other architects to adequately understand requirements for software architecture and implementation Understand both internal and external customer requirements and render those as architectural models that will operate at large scale and high-performance Work with a global team of engineers to build data ingestion, data management, and data insight frameworks that emphasize a platform mentality and utilize AWS and other best of breed data offerings Engage with the rest of the Autodesk technical community to evangelize, defend and adapt how to best produce and consume big data as it aligns to the company’s continuing digital transformation Consciously monitoring implementation to ensure non-functional requirements such as availability, scalability, reliability, security, compliance, governance is all in place Passion for following and incorporating emerging trends in big data and technology Minimum Qualifications Highly technical systems thinker with 10+ years of big data platform experience (APIs, front-end, backend, security, data, service, persistence layers, automated testing, etc.) Excellent verbal and written communications skills are a must have, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations and virtual teams Strong leadership, problem solving, communication, and influencing skills Ability to understand complex business requirements and render them as prototype systems with quick turnaround time.  Strong experience in API and Pub/Sub architecture with hands on implementation experience at scale Strong experience with real-time streaming architecture and technologies like Kafka, Spark-streaming and Flink Experience serving as architect for applications on cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure) Experience building and operating big data query engines (such as Spark, Presto, Hive), databases (such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, Dynamo), and data warehouses (such as Snowflake, Redshift)  Deep knowledge of foundation infrastructure requirements such as Networking, Storage, and Hardware Optimization with Hands-on experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS)  Preferred Qualifications An advanced degree in computer science, MIS, engineering, or related discipline  Track record of implementing AWS services in a variety of environments, from startups to large enterprises Deep understanding of data ingestion patterns (for both event based and structural data) and understanding of related concepts (such as data cataloging and data lineage, etc.)  Demonstrated industry leadership in the fields of data warehousing, data science and data processing At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. jobTitle: Engineer Infrastructure, SRE Manager (Cloud Services) - Remote, West Coast
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD65697 Position Overview This role can be located in the West Coast/Remote. Autodesk's Development Enablement organization seeks a hands-on, experienced engineering manager to lead a team of intelligent and driven engineers responsible for building, maintaining, and supporting Autodesk's next-generation platform infrastructure. This successful manager will lead the infrastructure teams that manage cloud platform technologies, will have exceptional engineering leadership experience and proven hands-on background, a strong sense of ownership, and can drive projects through completion; they will be well-versed in modern automation frameworks that will be used to build supportive services used by our internal customer base. They will lead the infrastructure teams that manage cloud technologies, middleware, language runtimes, CI/CD build and deployment systems, core libraries, debugging and monitoring tools, etc. that support Autodesk engineering across the world. Responsibilities Lead, manage and mentor the Infrastructure / SRE team Provide insight, feedback, and recommendations to senior management Identify efficiency opportunities through automation and engineering Be responsible for the overall planning, execution, and success of technical projects Work with architects, product owners, and experience designers towards a shared vision and actively contribute to product roadmaps and business strategies Attract, hire, and continuously grow top engineering talent Collaborate with a geographically dispersed team and stakeholders Build and foster a high-performance culture Work with Autodesk's engineering teams to ensure applications and services are highly available and reliable Perform code reviews, evaluate implementations, and provide feedback for tool improvements Engage in technical and architectural discussions and decision-making Collaborate with stakeholders to understand requirements, understand use cases and build toward a cohesive technical strategy Automate processes where possible and propose new tools when needed Cross-train and mentor teammates Minimum Qualifications Hands-on experience with cloud technologies (AWS) Strong understanding of designing and developing large-scale, distributed microservices architecture and platforms 10+ years of relevant industry experience, 5+ years of hands-on technical leadership, and 5+ years of people management experience (a must) Experience working with remote teams and other cross-functional stakeholders Recent hands-on experience with in one or more languages - Python/Go. (a must) Experience with Scrum and agile development processes and methodologies Customer-facing and service-oriented person Understanding & curiosity of DevOps best practices, architectures, and methods 4+ years of experience with Docker and Kubernetes/ECS environments 4+ years of experience with configuration management tools and cloud automation (eg. TerraForm, Chef, Ansible, etc.) 4+ years of experience defining and building CI/CD processes and working with common CI/CD tools (Jenkins/Circle CI/Spinnaker, etc.) Good self-management skills and ability to track and prioritize multiple tasks coming in simultaneously Preferred Qualifications Experience building apps on AWS using services such as Step functions, DynamoDB, IAM, EC2, CloudWatch and Lambda Experience consuming, designing, and implementing REST APIs Good understanding of networking and security concepts Experience with monitoring and logging tools (NewRelic, Splunk, ELK) Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Job Requisition ID # 22WD64548 Position Overview Please note, this role can be located in the United States, remote or Canada (Toronto) We are seeking an Engineering Manager to join the Developer Relations team under the Developer Enablement Group. We are looking for both technical and people management skills in this role. For the technical side, we're looking for candidates with recent Python experience. This is a requirement. You will lead Global DevRel team focused on CI/CD, GitHub and Observability Run support. As the ideal candidate, you have deep understanding and hands-on experience of building modern CI/CD pipeline and Cloud deployment. You would also lead a Global Developer Relations team that builds relationships with and provide onboarding support to our growing product engineers. You have knowledge of modern engineering best practices and are in tune with industry trends. You are comfortable in an agile environment and know how to build highly effective teams. Most of all, you can inspire a team to do great things. Responsibilities Manage high performance, modern agile engineering teams Drive design and implementation of tools and applications for automated support system Regularly communicate and collaborate across various functions including engineers, architects, product owners, and product managers Proactively removes roadblocks to your team's progress and empower your team to be successful at releasing quality software, often, and with confidence Build and foster a high-performance culture, mentoring team members, and providing your team with the tools and motivation to make things happen Ensure internal development teams using our platform are supported through standard methodologies, documentation, and productivity tools Qualifications 1- 3 years managing teams of engineers with focus on CI/CD pipelines, Cloud deployment, DevOps with strong developer advocacy experience 2-3 years hands-on experience with Python (a must) You have built high performing engineering teams with diverse skillset, attracting good talent You have demonstrated experience in adapting and improving engineering best practices (e.g. test-driven development, continuous delivery, scrum practices, automation, Maintainable and testable code etc.) Excellent interpersonal skills; you can explain a complex technical issue in such a way that most people could understand BS or MS in Computer Science or related technical field At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD65700 Position Overview As Executive Assistant, you’ll provide administrative support by acting as a facilitator and liaison for the team. You will perform a wide range of tasks, and handle details of a confidential and critical nature while using your experience to proactively address potential problems and ensure an efficiently functioning team. Responsibilities Manages and maintains calendars managing conflicts and impacts Partner with team and Chief of Staff as needed to research and proactively prepare agendas and meeting materials, document meeting minutes, track action items, and communicate status Schedules, plans, and coordinates events and meetings onsite and offsite, including research and preparation of meeting materials Ensures meeting attendees have appropriate information including directions and maps May track action items and communicate status Maintain confidential material related to employees and company operations Partner with HR business partner to coordinate new hire processing and team onboarding Works closely with Corporate Travel to schedule and change itineraries Plan and coordinate virtual and in-person events and meetings on and offsite, including preparation of meeting materials, logistics, venue, activities, and food Develop and maintains positive working relationships with staff, internal departments, and outside parties, including high-level contacts of a sensitive nature to coordinate activities and collaborate on special projects effectively Collaborate flawlessly with other team admins to execute scheduling meetings and coordinate company-wide events Coordinates new hire processing May maintain email aliases, Slack channels, distribution lists, and shared directories, including maintaining permissions Manages information by organizing and tracking databases to synthesize and generate reports Tracks expenses and generates expense reports Drafts letters, memos, and emails Responsible for general office administration tasks such as filing, copying, collating/stapling, etc. May work with the Facilities department to coordinate space planning for division or business unit Creates presentations and maintains organization charts May be responsible for maintaining and updating websites, including building or redesigning pages Minimum Qualifications 3+ years’ experience providing administrative support Ability to work in a fast-paced work environment that requires strong multitasking skills, time management, and self-starter mentality Willing to adapt to rapidly changing environment and new processes and responsibilities Proven ability to work under pressure, communicate effectively, and meet deadlines Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, Mac and Windows operating systems, and related business applications such as Slack, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft SharePoint Excellent oral and written English communication skills Team player who is results-oriented with strong interpersonal skills Ability to travel to events or internal meetings, locally and internationally as needed The Ideal Candidate You have a lot of initiative and are a self-starter. You enjoy working on complex assignments with a team or by yourself to get things done Enjoy working with other people—You believe that a high functioning team is critical to success You enjoy reaching out and building productive working relationships with people across all levels and take a customer service orientation when supporting the team Successful multi-tasker—You know how to prioritize multiple projects and responsibilities at a single time and ensure things are done on time and within budget Extremely organized—You can maintain large amounts of information in an organized way Adaptable—You work well in fast-paced environments, you’re a quick learner, and always ready to lend a hand At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world.
