jobTitle: Executive Assistant to Chief Marketing Officer
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD64888 Position Overview At Autodesk, we are obsessed with building tools for people who imagine, design, and make a better world for the 10 billion people living on our planet. Our clients make the tallest buildings in the world, innovate on new green, affordable housing for low-income communities, put rockets into space, 3d print affordable prosthetic limbs, and bring stories and experiences to life that leap off the screen and inspire the world. Helping those teams do what they do better, faster and with less negative impact on the world is the mission that pulls us all out of bed every morning. We’re on the search for an experienced Senior Executive Assistant to support our Chief Marketing Officer. As Executive Assistant, you’ll provide administrative support to the Chief Marketing Officer, by acting as a facilitator and liaison for the team. You will perform a wide range of tasks, handle details of a confidential and critical nature, while using your experience to proactively address potential problems and ensure an efficiently functioning team. This role can be based anywhere in the U.S. Responsibilities Manages and maintains calendars managing conflicts and impacts Partner with team and Chief of Staff as needed to research and proactively prepare agendas and meeting materials, document meeting minutes, track action items, and communicate status Schedules, plans, and coordinates events and meetings onsite and offsite, including research and preparation of meeting materials Ensures meeting attendees have appropriate information including directions and maps May track action items and communicate status Maintain confidential material related to employees and company operations Partner with HR business partner to coordinate new hire processing and team on-boarding Works closely with Corporate Travel to schedule and change itineraries May research and obtain travel visas. In some cases, may travel with executive(s) Plan and coordinate virtual and in person events and meetings on and offsite, including preparation of meeting materials, logistics, venue, activities, and food Work with our Executive Comms Manager and Chief of Staff to plan out and execute All Hands Meetings, Manager Calls, and organization wide communications Develop and maintains positive working relationships with staff, internal departments, and outside parties, including high-level contacts of a sensitive nature to effectively coordinate activities and collaborate on special projects Collaborate flawlessly with other executive team admins to execute on scheduling meetings and coordinate company-wide events Coordinates new hire processing May track expenditures related to employee rewards programs or coordinate and compile feedback for performance reviews May maintain email aliases, Slack channels, distribution lists and shared directories, including maintaining permissions Manages information by organizing and tracking on databases to synthesize and generate reports Organize quarterly All Hands meeting in person and via zoom webinar Tracks executive expenses and generates expense reports Monitors purchasing software system notifications and approves on behalf of executive if appropriate Works with Accounts Payable to ensure department bills are paid in a timely manner May serve as point person for departmental purchases, including but not limited to PC tracking and overall asset management May manage budget and departmental costs, including reclassifications as necessary Drafts letters, memos, and emails Responsible for general office administration tasks such as filing, copying, collating/stapling, etc. May work with Facilities department to coordinate space planning for division or business unit Creates presentations and maintains organization charts May be responsible for maintaining and updating websites, including building or redesigning pages Minimum Qualifications 6+ years’ experience providing administrative support for senior level executive Ability to work in a fast-paced work environment that requires strong multitasking skills, time management, and self-starter mentality Willing to adapt to rapidly changing environment and new processes and responsibilities Proven ability to work under pressure, communicate effectively, and meet deadlines Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, Mac and Windows operating systems and related business applications such as Slack, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft SharePoint Excellent oral and written English communication skills Team player who is results-oriented with strong interpersonal skills Ability to travel to events or internal meetings, locally and internationally as needed The Ideal Candidate You have a lot of initiative and are a self-starter. You enjoy working on complex assignments with a team or by yourself to get things done You enjoy working with other people—You believe that a high functioning team is critical to success You enjoy reaching out and building productive working relationships with people across all levels and take a customer service orientation when supporting the team You are a successful multi-tasker—You know how to prioritize multiple projects and responsibilities at a single time and ensure things are done on time and within budget You are extremely organized—You can maintain large amounts of information in an organized way You are adaptable—You work well in fast-paced environments, you’re a quick learner, and always ready to lend a hand At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD65367 Position Overview We are looking for an experienced executive communications professional to join our team. The right person will bring strategic thinking, communications expertise, intellectual curiosity, energy and creativity to help our new chief marketing officer (CMO) find and authentically tell stories about Autodesk to customers, external influencers and employees through compelling speeches, presentations, meetings and written communications. Our ideal candidate should have experience working with marketing organizations or for a global technology company. Responsibilities Think strategically to develop and execute an annual executive communications plan for our CMO in collaboration with other teams including employee communications, public relations, and social media Develop an internal communications strategy and create content to help inform the Worldwide Marketing (WWM) team, run by our CMO, and drive the message of the organization across the company Work directly with our CMO, their chief of staff and key subject matter experts to develop the narrative arcs for and create presentations and talks to be given to customers, shareholders, employees, and influencers. Develop ways to reuse this content by other leaders within WWM and in other parts of the company Deeply embed in the organization and participate in meetings as requested with CMO and WWM leadership, helping shape strategy, providing a point of view on what and how should be communicated, and debating that POV with direct staff Support the CMO’s robust social media program by creating or editing social media posts; suggesting shares and existing content related to Autodesk’s business; and proposing new ways to engage on Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn and other platforms Work across the executive communications team, employee communications, the WWM group, and with partners across the company on communications projects as needed in the best interests of the company and its employees Support teammates on high-priority communications projects related to other members of C-staff as necessary Minimum Qualifications 8+ years of experience in executive communications, public relations, and/or employee communications Exceptional PowerPoint and/or Keynote skills; knowledge of Photoshop, HTML and SharePoint a plus Four-year college degree (BS or BA), preferably in English, communications or journalism; or equivalent work experience and excellent writing and communications skills Creative thinking, and the ability to brainstorm new communications strategies and approaches with the CMO Identify new opportunities and execute against them to help the CMO further the Autodesk brand Understanding of Autodesk’s business, experience with cloud software companies, or familiarity with the industries Autodesk serves Excellent writer, with the skills to distill complex content into clear, concise, and engaging communications, and able to write with speed and accuracy Strategic and creative thinker comfortable debating and defending their ideas Strong storyteller with the ability to create compelling narratives in support of our business strategies Preferred Qualifications Experience developing and executing communications strategies, plans, programs and events Strong presence and confidence which will help build high credibility with senior executives Ability to influence without authority, across functions, geographies and levels, and the ability to work with various departments and teams to drive alignment and collaboration Ability to be flexible, proactive, work under deadlines, and ensure quality and accuracy Focused and performance-driven Strong attention to detail and project management skills Occasional travel required At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Job Requisition ID # 22WD64429 Position Overview We are seeking a curious and motived Finance Business Partner / Finance Manager with experience in both topline reporting and spend. In this individual contributor role, you’ll report to the Sr Director, FP&A Product Development and Manufacturing Solutions (PDMS). You will partner closely with incubation leaders including Fusion sales leadership and the general manager of Extended Reality to meet their strategic financial objectives. What is incubation? It is a CEO-led board of cross-functional leaders, empowered to invest in adjacent products/personas. Each project is led by a GM who has business decision autonomy and presents quarterly progress to the board. Responsibilities You will provide financial advice and analyses to the general manager of Extended Reality You will forecast all components of top-line and spend for the business unit (e.g. billings, revenue, headcount, OPEX, and COGS) and prepare variance analyses You will also own the 5-year topline long-range plan Manage and coordinate end-to-end quarterly sales commission cycle from target setting through payout in partnership with Fusion sales leadership Create KPIs to measure sales efficiency and effectiveness in driving business growth, while ensuring it doesn’t cost too much to meet our targets Extended Reality is the result of an acquisition and internal investment. As the partner to the acquisition, you are the steward of unintegrated financials and will support ongoing integration needs as they arise Every role has its core responsibilities and the opportunity for more when ready. For example, you could support ad-hoc projects requiring cross-company collaboration to achieve the desired outcomes or you might join the FP&A employee engagement team Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree required; MBA or CPA a plus Minimum 6 years of related finance experience Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel (including financial modeling) and PowerPoint Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills Experience using planning and reporting software (e.g. Anaplan, Qlikview, SAP, PowerBI) is a plus The Ideal Candidate Fast learner. Effective at prioritizing and adjusting expectations Pragmatic Strong critical thinker. Solid business acumen Builds trust Excellent communication skills Collaborative Growth mindset Adaptable to change You work well with others You know how to build relationships with individuals who are peers as well as those who are senior and junior to you You build trust with your team and the team you support, encouraging diverse perspectives You know when to have hard conversations – without ego to drive better outcomes You have outstanding analytical and system skills You are a pro working in excel and building excel models You know how to navigate through the company’s systems and network of people to get the data and information you need You know how to model and interpret large volumes of complex data to identify trends and insights You’re comfortable with ambiguity. Supporting incubation projects is exciting, but also often uncharted. While we can leverage existing processes and what’s worked in other parts of Autodesk, many of these products and solutions are being started from zero, which means we are defining the future At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Job Requisition ID # 22WD65942 Finance Manager - Go To Market Finance, Planning Position Overview Our Go-To-Market (GTM) Finance, Financial Planning & Performance Management Team is seeking an enthusiastic and self-motivated professional to support Autodesk’s annual topline planning cycle and deliver insightful performance analysis feeding QBRs and other business review processes. This is an exciting role with significant impact on our ability to drive top line performance and sustain our growth trajectory. The right candidate will demonstrate a strong aptitude for financial planning, outstanding analytical and communication skills, and strong business acumen. They will be able to architect highly visible financial analysis and modeling, draw insights, and articulate impact from various business factors to inform key stakeholders (both internal and external). They must be comfortable in engaging with a broad range of cross-functional teams and establish great partnership in a collaborative environment. Detail-oriented, but also able to think strategically, the candidate must possess strong critical thinking skills and good judgment to produce high quality work within tight deadlines. Responsibilities Support our annual business planning process, including consolidation and review of field revenue plan submissions, centralized financial modelling, and design and support of business & strategic planning review presentations. Proactively support key stakeholders within GTM Finance and collaborate and manage relationships across the broader Finance organization. Provide central topline support to the quarterly business review (QBR) process including CFO presentation and other presentations for GTM & Finance leadership meetings. Co-own and drive continuous development, testing, and implementation of planning tools to support planning and business needs. Lead ad hoc strategic analysis, leveraging raw data pulls and inputs from other teams, to generate insights for executives’ consumption. Support and empower a small but mighty core planning team as needed. Qualifications Bachelor in Math, Computer Science, Finance or Accounting preferred; MBA/CFA a plus 8+ years of related experience, preferably a combination of investment banking and/or private equity and corporate FP&A Experience supporting topline FP&A processes, preferably for complex subscription-based companies Strong familiarity with key accounting principles impacting revenue recognition for software companies Experience with or strong willingness to learn FP&A systems and tools such as Anaplan Ability to synthesize detailed analysis into strategic insights to support deeper understanding of business performance Team player with strong sense of ownership, problem solving and project management skills Strong presentation and communication skills and preference for fast-paced environments Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD65938 Position Overview Enterprise Identity Services has an opening for a Software Engineer to work cross-functionally with different Identity domain areas namely Identity and Access Management (IAM), Single Sign-On (SSO), Multi-factor authentication (MFA) and Directory services to drive progress towards goals. As an Identity Engineer you will be instrumental in designing and developing various Identity solutions for initiatives like Employee Experience and Security. For example, this team is executing on a strategic initiative to improve Employee experience, with better access and improved functionality to our core back-office services. As part of this initiative, we are investing in development efforts specifically focused on making it easier for Autodeskers to access key resources through a modern identity management framework. As a part of this effort, Autodesk is seeking an energetic and motivated engineer to join our team and collaborate on designing and implementing new and innovative web-based solutions, ideally with a specialty in identity management systems. These tools and automations will be integrated into our core back-office services, assisting our internal divisions in product development, sales, and other key initiatives. Our engineering culture will empower you to make effective decisions, work collaboratively, and take accountability for engineering projects at the core of the company. Hybrid Schedule / Remote Work Allowed Responsibilities Design Identity solutions to successfully deliver on critical projects and initiatives using SailPoint Identity Management product and Microsoft Azure Collaborate with team members, business stakeholders, and end users to provide a delightful and secure employee experience to our workers Work on complex challenges at large scale by utilizing your skills in software and data analysis to deliver new solutions providing user identity and analytics Design, develop, re-factor, optimize, and enhance solutions that enable key business functions Work with adjacent teams to integrate new services with other platform web services providing user identity and analytics Optimize and support our existing public cloud solutions and workloads Work with user experience designers and subject matter experts to design solutions with the end-user in mind Learn new Identity and Access Management technologies to implement innovative solutions for Autodesk’s workforce Minimum Qualifications Deals well with ambiguous or undefined problems; ability to think abstractly and guide others Comfortable performing requirements analysis, interfacing with stakeholders of various levels and documenting solutions Ability to articulate technical topics to non-technical audiences both in writing, in diagrams and person Energetic team player who works well across boundaries and readily adapts to change and enjoys rapid development Committed to deliver on time according to requirements and business needs Has a can-do attitude about providing solutions even when situations are uncertain Takes learning seriously and is always willing to grow through work experiences and trainings Willing to jump in to assist teammates to ensure deadlines get met Proactively reaches out for help when needed to make sure their work stays on track Focused on providing quality solutions to better people’s work experience rather than delivering “engineering perfection” Passion for analyzing data and using the insights it gives you to propose ideal solutions Enjoys actively participating in design and troubleshooting discussions Preferred Qualifications Identity and Access Management domain knowledge Familiarity with Identity Management tools, preferably in SailPoint IdentityNow/IIQ Familiarity with SSO (Single-Sign-On)/Azure, Two-step verification, Directory Services (Active Directory and Azure AD) Experience deploying applications on Amazon Web Services or similar cloud computing platforms Customer success, customer support, or customer training related to technology Experience with Agile methodology and Scrum framework Experience working with overseas counterparts to direct their efforts in follow-through development activities Bachelor's or Master’s degree, preferably in technology related field or equivalent work experience At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. Job Requisition ID # 22WD65864 Position Overview Autodesk is undertaking a multi-year Future of Finance project. This includes the consolidation of tax engines, updating of ERP systems and automation of manual, traditional finance processes. Automation will enable Finance to be more efficient and productive. Teams can shift from unfulfilling, manual transactional work, enabling them to focus more time on analysis and insights. We are identifying the work of the future that leverages increased automation, utilization of AI, and proactive and predictive insights. On top of the benefits to the Finance & Tax functions of Autodesk, the results for our teams are transferrable skills, employee satisfaction, and fulfilled careers. We have a role for an Indirect Tax Technology Specialist to join our team. This position will report to our Indirect Tax Senior Manager based in Dublin and will be embedded virtually with our global team. We are seeking a candidate who will help drive a culture of accountability and excitement within the tax team, who enjoys coming to work, has a growth mindset and enjoys learning new technologies. The Indirect Tax Technology Specialist will help steer the strategy and course of our Indirect Tax technology function to ensure we establish efficient and effective end-to-end management of tax compliance and reporting processes across Autodesk. Responsibilities Ensuring Autodesk is well prepared for the ‘digitization’ of tax management Review changing legislation and regularly provide updates to the wider tax department and other key stakeholders and changes in relation to Digital Tax rules, e-Invoicing, Digital reporting, VAT regulation changes and other areas of interest for the indirect tax team Responsible for the design, build and deployment of low-code & no-code technology solutions e.g., RPA, Alteryx or SAP related automations Develop your knowledge of US Indirect Tax laws that apply to the business and keep up to date with changes Contribute to the North American compliance process, working closely with existing team members with responsibility for Sales Tax, Business License, Property Tax and Canadian indirect taxes Continually supply new ideas and challenge assumptions around what is possible to ensure that we set and achieve stretching targets Define process performance metrics and to ensure these are delivered across end-to-end process Minimum Qualifications A minimum of 2 years of experience automating tax accounting processes 2 – 4 years’ experience in indirect tax, project management, and ERP / tax / billing implementation projects Professional qualification – CTA required and accounting preferred Strong project management skills with experience of meeting deadlines and prioritization Strong analytical skills and problem-solving ability Experience training management and staff on new systems A broad range of tax process and control experience across a wide range of territories At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? jobTitle: Industry Strategy Manager, Digital Project Delivery (Remote)
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD65858 Position Overview The Industry Strategy Manager of Digital Project Delivery will play a critical role in supporting a team that defines the strategy and go-to-market growth strategies for Autodesk’s design project collaboration and coordination solutions. You will contribute to a team that defines and executes on the industry strategy, including market opportunity analysis, customer value propositions, competitive analysis, partnerships, target personas, and business models. You will work with cross-functional teams, including Autodesk’s Building and Infrastructure Development teams as well as Autodesk’s Construction Solutions division. You must possess deep knowledge in BIM, have delivered digital projects across multiple disciplines, and have experience in implementing an ISO 19650 process. This includes managing Common Data Environments (CDE), design collaboration, project information management, industry data standards and project team management. You will need to be an effective communicator who thinks strategically, writes concisely, speaks easily to small and large audiences and is a coalition builder. You must have the appropriate skills to work across a matrixed-organization and can effectively use data to drive effective business decisions. Autodesk is in a period of exciting and dynamic change as we continue to expand market share through various business growth initiatives and our transition to cloud. The successful candidate will have input into the shape, direction, and growth of the organization as we transition through this change and plan for the future. Responsibilities Strategy and Business Development Contribute to the digital project delivery vision and strategy for Autodesk Work with the strategy team to create business cases to drive sales channels, partnerships, and mergers & acquisitions Conduct internal and external research, market, competitors, and customer personas Work with product development to clearly communicate key customer value propositions and workflow requirements Represent Autodesk within industry organizations and at industry events Business Execution Monitor business performance; profit & loss, document and report on subscribers, billings, adoption, customer acquisition and retention Develop corrective action plans when appropriate Work with the strategy team to continually evaluate and adjust strategic go-to-market plans to meet evolving business and market requirements Work with sales to develop and achieve success with early adopter customers, and strategic and reference accounts Sales Enablement Partner with sales enablement organization to define and develop appropriate sales plays and tools Support marketing execution to create marketing and training content Work with sales teams to ensure adoption of sales plays to ensure effectiveness Collaborative Relationships Maintain close customer relationships to effectively represent the voice of the customer with respect to offer price, package, position, and business models Build strong internal partnerships with Product Management, Product Line Group Leaders, and Sales/Channel teams Work with PR as critical point of contact in the industry, including industry specialists, research analysts, key press, and other third parties Minimum Qualifications BS or equivalent degree in Architecture, Engineering, or related field 8+ years of experience working within the AEC industry Experience in industry working on project information management systems Knowledge in ISO 19650 (formerly PAS 1192) Experience with cloud-based design and collaboration tools targeting architects, engineers, contractors, and owners Ability to travel up to 25% Preferred Qualifications MBA Knowledge of cloud and SaaS technology and business landscape Strong business fundamentals and a background in solving complex customer problems Exceptional customer/market research, analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving skills Skilled diplomat with executive presence, high level of confidence and maturity with solid experience working across large corporations Proven ability to influence within a geographically dispersed global organization to build consensus Demonstrated success using critical thinking to formulate strategic direction and success at skillful negotiation and strategy implementation Substantial experience in a business role with global scope, with an understanding of the nuances in sales and marketing to different cultures Well-rounded business professional with technical acumen and a passion for creating, mining, sharing, and using sound, solid and accurate customer data; financial acumen and a track record of continual enhancements to metrics (via analysis, reporting, management within budget and ROI calculations) Excellent interpersonal skills required to build strong relationships, and an ability to be highly successful in a matrix management organization At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It’s disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital artists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD65858 Position Overview The Industry Strategy Manager of Digital Project Delivery will play a critical role in supporting a team that defines the strategy and go-to-market growth strategies for Autodesk’s design project collaboration and coordination solutions. You will contribute to a team that defines and executes on the industry strategy, including market opportunity analysis, customer value propositions, competitive analysis, partnerships, target personas, and business models. You will work with cross-functional teams, including Autodesk’s Building and Infrastructure Development teams as well as Autodesk’s Construction Solutions division. You must possess deep knowledge in BIM, have delivered digital projects across multiple disciplines, and have experience in implementing an ISO 19650 process. This includes managing Common Data Environments (CDE), design collaboration, project information management, industry data standards and project team management. You will need to be an effective communicator who thinks strategically, writes concisely, speaks easily to small and large audiences and is a coalition builder. You must have the appropriate skills to work across a matrixed-organization and can effectively use data to drive effective business decisions. Autodesk is in a period of exciting and dynamic change as we continue to expand market share through various business growth initiatives and our transition to cloud. The successful candidate will have input into the shape, direction, and growth of the organization as we transition through this change and plan for the future. Responsibilities Strategy and Business Development Contribute to the digital project delivery vision and strategy for Autodesk Work with the strategy team to create business cases to drive sales channels, partnerships, and mergers & acquisitions Conduct internal and external research, market, competitors, and customer personas Work with product development to clearly communicate key customer value propositions and workflow requirements Represent Autodesk within industry organizations and at industry events Business Execution Monitor business performance; profit & loss, document and report on subscribers, billings, adoption, customer acquisition and retention Develop corrective action plans when appropriate Work with the strategy team to continually evaluate and adjust strategic go-to-market plans to meet evolving business and market requirements Work with sales to develop and achieve success with early adopter customers, and strategic and reference accounts Sales Enablement Partner with sales enablement organization to define and develop appropriate sales plays and tools Support marketing execution to create marketing and training content Work with sales teams to ensure adoption of sales plays to ensure effectiveness Collaborative Relationships Maintain close customer relationships to effectively represent the voice of the customer with respect to offer price, package, position, and business models Build strong internal partnerships with Product Management, Product Line Group Leaders, and Sales/Channel teams Work with PR as critical point of contact in the industry, including industry specialists, research analysts, key press, and other third parties Minimum Qualifications BS or equivalent degree in Architecture, Engineering, or related field 8+ years of experience working within the AEC industry Experience in industry working on project information management systems Knowledge in ISO 19650 (formerly PAS 1192) Experience with cloud-based design and collaboration tools targeting architects, engineers, contractors, and owners Ability to travel up to 25% Preferred Qualifications MBA Knowledge of cloud and SaaS technology and business landscape Strong business fundamentals and a background in solving complex customer problems Exceptional customer/market research, analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving skills Skilled diplomat with executive presence, high level of confidence and maturity with solid experience working across large corporations Proven ability to influence within a geographically dispersed global organization to build consensus Demonstrated success using critical thinking to formulate strategic direction and success at skillful negotiation and strategy implementation Substantial experience in a business role with global scope, with an understanding of the nuances in sales and marketing to different cultures Well-rounded business professional with technical acumen and a passion for creating, mining, sharing, and using sound, solid and accurate customer data; financial acumen and a track record of continual enhancements to metrics (via analysis, reporting, management within budget and ROI calculations) Excellent interpersonal skills required to build strong relationships, and an ability to be highly successful in a matrix management organization At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It’s disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital artists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.

jobTitle: Information Architect, West Coast Hybrid/Remote or 100% Remote
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD65853 Position Overview Autodesk is on a journey to re-architect its Architecture, Engineering, and Construction (AEC) Design tools for the cloud. Working directly for the AEC Design VP of Software Architecture, you can help us make this journey a success. You'll learn about our industry and our existing software landscape, and then organize that information so we get the most out of it. And you'll help your software architecture colleagues define their vision, and then share that with the rest of the company. This is a job for someone who enjoys the rigor of a good definition and clear taxonomy, who enjoys the scale of a multi-year, globe-spanning effort, and loves to see the customer impact of their work. When applying, please include your portfolio or work samples including passwords as needed. Responsibilities Develop a strategy and information architecture for the software architecture function within the AEC Design organization Learn Autodesk's AEC product line, new technologies, and the AEC industry to inform your work Research existing information sources to assess available materials and identify gaps therein Working with your colleagues, create new documentation where gaps in existing materials exist Develop templates, process, and methods to scale your efforts via the participation of others Assist with the cadence, writing, and publication for VP of Software Architecture internal communications Participate in honest and respectful debate on priorities, strategies, and tactics related to your work Maintain and administer Confluence and SharePoint sites Use analytics to develop insights on the adoption and use of materials developed Minimum Qualifications A minimum of three years of experience as an Information Architect, or equivalent work A proven ability to learn and write about programming, APIs, SDKs, machine learning, cloud computing, graphics, or similar technologies An ability and desire to get things done without the need for external deadlines or daily oversight Preferred Qualifications A degree in Information Science, or equivalent field Basic data handling skills, sufficient to work with data on the consumption of documents, blog posts, and the like Experience with Confluence, Word, SharePoint, GitHub At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. Job Requisition ID # 22WD64378 Position Overview We are seeking a talented and motivated individual who will strategize and support opportunities to further mature Autodesk’s security posture on the vulnerability management team. The ideal candidate will thrive on partnering with Product and Services teams to develop and implement secure solutions that will ensure customer trust. The Vulnerability Management Infrastructure Security Engineer will partner with teams across Autodesk to achieve the security needs of our traditional and cloud environments. This role will allow you to develop, advise and implement technical and process solutions to mitigate risk to our environment. Responsibilities Partner with stakeholders and your team to develop capability roadmaps, identify and deliver key results to achieve roadmap milestones Identify and lead new projects and initiatives that make it seamless for developers to onboard and better utilize our security solutions Leverage data to monitor capability execution to identify opportunities for improvement and to mitigate risk Partner and collaborate with internal stakeholders on assisting with their overall security posture Work across product and business systems teams to enhance and evangelize security in infrastructure and drive changes needed to respond to emerging threats Research emerging technologies and maintain awareness of current security risks in support of security enhancement and development efforts Review outstanding vulnerabilities with product teams and assist in remediation efforts to reduce risk Minimum Qualifications BS in Computer Science, Information Security, or equivalent professional experience Experience working with technologies hosted via cloud computing environments (e.g., Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform) Understanding of various security tools such as InsightVM, Nessus, and Qualys Ability to build on forming strong relationships and being a team player Proven ability to communicate technical issues to technical and non-technical audience Knowledge of project management and data visualization solutions such as JIRA, Wiki, Confluence, PowerBI, Tableau Demonstrate courage, inclusiveness, and pragmatism Preferred Qualifications Familiarity with multiple security domains, such as application security, asset security, network security, incident response, and/or regulatory compliance and certifications Penetration testing experience and understanding of remediation techniques for common misconfigurations and vulnerabilities The Ideal Candidate You are a perpetual learner and often find yourself ideating about new and improved ways of doing things and are confident to share your ideas with the rest of the security team As a team player and effective communicator, you establish collaborative relationships with technical and non-technical colleagues You enjoy working with distributed team members At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD61854 Position Overview Flexibility work from home options available*. Autodesk is one of the most influential tech companies in the world. No matter who you are, it is highly likely you encounter something made using our software every day. High performance vehicles, smartphones, skyscrapers and even video games have benefited from using Autodesk’s software. With continuous growth, now is a great time to join our teams! Our early-career sales positions focus on advancement opportunities for candidates seeking to grow into their sales career and become business leaders within a fast-growing technology company. Our sales teams help Autodesk meet its goals for growth, while also building the foundational skills for sales roles in the future. You will gain valuable hands-on experience in one of the most impactful areas of a tech company: sales! Responsibilities Gain knowledge of Autodesk products, our competitor’s products, and industry trends Utilize Salesforce.com, Outreach, LinkedIn, and other resources to help you be successful Work directly with potential customers to better understand their business needs and find ways to solve their problems with Autodesk’s software as a solution Collaborate with teammates and sales leadership on strategic projects as needed Transition qualified opportunities to the appropriate sales representative while learning sales process, sales skills, and industry knowledge Minimum Qualifications Working understanding of, or ability to quickly learn, sales enablement software systems (Salesforce.com, Outreach.io, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, etc.) Keen listening and critical thinking ability Ability to effectively manage multiple daily tasks in a fast-paced environment Results-driven and have a consistent track record of successful projects Team player who is forward-thinking and passionate about moving the industry forward Located in the Denver, CO area On Target Earnings (Colorado): $72-76k Please note this is role is located in Denver, Colorado and you would need to live in a commutable distance to the office. Job Requisition ID # 22WD64856 Position Overview We are seeking an enthusiastic and self-motivated finance professional to join the Channel Sales Finance team as Finance Intern. The right candidate will possess strong aptitude for financial planning and analysis, building and delivering reliable, accurate and timely financial data, modeling, and analysis, and being able to understand and articulate business impact beyond numbers. Technically sound, passionate for process improvement, organization savvy, detailed oriented but also able to think strategically, you must demonstrate critical thinking, excellent analytical and communication skills and ability to work proactively with key stakeholders in a highly collaborative environment, manage tight deadlines and always open for changes. As a global leader in 3D design, engineering, and entertainment software, Autodesk helps people imagine, design, and create a better world. Autodesk accelerates better design through an unparalleled depth of experience and a broad portfolio of software to give customers the power to solve their design, business, and environmental challenges. In addition to designers, architects, engineers, and media and entertainment professionals, Autodesk helps students, educators, and casual creators unlock their creative ideas through user-friendly applications. Responsibilities Establish strong partnership with Channel Strategy team, Channel Operation team, financial analysis team, sales finance directors, and finance business partners to provide financial analysis and forecast support for the assigned business group. Communicate effectively to business partners around processes update, key deliverables, and timelines per requirements. Build automation dashboard for business transformation initiatives. Manage quarter end executive reporting and presentations, support quarterly operations review, quarterly business review with stakeholders Provide regular and ad-hoc analysis, build financial report and modeling and drive insightful color of business performances Work across functions to drive efficient processes and systems, and leverage best practices Lead or participate projects related to process improvement. Liaison with Corp finance team and other cross function teams as required Minimum Qualifications Bachelor in Accounting or Finance preferred; MBA or CPA a plus Minimum 4 years of related experience Financial planning & analysis experience is highly preferred Advanced skills in Power BI, Python, SQL language is preferred Strong aptitude for, and experience with, financial software (e.g. Business Objects, Data Warehousing, SAP, BPC, Hyperion etc) Strong interpersonal skills and leadership potential High energetic, and self-motivated, capable of working to firm deadlines Ambitious and eager to learn About The US Intern Program The 2023 U.S. program runs for 12 weeks (May 22 – August 11 or June 12 – September 1) and will be remote (subject to change). All internships are paid. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to contribute to meaningful projects, be mentored by industry leaders, work alongside peers from universities all over the country and participate in tech talks and other activities designed to support your personal and professional development. US recruiting begins in the Fall and concludes end of March. Our Internships align with Autodesk’s Flexible Workplace approach, which is designed to meet the needs of our business while providing flexibility in support of office, remote and hybrid work preferences. Job Requisition ID # 22WD64422 Position Overview Does supporting large cross-functional platform programs excite you? Do you enjoy working & exploring at a fast pace? Are you known to get things done? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you. Your mission: help our Platform teams to work across silos with transparency and efficiency by driving cross-organizational communications that win hearts & minds while enabling teams to understand requirements & expectations. This will be a challenging but exciting opportunity to join a group that is driving new business programs to achieve strategic outcomes for Autodesk. Our team ensures that every stakeholder has access to the information needed to make the best decisions and accelerate the delivery of our platform capabilities. There are many opportunities to continue innovating and leveraging cutting-edge techniques in this area. As Autodesk moves to the cloud and transforms itself from a traditional desktop software company to embracing other technologies, a ton of work needs to get done to keep our technical teams and leaders fully informed, educated, and performing. This internship is an opportunity to work with Cloud Platform product teams, Executive Leadership, Chief Architects, and Technical Training to reach our Engineering community with the tools, frameworks, practices, and processes that will secure their success in this rapidly changing software development landscape. Responsibilities Learn how Autodesk builds & scales its cloud core platform Execute internal communication and multimedia content creation for Autodesk’s platform transformation Partner closely with other team members on a range of activities to create engaging supplemental content, such as videos and animations to support more in-depth messaging Exposure to business teams and leaders primarily in PSET, with some exposure to other department leadership and communication teams Tailored mentoring for your learning path Minimum Qualifications Pursuing a marketing, communications, business, or related degree at an accredited program in the United States with at least one academic term to complete post internship to be eligible for internship participation Be an excellent storyteller Strong proficiency in critical thinking, communication, and organizational skills. Graphic design experience Able to work independently and in a team environment that requires collaboration About The U.S. Intern Program The 2023 U.S. program runs for 12 weeks (May 22 – August 11 or June 12 – September 1) and will be remote (subject to change). Job Requisition ID # 22WD65140 Position Overview Content design is one of the top 10 fastest growing job roles on LinkedIn, and a rapidly emerging discipline within Autodesk. Autodesk is seeking a Content Design Intern to join our Product Design & Manufacturing Solutions (PDMS) team to work on Fusion 360, our innovative, cloud-based platform for product design (CAD) and manufacturing (CAM). The Fusion platform helps companies solve important workflow challenges and reimagine new possibilities based on our 3D modeling, visualization, and data insight software. You’ll join an experienced team of content designers and experience designers to create in-product messaging and supporting content, which expertly guides our customers and helps them gain confidence to continually expand their use of Fusion 360. Our team has a strong culture of collaboration, mentorship, practice excellence, and individual attention to accelerate your career growth and impact. Success in this role requires a love for writing and problem solving with an ability to incorporate feedback from stakeholders and customer research to develop holistic content designs. We’re looking for an intern with curiosity, empathy, and optimism with a knack for conveying complex subject matter clearly and concisely to help us craft an engaging platform experience through content. If this sounds like you, come join our team! To be considered, please submit a sample of your own writing or a link to a portfolio. Responsibilities Capture project requirements and other information necessary to estimate content efforts. Participate in product teams to understand customer requirements and contribute to the design of features with a focus on learnability. Create user-interface text and in-product messaging that improves the customer experience. Deliver high-quality learning content, which supports new product features and workflows, within agreed timescales. Produce content that meets Autodesk’s content design standards for style, tone and voice. Seek feedback and contribute constructively to content/design critiques. Use customer insights from analytics and other customer interactions to help inform content decisions. Minimum Qualifications Pursuing a degree in technical communication, linguistics, communication studies, journalism, product design, human computer interaction, or engineering. Excellent verbal, written and visual communication skills. Interest in researching and understanding complex technologies, and presenting it to others in a clear, approachable manner. Ability to work independently and in a distributed team environment. Eager to learn, explore, and gain new experiences. About The US Intern Program The 2023 U.S. program runs for 12 weeks (May 22 – August 11 or June 12 – September 1) and will be remote (subject to change). All internships are paid. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to contribute to meaningful projects, be mentored by industry leaders, work alongside peers from universities all over the country and participate in tech talks and other activities designed to support your personal and professional development. Job Requisition ID # 22WD64423 Position Overview Do you love building tools that designers use to envision a better world? Autodesk’s platform team designs the ecosystem of APIs, services, and infrastructure that our customers and developers use to extend the capabilities of Autodesk’s design and make software. The Autodesk platform helps companies bring businesses to life to solve important workflow challenges and reimagine new possibilities based on our 3D modeling, visualization, and data insight software by contributing new applications, content, and plugins to our ecosystem. In this role, you’ll help us reimagine the content experience across the Autodesk platform products through content audits, unified taxonomy, standards library, and cohesive storytelling to weave together the experiences across the platform. You’ll collaborate with other experience and content designers, architects, product managers, engineers, and teams who are passionate about bringing exceptional experiences to the fields of architecture, construction, manufacturing, and film and visual effects. Our team has a strong culture of collaboration, mentorship, practice excellence, and individual attention to accelerate your career growth and impact. Success in this role requires a love for writing, creative and systems thinking along with an ability to incorporate feedback from stakeholders and customer research to develop holistic content design outcomes. We’re looking for an intern who can join us on our journey to develop long-term outcomes by partnering with teams with curiosity, empathy, and optimism, and who’s passionate about bringing human voices in crafting world-class platform experiences. If this sounds like you, come join our team! To be considered, you must apply and include your resume and a few writing samples. Please attach a PDF or include your portfolio and a password, if required. Responsibilities Learn about writing for software products Contribute to build taxonomies and glossaries to keep terminology aligned across the company and industries and improve way-finding and discoverability of our products Partner with product and design teams to understand, audit, and implement content recommendations Uncover mental models and interoperability with other Autodesk products and visual design directions Practice product discovery thinking to help shape the problem to be solved Develop tools, processes, talks, and tips to show the value of content design Minimum Qualifications Pursuing a degree in journalism, computer science, design strategy, technical communication, or a related degree in human computer interaction. Reside and attend university in the country where the internship is being offered A mix of previous internship, school project, volunteer and leadership experience is also important  About The US Intern Program The 2023 U.S. program runs for 12 weeks (May 22 – August 11 or June 12 – September 1) and will be remote (subject to change). Job Requisition ID # 22WD63892 Autodesk is seeking a Data Engineering Intern with interest in building data pipelines and designing data quality assurance solutions to join our Enterprise Data Engineering & Visualization (EDEV) team. The EDEV Team is chartered with building robust and resilient pipelines that create the master data sets that serve as the building blocks for all data scientists and data analysts throughout the organization. In addition, this team establishes and promotes data engineering standards and best practices across Autodesk and helps to lead the effort to make data an integral part of decision making at Autodesk.   Responsibilities Mapping and automating data flow from a variety of sources including desktop, web, and mobile product feeds and business systems Leverage test-driven driven development principles to design data transformations running on Apache Spark or dbt Snowflake that are orchestrated via Airflow Deploy solutions via automated CI/CD processes to execute data pipelines running in batch Work with programming languages used for data manipulation, including: PySpark, Spark SQL, Snowflake SQL Develop, execute, and document software solutions to address complex data collection, processing, transformation, and reporting issues. Interpret and translate business needs to technical requirements Work with team to troubleshoot code level problems quickly and efficiently Design solutions to measure data quality and detect data issues and anomalies Qualifications Pursuing Bachelor’s Degree and relevant experience in the field of Computer Science, Mathematics or Statistics; advanced degree a plus Training and experience in big data technologies including Spark, Hadoop, RedShift, Snowflake, Hive, Lambda, S3 Proficiency in executing analysis using SQL, Hive, Spark Data Frames, and Python Strong SQL skills Working knowledge of basic and complex data structures Effective communication skills and ability to explain complex topics to a non-technical audience Knowledge of handling large data sets, event streams and distributed computing (Hive/Hadoop, Spark etc.) Familiarity working with Agile Scrum Teams About The US Intern Program The U.S. program runs from May through August for 12 weeks and will be remote (subject to change). All internships are paid. Job Requisition ID # 22WD63894 Autodesk customers make sense of the world through rich streams of data that might include 3D scans of buildings, fluid dynamic simulations, daily notes on the construction site, trends on product usage and more. As a Data Scientist Intern, you will get to apply your knowledge in data engineering, work with the latest machine learning models, contribute to the next-generation MLOps platform and make an impact by helping our customers create a better, safer, more sustainable world. Responsibilities Develop, prototype, and deploy machine learning models Perform analysis on large datasets and produce qualitative visualizations based on reporting requirements Develop analytical solutions and dashboards that integrate data from a wide variety of sources such as relational databases, AWS, data virtualization tools Understand technology operations data from many different sources in detail to create these models Optimize workflows and scripts on data lake for data cleaning, processing, and transformation Extract and derive useful metrics and KPIs from raw data gathered from multiple data sources Minimum Qualifications Pursuing a Master's in Computer Science or Data Science. Proficiency with data analysis using Python and experience with open-source data science toolkits (Pandas, SciKit-Learn, NLTK, etc.) Familiarity with various statistical and machine learning techniques including classification, regression, dimension reduction, regularization, clustering and various multivariate methods Familiarity with relational data modeling and SQL Familiarity with Snowflake or comparable Data Warehouse and ETL tooling like Astronomer/Airflow and DBT. Preferred Qualifications Prior experience implementing and deploying data science models or data products in Production Experience working in an Agile/SCRUM environment Experience working in an AWS environment and leveraging its offerings such as EC2, S3, Lambda, Glue, Athena, SageMaker etc. Be self-motivated, creative and collaborative About The US Intern Program The U.S. program runs from May through August for 12 weeks and will be remote (subject to change). Job Requisition ID # 22WD64572 Position Overview Autodesk makes software for people who make things. If you’ve ever driven a high-performance car, admired a towering skyscraper, used a smartphone, or watched great science fiction films, chances are you’ve experienced what millions of Autodesk customers are doing with our software. The Autodesk People Analytics Team is looking for a driven and naturally curious data science intern who can hit the ground running in a fast paced, complex environment. You will work with the team to develop and deliver strategic organizational insights using data mining, machine learning, and statistical interpretation. In this role you will help People & Places (PPL) reach its goal of having an industry leading People Analytics team, the project will focus on using data from many sources to create a method for ongoing research and analysis of Autodesk’s most important asset, its people, as well as general industry trends in markets around the world. You will be a key member of the People Insights team, working to understand the desires of our people, measuring the impact of key changes, and communicating this information across the company. Responsibilities Conduct analyses on vast amounts of data to ensure an accurate understanding of the current state of our organization and communicate these findings clearly to our internal stakeholders Apply statistical techniques to model internal behavior and trends to identify potential opportunities for growth and improvement Build statistical models (both predictive and descriptive) such as network analysis modeling, retention modeling, survey interpretation and exploration etc. Automate these results to ensure consistency and repeatability while expanding our ability to understand our organization Communicate findings to executives and cross-functional teams in Product, Engineering, Finance and throughout the company Minimum Qualifications Must be at least 18 and enrolled in college or non-traditional education, such as coding boot camps or industry-related vocational classes and returning to school or program following the completion of this internship Must be attending school in the country where the internship is being offered. A mix of previous internship, school project, volunteer, and leadership experience Pursuing a master’s or PhD in Statistics, Math, Economics, Computer Science, Information Science, Data Science, Analytics, Machine Learning, Physical Sciences, or a related field Proficient in SQL and Python and/or R Preferred Qualifications Experience gathering, sourcing, connecting, and interpreting disparate data Experience with data analysis and machine learning algorithms such as GLMs, CART/CHAID, Random Forests, Gradient Boosting, Cluster Analysis, Text Mining Familiarity with working in big data environments like Hadoop, Hive and Spark Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau/PowerBI AWS experience is a plus A self-starter who finds new ways to solve problems through cutting-edge solutions Passionate about insights, not just data. You’re a strategic thinker and can synthesize methodology and data into actionable business and/or product strategy from your analyses About The US Intern Program The 2023 U.S. program runs for 12 weeks (May 22 – August 11 or June 12 – September 1). All internships are paid. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to contribute to meaningful projects, be mentored by industry leaders, work alongside peers from universities all over the country and participate in tech talks and other activities designed to support your personal and professional development. US recruiting begins in the Fall and concludes end of March. Job Requisition ID # 22WD64312 Position Overview The Autodesk Employee Communications team is on a mission to connect Autodeskers globally through authentic storytelling and engaging experiences that shape our culture, business, and world. We are strategic global communicators and advocates of our company culture, and as part of Autodesk's People & Places (PPL) organization, we are champions of the employee experience. We collaborate with leaders, stakeholders, and communications partners across the company to deliver data-driven content, compelling stories and immersive experiences that bring our company's strategic priorities to life. We are seeking an Employee Communications Intern to work on impactful communications projects that enable all Autodeskers to thrive. A major focus of this role will be partnering with the Culture, Diversity & Belonging teams to support ongoing campaigns and storytelling. Additionally, the intern will learn about the employee communications function as a whole and will support team ad hoc projects when needed. Our team is looking for an applicant who is an excellent communicator and storyteller and can approach the work with a collaborative mindset. This role will report to the Senior Manager of PPL Communications with supervisory oversight from our Manager of Culture, Diversity & Belonging Communications. Responsibilities Supporting the design, drafting, and deployment of communications that inform and engage Autodeskers in our nine Employee Resource Groups Support sourcing and writing stories about global Culture, Diversity & Belonging activities for our company intranet & newsletters Support informing and engaging both an all-employee audience and our people manager populations Contributing to our editorial calendar and day-to-day team and organization operations Minimum Qualifications Must be at least 18 years of age Must be actively enrolled in a degree granting academic institution or accredited boot camp at the time of internship, with at least one academic term to complete post internship. Must be attending school in the country where the internship is being offered. Academic studies or other relevant experience focused in communications, marketing, journalism, or HR Excellent written communication Proven interest in inclusive communications or marketing for a global audience Ability to collaborate well and work in a team environment Strong organizational and project management skills Passion for learning about diversity, equity, and inclusion and commitment to fostering a culture of belonging About The US Intern Program The 2023 U.S. program runs for 12 weeks (May 22 – August 11 or June 12 – September 1). Job Requisition ID # 22WD64560 Position Overview As a Summer 2023 intern, you’ll join a small but mighty team obsessed with delivering a remarkable Autodesk employee experience. In this role, you’ll take a deep dive into the experiences of a specific population of employees (early career, remote, neurodiverse, etc.), including interactions with environments, technology, and each other. Your insights will help us shape emotional, physical, and digital experiences for employees across the globe. In doing this work, you will work closely with our team of systems and design thinkers, experience designers and platform, content, and conversation design experts. Responsibilities With the guidance and support of a mentor, you will be: Creating research briefs and summaries Planning and conducting generative and evaluative research Keeping track of tasks and adhering to project milestones Compiling, analyzing, and synthesizing insights, themes, and recommendations from primary and secondary research data Prototyping effective ways to communicate research findings Identifying opportunities to put research findings to use Sharing insights and recommendations through narratives and other actionable artifacts Minimum Qualifications Actively enrolled at a graduate degree granting academic institution at the time of internship Must reside and be attending school in the country where the internship is being offered Studying one or more of the following: Anthropology, Psychology, Sociology, Journalism, Transmedia or Digital Storytelling, Film and Video Production, or another related field Experience doing field or other human-centered research where your research has been used for a broader academic or professional purpose (if possible, please provide a link to a work sample or portfolio) Experience coding, synthesizing, and interpreting qualitative data Practical experience with design thinking, human-centered design, and/or service design Comfortable working with Microsoft software (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel), Zoom, MURAL and MS Teams and/or Slack Preferred Qualifications At least 2 years of working experience Multicultural experience (e.g., experience as a tour guide) The Ideal Candidate Passionate about research and naturally curious about people and culture A keen observer of behavior Experienced at planning and executing generative and evaluative research, including synthesizing, and communicating findings to a non-research audience Organized and self-directed, able to work independently and as part of a team Detail oriented and meticulous about treatment of study data Creative and adaptable, experienced at overcoming obstacles Highly collaborative, with strong communication skills A compelling storyteller Learning Benefits Exposure to the rapidly growing field of employee experience design Putting academic knowledge into practice to explore real-world experiences for a rapidly growing, purpose-driven company Experience working with a dedicated mentor and team that wants to see you thrive About The US Intern Program The 2023 U.S. program runs for 12 weeks (May 22 – August 11 or June 12 – September 1). All internships are paid. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to contribute to meaningful projects, be mentored by industry leaders, work alongside peers from universities all over the country and participate in tech talks and other activities designed to support your personal and professional development. US recruiting begins in the Fall and concludes end of March. Our Internships align with Autodesk’s Flexible Workplace approach, which is designed to meet the needs of our business while providing flexibility in support of office, remote and hybrid work preferences. Target Pay for this Position (Colorado): 27 - 37$ hourly At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD64307 Position Overview As a Summer Experience Design intern, you will support platform design initiatives to improve Autodesk Developer Experiences. You will collaborate with cross disciplinary platform teams to investigate, define, and design ideal experiences improving developer productivity, trust, engagement, and happiness. The Experience Designer at Autodesk is a relentless customer advocate, possesses a passion for human-centered design, and has a track record of executing highly impactful research and delivering user experiences using established design processes with cross-functional teams. Our designers leverage a wide variety of design methods and work in lockstep with their teams to understand root problems and constraints, explore and test design options, and ship high-quality experiences our customers will love. The role will require top-notch user experience design skills, along with a strategic mindset that balances the needs of the customer with the needs of the business, and a thoughtfulness towards using data and instrumentation to ensure design decisions track towards measurable success. Responsibilities Work with Senior Designers to plan and execute experience design throughout the design and development lifecycle, from early strategic direction through post-release validation. Employ a wide range of research methods, including generative design research and contextual inquiry, participatory design workshops, interviews, formative and summative usability studies, and quantitative methods, such as surveys and data analytics. Assisting with empathy and design-thinking workshops with cross-functional teams to ensure that findings and insights are translated into actionable product goals and direction. Develop information architectures, wireframes, interactive prototypes, workflow and systems designs that address priority pain points in the developer experience and ease toil in multi-step and cross-platform flows that meet pre-defined and measurable acceptance criteria Consistently considers the holistic developer experience including potential states (errors, successes, dead-ends, opportunities for feedback loops) in their work Collaborates with Developers to ensure implementation works as specified, listens to customers in sprint demos, collaborates with Product Manager to ensure customer needs are balanced with business considerations Minimum Qualifications Students must be at least 18 years of age Students must be a full-time student, pursuing a BS, MS or PhD in user experience design, human-computer interaction, information science, data science, or a related field. Students must be actively enrolled in a degree granting academic institution or accredited boot camp at the time of internship. Students must reside and be attending university in the country where the internship is being offered. Students must have previous experience with effectively conducting user research and designing user experiences Familiarity with Software Development and Dev Ops workflows a plus About The US Intern Program The U.S. program runs from May through August for 12 weeks and will be remote (subject to change). All internships are paid. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to contribute to meaningful projects, be mentored by industry leaders, work alongside peers from universities all over the country and participate in tech talks and other activities designed to support your personal and professional development. US recruiting begins in the Fall and concludes end of March.
