Job Requisition ID # 22WD64427 Position Overview Help us build the tools that designers use to envision a better world! The platform helps other companies bring businesses to life to solve important workflow challenges based on our 3D modeling, visualization, and data insight software. Through the platform infrastructure and API’s we enable customer to build custom apps that extend our ecosystem. You will collaborate with designers, product managers and development teams who are passionate about bringing better experiences to the fields of architecture, construction, manufacturing, film and visual effects. As a User Experience Designer Intern, you will help bring our customers’ workflows to life as their industries undergo digital transformation. You will provide the tools to change how our customers work, by automating tedious workflows, and collaborating across company boundaries. In this position you will be building experiences across many interfaces – desktop, web, and mobile – as well as API, SDK, and low-code touchpoints. You will dive deep into a technical understanding of platform customer needs, get ahead of technological trends that are reshaping industries. To be considered, please submit both your resume and portfolio with a password if needed. Responsibilities Conduct and synthesize customer research to derive insights for innovation Develop technical personas (i.e., low-code, front and back-end developers) Produce graphics, and technical artifacts required for product development Sketch low fidelity mock-ups to evaluate alternate designs in collaborative sessions Provide visual and clickable prototypes and rapidly iterate based on customer feedback Assist in the design of product analytics that measure usage and usability Partner with development teams to review feature implementation Collaborate with product management to communicate your ideas Minimum Qualifications Students must be a full-time student, pursuing a BS, MS or PhD in user experience design, human-computer interaction, information science, data science, or a related field. Students must be actively enrolled in a degree granting academic institution or accredited boot camp at the time of internship. Students must reside and be attending university in the country where the internship is being offered. Students must have previous experience with effectively conducting user research and designing user experiences. Familiarity with Software Development a plus. Familiarity with AEC or MFG industries a plus. About The US Intern Program The 2023 U.S. program runs for 12 weeks (May 22 – August 11 or June 12 – September 1) and will be remote (subject to change). All internships are paid. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to contribute to meaningful projects, be mentored by industry leaders, work alongside peers from universities all over the country and participate in tech talks and other activities designed to support your personal and professional development. US recruiting begins in the Fall and concludes end of March. Job Requisition ID # 22WD64523 Position Overview Autodesk is looking for an intern to join a highly collaborative Experience Design team for the summer. Autodesk software is used daily by millions of design and engineering professionals all over the world – who also need to manage their logins and licenses! Help us evolve our platform to meet new business and customer needs by crafting clear, approachable experiences that guide customers easily through these necessary tasks. The Platform Services and Emerging Technologies (PSET) organization enables Autodesk product teams and Autodesk customers to accelerate outcomes by providing a trusted platform of shared and enabling capabilities. PSET XD teams partner with Product Management and Engineering teams to deliver front end web-based experiences, APIs, services, and infrastructure that our customers and developers use to access, manage, and extend the capabilities of Autodesk’s design and make software. The Experience Design (XD) team within PSET includes interaction design, visual design, research, and content strategy. Responsibilities Visualize and prototype intended solutions at various levels of fidelity, from high-level wireframes or mock-ups to conceptual presentations to highly technical documents and diagrams. Collaborate closely with one or more local or remote Agile Scrum teams, working iteratively to deliver customer value. Use customer insights that come from analytics and customer interactions to help inform business and design decisions. Help develop and conduct usability tests and other customer research. Run competitive analyses to identify industry best practices or key capabilities related to specific projects. Minimum Qualifications Full-time student, pursuing a BS, MS or PhD in user experience design, human-computer interaction, information science, data science, or a related field. You have profound empathy for people and want to create the best experiences, even in apparently mundane tasks. You are an enthusiastic collaborator, able to work with people from different disciplines to get the job done. You are a systems thinker who is as interested in what is happening behind the screens as in crafting the interaction experience. You’re excited about digging into the design process alongside other experience designers, researchers, and content strategists, working on real projects while receiving guidance and feedback from senior members of our Experience Design team. We would especially love to talk with you if you have these qualifications: Experience with Figma and/or other current design tools. A portfolio of work that demonstrates your user experience design process and skills. Hands-on knowledge of qualitative or quantitative research and analysis. About The U.S. Intern Program The 2023 U.S. program runs for 12 weeks (May 22 – August 11 or June 12 – September 1). All internships are paid. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to contribute to meaningful projects, be mentored by industry leaders, work alongside peers from universities all over the country and participate in tech talks and other activities designed to support your personal and professional development. US recruiting begins in the Fall and concludes end of March. jobTitle: Intern, Financial Analyst - Autodesk Construction Solutions (ACS)
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD64920 Position Overview Autodesk has fully reimagined the construction business for the digital age, enabling companies to address the most important challenges they face today while preparing for new ways of working in the future. The Autodesk Construction Solutions (ACS) portfolio connects the office, trailer and field so customers can move seamlessly through each phase of a building's lifecycle — from design and preconstruction to construction, turnover and operations — with best-in-class solutions that include Assemble, Build, Takeoff, Collaborate, Docs, BuildingConnected and ProEst. General contractors, subcontractors, and owners around the world rely on the Autodesk Construction Cloud to win more work, enhance collaboration, speed decision-making, reduce risk, and improve overall project outcomes. ACS finance team is seeking a highly motivated and curious financial analyst intern to join our team. The right candidate for this role will demonstrate strong collaboration skills, financial aptitude, excellent business intuition, and the capability to work at multiple levels, including high level strategy and day-to-day financial details. As part of the Finance Team, you will provide high quality support to the Sr Finance Business partner including reporting on business results, providing insights & analysis, driving continuous improvements. This is an ideal opportunity for candidates seeking experience within a dynamic finance function at the center of the company’s future success. Responsibilities Perform analysis on large ACS finance datasets and produce relevant business trends - develop analytical solutions and dashboards to automate the reporting Provide executives with a deeper understanding of business performance by developing and incorporating new metrics and measures into existing analysis Understand the business drivers behind ACS long-range planning model (LRP) - partner with other finance teams to design and develop real-time insights into the assumptions and metrics that support our financial projections Minimum Qualifications Student must be actively enrolled in a degree granting academic institution or accredited boot camp at the time of internship.  Student must reside and attend university in the country where the internship is being offered. Preferred Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Finance or Accounting. MBA or CPA a plus 2+ years of related finance experience Excellent quantitative and analytical skills, inquisitive mind, data savvy High attention to detail and comfortable working with large data sets Ability to work cross functionally, as well as independently Strong Excel and PowerPoint skills; Experience with financial software a plus (ex. Anaplan, Power BI, etc.) Strong sense of ownership, ability to prioritize, and work in fast paced environment Knowledge of SaaS company metrics & drivers such as recurring revenue, churn, ACV, etc. a plus About The US Intern Program The 2023 U.S. program runs for 12 weeks (May 22 – August 11 or June 12 – September 1) and will be remote (subject to change). All internships are paid. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to contribute to meaningful projects, be mentored by industry leaders, work alongside peers from universities all over the country and participate in tech talks and other activities designed to support your personal and professional development. US recruiting begins in the Fall and concludes end of March. Our internships align with Autodesk’s Flexible Workplace approach, which is designed to meet the needs of our business while providing flexibility in support of office, remote and hybrid work preferences. General contractors, subcontractors, and owners around the world rely on the Autodesk Construction Cloud to win more work, enhance collaboration, speed decision-making, reduce risk, and improve overall project outcomes. ACS finance team is seeking a highly motivated and curious financial analyst intern to join our team. The right candidate for this role will demonstrate strong collaboration skills, financial aptitude, excellent business intuition, and the capability to work at multiple levels, including high level strategy and day-to-day financial details. As part of the Finance Team, you will provide high quality support to the Sr Finance Business partner including reporting on business results, providing insights & analysis, driving continuous improvements. This is an ideal opportunity for candidates seeking experience within a dynamic finance function at the center of the company’s future success. Responsibilities Perform analysis on large ACS finance datasets and produce relevant business trends - develop analytical solutions and dashboards to automate the reporting Provide executives with a deeper understanding of business performance by developing and incorporating new metrics and measures into existing analysis Understand the business drivers behind ACS long-range planning model (LRP) - partner with other finance teams to design and develop real-time insights into the assumptions and metrics that support our financial projections Minimum Qualifications Student must be actively enrolled in a degree granting academic institution or accredited boot camp at the time of internship.  Student must reside and attend university in the country where the internship is being offered. Preferred Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Finance or Accounting. MBA or CPA a plus 2+ years of related finance experience Excellent quantitative and analytical skills, inquisitive mind, data savvy High attention to detail and comfortable working with large data sets Ability to work cross functionally, as well as independently Strong Excel and PowerPoint skills; Experience with financial software a plus (ex. Anaplan, Power BI, etc.) Strong sense of ownership, ability to prioritize, and work in fast paced environment Knowledge of SaaS company metrics & drivers such as recurring revenue, churn, ACV, etc. a plus About The US Intern Program The 2023 U.S. program runs for 12 weeks (May 22 – August 11 or June 12 – September 1) and will be remote (subject to change). All internships are paid. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to contribute to meaningful projects, be mentored by industry leaders, work alongside peers from universities all over the country and participate in tech talks and other activities designed to support your personal and professional development. US recruiting begins in the Fall and concludes end of March. Our internships align with Autodesk’s Flexible Workplace approach, which is designed to meet the needs of our business while providing flexibility in support of office, remote and hybrid work preferences. At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It’s disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital artists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.

Job Requisition ID # 22WD64911 Position Overview  Do you have an interest in understanding the corporate finance function and its role in a dynamic, public company environment? Do you have strong analytical skills, an ability to communicate complex ideas to diverse populations, and an interest in driving process improvement? This internship position will work on a reporting standardization project, gathering needs from senior business leaders, drafting what those needs look like in a reporting dashboard, and outlining a plan to implement the project. Join us and gain exposure to Finance at Autodesk. At this point in time, Autodesk is planning for a virtual summer internship program.   Responsibilities   Engage with senior management to identify financial reporting needs across a broad organization. Meet with finance partners to understand current management reporting and data sources used. Synthesize your findings and make recommendations for reporting improvements. Identify any gaps in data/systems/tools and potential automation opportunities. Implement recommendations and outline future enhancements. Minimum Qualifications  Students must be at least 18 years of age  Student must be actively enrolled in a degree granting academic institution or accredited boot camp at the time of internship  Students must reside and attend university in the country where the internship is being offered    Preferred Qualifications  Pursuing an undergraduate degree in business, economics, or a related field.  Tech savvy, analytical and have excellent problem-solving skills.  Passionate about data driven decision making, eager to learn, creative thinker, analytical mindset.  Affinity with self-service analytical tools, such as Power BI and Smartsheet.  Excellent communication skills, detail-oriented, and with the ability to interact with various levels of customers and finance resources.  Ability to work both independently and as a member of a cross-functional team with strong sense of ownership.    About The US Intern Program The 2023 U.S. program runs for 12 weeks (May 22 – August 11 or June 12 – September 1) and will be remote (subject to change). All internships are paid. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to contribute to meaningful projects, be mentored by industry leaders, work alongside peers from universities all over the country and participate in tech talks and other activities designed to support your personal and professional development. US recruiting begins in the Fall and concludes end of March. Our Internships align with Autodesk’s Flexible Workplace approach, which is designed to meet the needs of our business while providing flexibility in support of office, remote and hybrid work preferences. Job Requisition ID # 22WD64308 Position Overview We are looking for a passionate and motivated Diversity & Belonging Intern to join Autodesk! In this role you will provide critical support by performing coordination, research for the day-to-day operations of company-wide D&B strategies, programs, and initiatives. You will work with the D&B team to support team projects, initiatives, events and research and support data and report curation. Responsibilities Partner with the Head of D&B and team members to drive existing D&B Goals and initiatives Provide support to D&B Stakeholders Create documents and curate content to be utilized for our D&B Resource Page Coordinate D&B activities in conjunction with the Team Participate in activities related to the D&B strategic plan (i.e., supporting the D&B Dashboard, metrics, reports etc.) Research and support the development of the D&B Resource page Help plan and attend ERG meetings and events Support the D&B team on drafting communications, capturing research, and event planning Minimum Requirements Must be at least 18 years of age and actively enrolled in a degree granting academic institution with at least one academic term to complete post internship Basic software development skills Some coursework, project, or work experience in Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Some analytical and problem-solving skills Strong oral and written communication skills Attention to detail and organizational skills Ability to work independently as a self-starter, but also act as a team player A demonstrated passion for Social Justice and Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Critical thinking skills About The US Intern Program The 2023 U.S. program runs for 12 weeks (May 22 – August 11 or June 12 – September 1). commission accounts Process contracts in Procurement and Legal systems Communicate with hotels and stakeholders regarding event details and follow up Maintain stakeholder feedback in Cvent Facilitate Uber Eats and other catering Creating floor plans for various set ups Payment Management Work with suppliers to ensure they are approved in Procure to Pay database Open purchase orders and manage vendor payments/deposits Work with stakeholders to facilitate event related payments and cross charge those expenses as required Reconcile and provide appropriate documentation for monthly event card charges Site Visits Schedule detailed site visit itineraries for team and stakeholders Meeting Concierge Assist stakeholders in finding offsite venues and activities including restaurants, team Resourceful team player with the ability to solve problems and issues independently Able to work independently and be a self-starter Able to thrive in a fast-paced environment and effectively prioritize workloads with multiple programs Professional, flexible personality and enjoy working with people Experience supporting customer service issues to resolution Able to work with a wide variety of stakeholders across the organization with excellent written and verbal communication skills Comfortable learning new technology with proficiency in Microsoft Office applications Preferred jobTitle: Intern, Network Security and Detection Engineering
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD63700 Position Overview As an intern within the Autodesk Infrastructure Security organization, you will work within the Network Security and Detection Engineering team to learn Network Security best practices and work on designing and automating Network Security and Security Logging. Responsibilities Review firewall policies and work with internal stakeholders to assess risk to allow certain network connections Develop automations to audit firewall policies for misconfigurations, overly permissive policies and duplicate policies Develop automations to automate the firewall change management process end to end Review configurations, policies or signatures on all network devices Monitor for threats and malicious activity targeting Autodesk Infrastructure and Networks. Develop automations to report these findings in real time and in an automated fashion Work closely with other Network Security Engineers to ensure Network Security best practices are adhered to across different parts of the Autodesk Network Automate onboarding and enrichment of Security log sources and events of interest Minimum Qualifications Must be at least 18 years of age Must be actively enrolled in a degree granting academic institution at the time of internship, with at least one academic term to complete post internship. Must be attending school in the country where the internship is being offered. Master's degree (M.S.) in cybersecurity, computer science, applied information technology, or related field Coursework in (some or all) the following: Cyber Security, Networking, Network Security, Operating Systems, Computer Architecture, Data Structure and Algorithms Familiarity with common security vulnerabilities and the ability to analyze risk, severity, and impact Basic understanding of Firewalls, Routing, TCP/IP, VPN, IDS/IPS, SSL, IPSec tunnels and other network security technologies Knowledge in one or more of the programming languages: C, C++, Java, or Go programming Knowledge in Python, Perl, shell, or other scripting languages Preferred Qualifications Strong understanding/working knowledge of the public cloud infrastructure and services in AWS/Azure Hands on experience building automation pipelines end to end Hands on experience with Firewall technologies such as Juniper, Fortigate firewalls Hands on experience with SASE technologies Familiarity with packet capture, NetFlow tools, Web Application firewalls, Real-Time Application Protection systems, log management, and SIEM Knowledge and experience with network, host and application security practices Knowledge and experience with security technologies including host and network-based protection and detection technologies About The US Intern Program The 2023 U.S. program runs for 12 weeks (May 22 – August 11 or June 12 – September 1). All internships are paid. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to contribute to meaningful projects, be mentored by industry leaders, work alongside peers from universities all over the country and participate in tech talks and other activities designed to support your personal and professional development. US recruiting begins in the Fall and concludes end of March. Our Internships align with Autodesk’s Flexible Workplace approach, which is designed to meet the needs of our business while providing flexibility in support of office, remote and hybrid work preferences. Job Requisition ID # 22WD63817 Position Overview The Platform Partner Management (PPM) team leads Autodesk’s platform partner relationships to ensure a highly resilient and compliant platform for all Autodesk customers. We do this by managing 3rd party vendor partners that provide foundational technology for Autodesk’s platform. This includes cloud-native vendor partners across domains such as API Management, Security, Databases, SAAS/PAAS providers, Localization, Service and staff augmentation providers. The Partner Manager Intern will be responsible for supporting the onboarding of a vendor relationship management tool, automating key processes, managing some vendor partner relationships including contracting, performance management, issue management, stakeholder management and being a key partner in risk and financial management. Responsibilities Support Partner Managers with onboarding of Vendor Relationship Management tool Review key vendor management processes and identify opportunities for automation, process improvement. Work with Business, Strategic Sourcing, Procurement, and Security teams on RF(x) processes, technical vendor evaluations, security assessments, and other projects as needed Work with Business, Procurement, Finance, and Legal teams on contract management including compliance, oversight, and adherence to change control procedures. Monitor and ensure contract renewals are planned and executed well in advance of expiry Monitor vendor partner performance, financial status, SLA/KPI monitoring. Drive and facilitate any disputes between business and supplier to resolution Set up regular check-ins with vendor account managers, facilitate regular conversations between the business unit/stakeholder(s) and vendor operations teams Ensure all relevant vendor data is automated and available on dashboards Minimum Qualifications Pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master's Degree in Business or Supply Chain Project or Vendor Management experience in school or past internship Students should reside and attend university in the country where the internship is being offered About The US Intern Program The U.S. program runs from May through August for 12 weeks and will be remote (subject to change). All internships are paid. Interns have the opportunity to work alongside peers from universities all over the country and participate in intern events such as tech talks, mentoring, fun events, and more. US recruiting begins in the Fall and concludes at the end of March. Job Requisition ID # 22WD64855 Position Overview  We are seeking an enthusiastic, self-motivated finance professional with a strong analytical mindset, proven ability to analyze large data sets and concisely communicate key business insights to senior stakeholders. The position is primarily focused on total Autodesk topline forecast support, a key deliverable to the CRO. You will also be responsible for creating a roadmap and financial models for monitoring forecast changes and attainment, allowing key stakeholders to accurately assess risk, opportunities, and performance of business initiatives.    Responsibilities   Lead analysis of topline billings and revenue, and other financial measures that are essential to measuring the success of our business Establish strong partnership with financial analysis team, sales finance directors, and finance business partners to provide revenue/billings analysis and forecast support Prepare critical financial analyses and executive level presentations to help stakeholders understand the context or 'why' behind our financial results   Develop financial models to track new business metrics to derive insightful color of business performances Recommend improvements to processes and models to increase efficiency and adapt to changing business Present findings to Finance and Sales leadership teams Minimum Qualifications  Pursuing an MBA or Master’s in business, or a related field Student must be actively enrolled in a degree granting academic institution or accredited bootcamp at the time of Job Requisition ID # 22WD65756 Position Overview Ever wanted to help build the tools that designers use to envision a better world? Autodesk’s platform team designs the experiences, API’s and services that our customers and developers use to extend the capabilities of Autodesk’s design and make software. The platform helps other companies bring businesses to life to solve important workflow challenges and bring new possibilities to life based on our 3D modeling, visualization, and data insight software by contributing new applications, content, and plugins to our ecosystem. You will collaborate with other designers and teams who are passionate about bringing better experiences to the fields of architecture, construction, manufacturing and film and visual effects. The strategic technologies experience team is looking for a Service Experience Designer – Learning intern to help us improve the learning experience across the developer's journey. The intern will be responsible for mapping and prototyping a new end to end learning experience that help developers become more proficient in creating applications that add value to our ecosystem.    When applying you must include both your resume and portfolio with password.  Responsibilities Create design prototypes that address business, existing & future systems, and learning requirements Help set the standards that will make Autodesk a platform company that can attract and sustain creative developers and creators that build on the platform Design rich interactive learning experiences prototypes across desktop, web, and mobile. Work with multiple stakeholders to identify key areas for learning innovation Construct compelling artifacts (wireframes, conceptual diagrams, journey maps, task flows, storyboards, etc.) that outline present conditions and proposed solutions to gain strategic alignment Effectively communicate conceptual ideas, design rationale and the specifics of user-centered design process Research and analyze current and future UX learning technology patterns and design trends, including market research and competitive analysis Lead customer research activities during the planning, strategy development, and early learning design of solutions Participate in design-thinking exercises to break through organizational silos and collaboratively solve complex design challenges. Manage time, prioritize tasks, and work within deadlines with little supervision Minimum Qualifications  Currently enrolled in a Master’s program in user experience design, human-computer interaction, computer science, design research/strategy, or information science at an accredited program in the United States with at least one academic term to complete post-internship You are comfortable doing both design and research  You are comfortable with early product development and service design  You’re not afraid to express your ideas, or change your mind when someone has a better one  You have a good understanding of user-centered design principles   You can present cohesive design approaches to a non-design audience   You grasp multiple system requirements with careful attention to detail  About The US Intern Program The 2023 U.S. program runs for 12 weeks (May 22 – August 11 or June 12 – September 1) and will be remote (subject to change). Job Requisition ID # 22WD64960 Position Overview As a Summer 2023 Software Engineering intern you can gain real world experience working as part of a fast-paced team developing the technology that enables Autodesk products to exchange data between a variety of Autodesk applications and workflows.  As a Software Development Intern at Autodesk, you will work with software engineers and software architects to design and implement software components for data workflows. These will serve as a model from which other developers can be inspired to learn from and build their own components with.The ideal candidate is a strong programmer who thinks creatively, is naturally innovative, highly collaborative, and has a passion for developing software with cutting edge features that are far reaching and have real impact. Responsibilities Design and implement testable, readable, and effective production quality code Develop build and test automations for import and export workflows Actively participate in team meetings and practice Agile mindset throughout the software development lifecycle Minimum Qualifications Enrolled as a full-time student pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math or similar degree program at an accredited University in the United States Completed course work and projects using Java programming or a similar programming language Strong knowledge in Computer Science subjects especially Object-oriented programming and data structures Programming experience in a Windows, Mac OS, or Linux environment Ability to work in team environment as a team player and a self-starter Strong interpersonal skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills Preferred Qualifications Building applications in Java, Scala, C#, Python Experience using REST APIs About The US Intern Program The 2023 U.S. program runs for 12 weeks (May 22 – August 11 or June 12 – September 1) and will be remote (subject to change). All internships are paid. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to contribute to meaningful projects, be mentored by industry leaders, work alongside peers from universities all over the country and participate in tech talks and other activities designed to support your personal and professional development. US recruiting begins in the Fall and concludes end of March. Our Internships align with Autodesk’s Flexible Workplace approach, which is designed to meet the needs of our business while providing flexibility in support of office, remote and hybrid work preferences. At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It’s disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital artists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.

Job Requisition ID # 22WD63981 Position Overview As a Summer 2023 Software Engineer intern, you will join one of the teams developing industry leading design authoring applications, such as AutoCAD, Revit, Inventor, Fusion 360 and Maya, used daily by millions of professionals all over the world. You will work on meaningful projects, solving unique challenges, processes and tools supporting development of robust and highly performant programs consisting of millions of lines of code. The ideal candidate is a strong programmer who thinks creatively, is naturally innovative, highly collaborative, and has a passion for developing software with cutting edge features that are far reaching and have real impact. Responsibilities Object oriented program languages C++, C#, Java and Python Excellent communication, presentation and interpersonal skills Ability to work in team environment and successfully build collaborative relationships Knowledge of Autodesk software is a bonus! Minimum Qualifications Must be at least 18 and enrolled in college or non-traditional education, such as coding boot camps or industry-related vocational classes and returning back to school or program following the completion of this internship A mix of previous internship, school project, volunteer and leadership experience About The US Intern Program The U.S. program runs from May through August for 12 weeks and will be remote (subject to change). jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD64304 Position Overview Autodesk is a global leader in 3D design, engineering, and entertainment software. The work we do at Autodesk gets to touch nearly every person on the planet. By creating software tools for making buildings, machines, and even the latest movie, we get to influence and empower some of the most creative people in the world to solve problems that matter. We are looking for a Software Engineer intern (Summer 2023) to join the Interoperability group to help develop and maintain the core components that enable world class data exchange capabilities in all of Autodesk’s major products.  You will have the opportunity to apply your computer science knowledge and work closely with team members in US, UK and China to solve interesting interoperability problems and develop automation tools. Responsibilities Design and implement testable, readable, and effective production quality code Develop build and test automations for import and export workflows Actively participate in team meetings and practice Agile mindset throughout the software development lifecycle Minimum Qualifications Student must be actively enrolled in a degree granting academic institution or accredited boot camp at the time of internship Coding and scripting skills in languages like C++, Python Strong knowledge in Computer Science subjects especially Object-oriented programming and data structures Strong verbal and written communication skills in English Works effectively both independently and as a member of a cross-functional team Keen eye for detail, meticulous and analytically minded Preferred Qualifications Pursuing Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or related field of study Previous intern/FTE experience Expertise using one or more CAD systems like Revit, Civil3D, Fusion 360, Inventor, etc. Experience with AEC (Architecture, Engineering and Construction) industry and BIM workflows About The US Intern Program The U.S. program runs from May through August for 12 weeks and will be remote (subject to change). All internships are paid. Interns have the opportunity to work alongside peers from universities all over the country and participate in intern events such as tech talks, mentoring, fun events, and more. US recruiting begins in the Fall and concludes end of March. At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. It’s disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital artists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.

Job Requisition ID # 22WD65012 Position Overview As a Summer 2023 Software Engineer intern, you will join one of the teams developing industry leading design authoring applications, such as AutoCAD, Revit, Inventor, Fusion 360 and Maya, used daily by millions of professionals all over the world. You will work on meaningful projects, solving unique challenges, processes and tools supporting development of robust and highly performant programs consisting of millions of lines of code. The ideal candidate is a strong programmer who thinks creatively, is naturally innovative, highly collaborative, and has a passion for developing software with cutting edge features that are far reaching and have real impact. Responsibilities Analyze product usage data for data quality and generation of insights. Generate data quality reports. Develop high quality, scalable, secure, stable code for use in products and solutions for customers, making it easier for other developers to maintain, enhance and reuse. Develop and maintain Unit Tests; strive to automate testing as much as possible.  Ensure new code follows best security practices.  Document new code and features developed, including changes to existing code.  Write and present code design specifications.  Interact with customers to identify and resolve product defects; work directly with business people daily.  Maintain, troubleshoot and debug code, as required.  Test newly developed features to ensure they are functioning properly  Participate in developing test plans, including regression tests, for newly developed software or feature.  Minimum Qualifications Pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in Software Engineering or Information Technology Experience with Python and databases like MySQL, PostgreSQL or Aurora Working knowledge of AWS technologies e.g. S3, EMR Excellent analyzing and problem-solving skills Team player attitude About The US Intern Program The 2023 U.S. program runs for 12 weeks (May 22 – August 11 or June 12 – September 1) and will be remote (subject to change). All internships are paid. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to contribute to meaningful projects, be mentored by industry leaders, work alongside peers from universities all over the country and participate in tech talks and other activities designed to support your personal and professional development. Job Requisition ID # 22WD64165 Position Overview  You can gain real world experience working as part of a fast-paced team developing the technology that enables Autodesk products to exchange data between a variety of Autodesk applications and workflows.  As a Software Development Intern at Autodesk, you will work under the guidance of a senior software engineer mentor to design and implement software components to exercise data exchange workflows. These will serve as a model from which other developers can be inspired to learn from and build their own components with.    This position is for an entry-level software engineering college student.  The position reports to a PSET Engineering Software Development Manager and will interact primarily with software engineers and software architects. Background should include Java, C#, or Python programming experience.  Familiarity with REST APIs a plus.              Responsibilities  You will perform the following tasks under the guidance of your assigned faculty advisor and Autodesk mentor:  Collaborate with the PSET Files & Derivatives team to develop software to drive data exchange workflows. Design, develop, and test software components that exercise data exchange workflows. Collaborate with the product development team to ensure the software components are reusable and well documented to support third party developers Work with a geographically dispersed team.  Communicate work plans, progress, status, and results.  Present and deliver the completed software to the team.     Minimum Qualifications  Enrolled as a full-time student pursuing a bachelors in Computer Science, Engineering, Math or similar degree program at an accredited University in the United States with at least one academic term to complete.  Completed course work and projects using Java programming and object oriented design   Programming experience in a Windows, Mac OS, or Linux environment   Ability to work in team environment as a team player and a self-starter   Strong interpersonal skills   Excellent verbal and written communication skills     Preferred Qualifications  Java, C#, Python knowledge Experience using REST APIs Some exposure to CAD (Computer Aided Design) systems About The US Intern Program The U.S. program runs from May through August for 12 weeks and will be remote (subject to change). All internships are paid. Interns have the opportunity to work alongside peers from universities all over the country and participate in intern events such as TED talks, mentoring, fun events, and more. US recruiting begins in the Fall and concludes end of March. At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Job Requisition ID # 22WD64432 Position Overview Do you love working on building a state-of-the-art personalized experience platform? Autodesk is in the midst of a major transition to help our customers more easily access and utilize Autodesk’s products so that they can design and make anything. jobTitle: Intern, Software Engineer, AWS Cost Analytics
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD63962 Position Overview Autodesk Cloud Cost Analytics team is seeking a passionate Software Engineering Intern to enhance our analytics platform. This is a great opportunity to create amazing things and learn from some of the best in the industry. Experiment, learn, and grow Use the latest and greatest cloud technologies Mentor and be mentored Our team enables real-time data-centric experiences at scale to make a difference for all of those who imagine, design, and make our world. As a Summer 2023 Software Engineer intern, you will join a team developing and analyzing AWS cost to optimize savings and performance. Responsibilities Based on the AWS docs formalize a criterion to identify unused or over-provisioned resources Design, develop, test features and functionalities via applications and services Analyze data extracted from the data to quantify how much can be saved by acting on these resources Write code that is tested, readable, and maintainable Engage in technical and architectural discussions and decision making Collaborate with stakeholders to understand requirements, understand use cases and build towards a cohesive technical strategy Automate processes where possible and propose new tools when needed Minimum Qualifications Hands-on software development experience in Python Familiar with cloud-native applications Familiar with Relational and NoSQL database technologies, such as MySQL, DynamoDB Customer-facing and service-oriented person Understanding DevOps best practices, architectures, and methods Ability to work in a remote team environment and successfully build collaborative relationships Must be at least 18 and enrolled in college or non-traditional education, such as coding boot camps or industry-related vocational classes and returning to school or program following the completion of this internship Must be attending school in the country where the internship is being offered A mix of previous internship, school project, volunteer and leadership experience are also important About The US Intern Program The 2023 U.S. program runs for 12 weeks (May 22 – August 11 or June 12 – September 1). Job Requisition ID # 22WD63965 Position Overview Autodesk, the leading Design and Engineering Software Company, is transitioning to the cloud! As a global leader in 3D design, engineering, and entertainment software, Autodesk helps customers imagine, design, and create a better world. Our flagship product, AutoCAD, has become synonymous with CAD and is a fixture in design shops worldwide. We have industry-leading 3D solutions for industrial design and manufacturing, architecture, engineering, and construction, as well as media and entertainment. Over 10 million professionals in 185 countries are using Autodesk products to save time and money, gain competitive advantage, and change the way ideas are brought to life. The success and growth of Autodesk is attributed not only to its exceptional products, but also to its unique culture which brings together the best and the brightest in a combined mission of innovation and creativity. We are continually ranked as a top place to work by Fortune, Forbes, and Glassdoor. As Autodesk transitions from a world of desktop products to products powered by cloud services, our group is tasked with building a resilient and extensible deployment platform that strengthens our cloud posture. Engineers across Autodesk's product teams utilize our platform to deploy the next generation of rich customer experiences. Do automation and a fast-paced environment excite you? Do you thrive on building resilient, self-healing, auto-scaling cloud-based systems? The Deployment and Compute group is seeking a highly motivated, Software Engineer to help build our cloud platform. Responsibilities Design, develop, and test features/functions delivered via applications and services Work with operations teams to ensure your applications and services are highly available and reliable Hands-on software development that will perform at scale Write code that is tested, readable, and maintainable Perform code reviews, evaluate implementations, and provide feedback for tool improvements Minimum Qualifications Must be at least 18 years of age Must be actively enrolled in a degree granting academic institution or accredited boot camp at the time of internship, with at least one academic term to complete post internship. Must be attending school in the country where the internship is being offered. Great team player with great communication skills. Hands-on software development experience in Python. Experience implementing unit and integration tests Understanding & curiosity of DevOps best practices, architectures, and methods Good self-management skills and ability to track and prioritize multiple tasks coming in simultaneously Good understanding of networking and security concepts Preferred Qualifications Production experience in large-scale cloud-based Infrastructure (AWS preferred) Experience with cloud-native applications Experience with Docker and Kubernetes/ECS environments Experience with configuration management tools and cloud automation (eg. TerraForm, Chef, Ansible, etc.) Experience defining and building CI/CD processes and working with common CI/CD tools (Jenkins/Circle CI/Spinnaker, etc.) Excellent problem-solving skills, along with the ability to work independently Experience building apps on AWS using services such as Step functions, DynamoDB, IAM, EC2, CloudWatch and Lambda Experience with infrastructure-as-code tools such as Terraform or CloudFormation Experience with Agile software development practices Experience using Docker to build containerized applications Experience consuming, designing, and implementing REST APIs Experience with monitoring and logging tools (NewRelic, Splunk, ELK) About The US Intern Program The 2023 U.S. program runs for 12 weeks (May 22 – August 11 or June 12 – September 1). All internships are paid. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to contribute to meaningful projects, be mentored by industry leaders, work alongside peers from universities all over the country and participate in tech talks and other activities designed to support your personal and professional development. US recruiting begins in the Fall and concludes end of March. Our Internships align with Autodesk’s Flexible Workplace approach, which is designed to meet the needs of our business while providing flexibility in support of office, remote and hybrid work preferences. Job Requisition ID # 22WD64305 Position Overview The Autodesk Forge Visualization Graphics Team is seeking a Senior Software Engineer to work on the Autodesk Graphics Platform (AGP), a shared graphics system used by many Autodesk applications, including AutoCAD, Fusion, Revit, Inventor, 3ds Max, and Maya. You will join a talented and experienced technical team in undertaking a complete modernization of the graphics components, providing Autodesk applications with the ability to support, and exploit, the latest and future generations of graphics technology. You will also be helping us to shape and adopt open standards and open source projects, in order to develop a USD-based graphics pipeline for Autodesk products Responsibilities Design and write robust, readable, maintainable, and extensible code that can last for years Produce both unit tests and developer documentation for any new code Debug existing subsystems, identify problem areas in the code, provide both quick temporary workarounds and high-quality, lasting solutions as needed Profile and optimize existing code on a variety of platforms, and generate performance and unit tests to catch any regressions Minimum Qualifications Pursuing Bachelor’s or Master's degree in computer science or related field of study Experience with computer graphics application development Strong object-oriented, software architecture, and C++ skills are required Experience developing on Windows with Visual Studio Ability to work within an established, tight-knit yet geographically distributed team of developers Good written and verbal English communication skills Preferred Qualifications Experience with graphics APIs (such as DirectX, OpenGL, CUDA), and shading languages (such as HLSL, GLSL, OSL) Knowledge of build and deployment technologies, such as Jenkins, CMake, and Python Knowledge of source control systems, especially Git and GitHub Experience developing on Linux, macOS, or mobile platforms About The US Intern Program The U.S. program runs from May through August for 12 weeks and will be remote (subject to change). All internships are paid. Job Requisition ID # 22WD64354 Position Overview As a Web Graphics Software Engineer intern, you will join the Forge Graphics Team that is building the next generation web visualization platform for design and make data. You will work on meaningful aspect of a visualization platform, solving unique challenges, processes and tools supporting development of robust and highly performant programs. You will work in close contact with software engineers, user experience designers, and QA engineers, and collaborate with graphics experts working on various products across the company. You will be to apply your knowledge of algorithms, data structures, front/back end or full-stack and software design patterns to serve customer needs. The ideal candidate is a strong programmer who thinks creatively, is naturally innovative, highly collaborative, and has a passion for developing graphics software with cutting edge features that are far reaching and have real impact. Responsibilities Making a significant contribution to the design, architecture and implementation of next-generation Saas-based web graphics platform meant for 2D/3D rendering applications, using web related technologies such as TypeScript/JavaScript and HTML Adding new capabilities to the 2D/3D web visualization component (https://forge.autodesk.com/api/viewer-cover-page/) Collaborating with internal teams, external partners and contribute to graphics open source initiatives Writing functional requirement documents and developer user guides Minimum Qualifications Must be at least 18 and enrolled in college or non-traditional education, such as coding boot camps or industry-related vocational classes and returning back to school or program following the completion of this internship. Job Requisition ID # 22WD64857 Position Overview  Do you have a passion for strategic sourcing and negotiating? Can you spot opportunities where others can’t? Are you a change agent who challenges the status-quo and makes things better? Do you have strong analytical skills, an ability to communicate complex ideas to diverse populations? Do you enjoy working collaboratively with people across various disciplines to make their work easier and leading cross-functional teams that does the same? We’re all about accelerating careers, delighting our customers, and delivering results. If you are too, then we have the right role for you! Responsibilities   Work with a diverse team and audience of internal stakeholders to manage engagement contracts, while maintaining a “delight the customer” mindset. Maintain an understanding for end-to-end purchase to pay processes and functional team responsibilities between Sourcing, Procurement, and Accounts Payable, and assist in resolving cross-team issues in a collaborative manner. Work with the sourcing team to facilitate global and country-specific processes within the EMEA, AMER and or APAC region. In partnership with Sourcing Managers, review and analyze data to determine cost savings opportunities through vendor consolidation and/or contract renegotiations. Prepare and present data for executive leaders related to department spend and recommendations to improve value from supplier services. Identify opportunities for process improvement and automation. Execute sourcing events (i.e. spot buy, RFQ/RFP, etc.) when necessary. Learn how to develop and implement category and sourcing strategies for the different categories in Sourcing. Help identify areas of risk for the business (i.e., indemnities, limits of liability, delivery of service, quality, performance, timeline, warranty, governance or other contractual terms); make recommendations where applicable. Provide business with approved sourcing tools, processes, and knowledge to qualify vendors and manage vendor relationships. Ability to build and maintain relationships with internal customers / clients as well as vendors. Ability to shine under pressure while dealing with changing priorities and timelines. Minimum Qualifications  Students must be at least 18 years of age  Student must be actively enrolled in a degree granting academic institution at the time of internship. Students must reside and attend university in the country where the internship is being offered.  Preferred Qualifications  Pursuing an MBA or Master’s in business, with a supply chain concentration  Strong PowerBI, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint skills  Strong communication skills Interest in technology sourcing (software, telecom, etc)   About The US Intern Program The 2023 U.S. program runs for 12 weeks (May 22 – August 11 or June 12 – September 1) and will be remote (subject to change). Job Requisition ID # 22WD64598 Position Overview Does running large technical cloud services development programs excite you? Do you enjoy working & exploring at a fast pace? Are you known to get things done? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you. Your mission: Help our Platform Services teams deliver our platform vision with high transparency and efficiency by driving cross-organizational technical programs that enable engineering teams to manage their inter & intra-dependencies. This will be an exhilarating opportunity to join Autodesk’s Programs and Business Excellence team and gain experience with driving Security domain technical programs. As Autodesk moves to become a trusted platform company and embraces new technologies, a ton of work needs to get done to keep our engineering teams and leaders fully informed, educated, and performing. This internship is an opportunity to work across product teams, engineering leadership, Technical Training and Agile Practices Development to reach our engineering community with the tools, frameworks, practices, and processes that will secure their success in this rapidly changing software development landscape. You will also have an opportunity to post about your internship experience on our Autodesk Cloud Engineering blog! Responsibilities Learning how Autodesk builds, scales, and secures its cloud core platform. Learning Agile & Lean Methodologies such as Scrum and Kanban. Gaining experience with the latest technology trends in Agile Program Management. Supporting Technical Program Managers in management of Security domain technical programs through delivery. Gaining experience with communicating and coordinating across multiple stakeholders and cross-functional teams (engineering managers, product managers, developers, architects, etc.). Gaining experience with tracking, monitoring, and following up on program progress and blockers to ensure program milestones and objectives are met. Gaining experience with preparing and distributing program status reports and updates to appropriate audiences through various channels. Minimum Qualifications Full-time student pursuing a bachelors level computer science or engineering degree at an accredited program in the United States with at least one academic term to complete post internship, to be eligible for internship participation. Strong proficiency in critical thinking, communication, and organizational skills. Preferred Qualifications Experience with Project Management or Program Management. Familiarity with Software Development Lifecycle and Cyber Security. Knowledge of Agile & Lean methodologies. About The U.S. Intern Program The 2023 U.S. program runs for 12 weeks (May 22 – August 11 or June 12 – September 1). All internships are paid. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to contribute to meaningful projects, be mentored by industry leaders, work alongside peers from universities all over the country and participate in tech talks and other activities designed to support your personal and professional development. US recruiting begins in the Fall and concludes end of March. Our internships align with Autodesk’s Flexible Workplace approach, which is designed to meet the needs of our business while providing flexibility in support of office, remote and hybrid work preferences. You will be working with cutting-edge tools and technologies impacting the entire business. Our job is to thwart attacker’s efforts to compromise our employees, products, and customers by investigating incidents and intrusion attempts. Job Requisition ID # 22WD64303 Position Overview   Autodesk’s Platform Services and Emerging Technologies Experience Design (PSET XD) team is looking for an Experience Design Intern to help conduct research, benchmark how other companies are addressing similar customer needs, and work on design concepts for new features.   Reporting to a Manager of Experience Design, this position will work on delivering a richer and more cohesive user experience as we develop new collaboration features. You will work with user experience designers, product managers, content strategists, and researchers to establish and deliver on ambitious goals to bring measurable benefits to customers, as well as contributing to corporate priorities. This will be an excellent opportunity to get hands-on experience that has real impact on the company and our customers.   What You’ll Need To Bring This role requires a strategic mindset, critical thinking, and a thoughtful approach to organization, collaboration, and execution on behalf of the customer. At Autodesk we look to hire innovators who reimagine possible, those with diverse backgrounds who elevate our thinking, and leaders who shape the world and our future.   For consideration, candidates must include both a resume + portfolio with password (if required) when applying. Responsibilities Develop a research plan with our Research partners and participate in research Analyze customer feedback and present findings to stakeholders Collaborate with our design team to create new design concepts Minimum Qualifications A full-time student in a field related to user experience design, human-computer interaction, computer science, design research, or information science at an accredited program in the United States with at least one academic term to complete post internship to be eligible for internship participation Experienced with conducting qualitative research studies and documenting findings (research for class projects is acceptable) Ability to visualize and prototype intended solutions at various levels of fidelity, wireframes or mock-ups to conceptual presentations and diagrams using Figma. Clearly communicate ideas. Curious, collaborative, accountable, and communicative Has a high quality portfolio and can demonstrate measurable outcomes from project work About The US Intern Program The U.S. program runs from May through August for 12 weeks and will be remote (subject to change). All internships are paid. Interns have the opportunity to work alongside peers from universities all over the country and participate in intern events such as tech talks, mentoring, fun events, and more. US recruiting begins in the Fall and concludes end of March Our Team The Platform Services and Emerging Technologies (PSET) organization enables Autodesk product teams and Autodesk customers to accelerate outcomes by providing a trusted platform of shared and enabling capabilities.  PSET XD teams partner with Product Management and Engineering teams to deliver front end web-based experiences, APIs, services, and infrastructure that our customers and developers use to access, manage, and extend the capabilities of Autodesk’s design and make software. The Experience Design (XD) team within PSET includes interaction design, visual design, research, and content strategy.     About Autodesk At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD65091 Position Overview UX designers at Autodesk are savvy and passionate about creating beautiful, innovative solutions for critical, impactful problems. They grow their careers with a global team of passionate design professionals. In this role, you will apply and develop your experience in design and research skills as you help us craft the next generation of electronics functionality within the Autodesk Fusion 360 product. You will work closely with a team of talented UX designers, along with stakeholders from Product Management, Software Engineering, Software Architecture, Content Development, and Quality Assurance, to create compelling experiences that help our customers solve their most critical "design and make" problems. At Autodesk, you'll work on some of the most intriguing challenges you’ve ever seen; you’ll have a dynamic and collaborative workplace. You’ll be surrounded by intelligent and engaging people that love to brainstorm. If this sounds like your thing, read on! The ideal candidate has a strong eye for design, research and natural curiosity for solving unique problems with out-of-the-box thinking in a collaborative software environment. Responsibilities Prepare design assets to support customer research and data analysis. You may be called on to participate in live customer research activities so that you begin to build your understanding of the real problems our customers face. Help distil customer needs into a set of capabilities that will benefit the customer in the most effective way. Learn how business, marketing, design and technical opportunities, goals and constraints become integrated into product designs. You will be able to conceptualize and create pixel-perfect design mock-ups from sketches, wireframes, and other UX deliverables that represent your design thinking capabilities. You and your designs must communicate that experience to our colleagues across our stakeholder groups and our customers to validate conceptual designs. Deliver design documentation for use by a wide range of audiences including Software Development, Quality Assurance, Sales, and Marketing. Review feature implementation, test plans and documentation to ensure accuracy of desired results. Participate in design review sessions with other user experience designers and receive constructive feedback that will help you develop your design abilities Minimum Qualifications Must be at least 18 and enrolled in college or non-traditional education, such as design or UX boot camps or industry-related vocational classes, and returning to school or program after completing this internship. A mix of previous internships, school projects, volunteer, and leadership experience. Preferred Qualifications Exposure to mechanical engineering or industrial design Exposure to CAD software General familiarity with design software such as Figma or Sketch Exposure with graphical tools and software – preferably 3D modelling tools About The US Intern Program The 2023 U.S. program runs for 12 weeks (May 22 – August 11 or June 12 – September 1) and will be remote (subject to change). All internships are paid. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to contribute to meaningful projects, be mentored by industry leaders, work alongside peers from universities all over the country and participate in tech talks and other activities designed to support your personal and professional development. US recruiting begins in the Fall and concludes end of March. Our Internships align with Autodesk’s Flexible Workplace approach, which is designed to meet the needs of our business while providing flexibility in support of office, remote and hybrid work preferences. Job Requisition ID # 22WD65916 Position Overview Do you thrive in an environment where you can work on engaging and challenging projects? Every year Autodesk hires talented engineers to join our global teams and benefit from unlimited access to our technology and industry mentors. If this sounds like you… let's talk. We are expanding our support team for the Cloud Enablement and Workplace organization, part of Enterprise Systems & Experience organization, to enhance the company’s IT systems, applications, and processes. Our engineering culture will empower you to make effective decisions, work collaboratively, and take accountability for engineering projects at the core of the company. We are seeking for an experienced Cloud Administrator to help guide our journey towards becoming a world-class engineering team. Located in Eastern Time Zone preferably near Novi, MI. Responsibilities Leverage industry-leading/modern practices that allow for rapid iteration and customer-centric experiences, adopt and partner in the evolution of existing engineering, automation, and support practices currently in-place Operate, maintain, and troubleshoot Data Center versions of Jira and Confluence Collaborate with team members on support, maintenance, and troubleshooting of other enterprise applications such as Vault, Secret Server, JetBrains, Stoplight, and Autodesk custom software applications Ensure in-depth analysis of problems and initiate corrective actions and implementation of preventative measures Interact with and support customer’s ad-hoc questions through Slack and other service delivery and operations platforms Engage with customers to understand business requirements and determine the best implementation path Install, test, and implement new versions of applications or platforms Ensure the reliability and security of applications and the associated infrastructure Troubleshoot integrations to and from numerous external systems Implement corrective actions to avert system degradations or possible outages from OS and application layer Collaborate on development and platform administration efforts that are aligned with strategic goals using the Agile practices Define and document best practices, policies, and standards that ensure a resilient highly available service stack that delights internal customers Assist and mentor L1/L2 services teams to deliver high caliber, zero-touch and automated support for Jira, Confluence, and Job Requisition ID # 22WD64675 Position Overview Autodesk Construction Solutions is looking for a Principal Mobile Engineer to help us build the future faster. Our customers are building some of the most amazing construction projects in the world, and our mobile applications are among their essential tools. On the Autodesk Construction Solutions mobile engineering team you'll be building a powerful construction productivity app and platform which are improving outcomes and safety on the jobsite, transforming the lives and work of our customers and users. We work across a diverse set of technologies; in this role you will have the opportunity to get exposure to many technologies including Swift, Kotlin (including Kotlin Multiplatform), JavaScript, Python, C++, Objective-C, C#, Metal, Vulkan, and more. We develop cross-platform domain logic in Kotlin, so the features you end up leading will also have an impact across multiple platforms, including iOS, Android, Windows desktop and the Web. Responsibilities  Development and optimization of features related to the rendering and viewing of construction records in both 2D and 3D, pushing the boundaries of what's possible with both our native and web-based viewing and markups capabilities Contribute to the ongoing design, development and optimization of our offline data synchronization system which enables our users to view and collaborate on complex construction records and design files without an internet connection Collaborate across mobile development teams to contribute to and help steer our shared libraries written in Kotlin (domain logic) and/or C++ (graphics and related concerns) Spread your knowledge and expertise to help enable other mobile developers grow in their craft while improving the quality of existing solutions Minimum Qualifications At least 10 years of diverse professional software development experience Significant experience building apps for iOS or Android, and ideally more than one mobile or desktop platform Kotlin Multiplatform experience is a major plus; excitement to learn more about this emerging technology is key Interest and experience in refactoring and improving legacy code and systems Preferred Qualifications Experience with professional-grade developer testing including TDD/BDD, property-based testing, contract testing, and other engineering practices which help drive high quality outcomes Experience with at least one server-side framework (Rails, Django, Flask, etc.), database-related concepts, and multiple client platforms will all be important as you will have cross-platform and full-stack exposure Experience with geospatial concepts and/or graphics programming Interest in mentoring and technical leadership – in this role, you’ll have the opportunity to help drive the technical direction of critical aspects of our products, as well as helping to guide your colleagues' careers Domain knowledge of the construction industry (or other areas of AEC) and a strong user-centered approach to one's work Strong written and verbal communication skills About Autodesk Construction Solutions Autodesk has fully reimagined the construction business for the digital age, enabling companies to address the most important challenges they face today while preparing for new ways of working in the future. The Autodesk Construction Solutions (ACS) portfolio connects the office, trailer and field so customers can move seamlessly through each phase of a building’s lifecycle — from design and preconstruction to construction, turnover and operations — with best-in-class solutions that include Autodesk Construction Cloud, Assemble Systems, BIM 360, BuildingConnected and PlanGrid. General contractors, subcontractors, and owners around the world rely on ACS to win more work, enhance collaboration, speed decision-making, reduce risk, and improve overall project outcomes #ACSCareers At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk?
