Job Requisition ID # 22WD65667 The Security Team @ Autodesk Our team of security experts helps Autodesk design, build, deploy and maintain secure products. We are embedding security in the full spectrum of how we build our products from inception, design, development, testing to how we are running them in the cloud as well as how we are responding to any existing or emerging threats to our products or the building blocks of our products and services. Our job is to be one step ahead of the bad guys and use expertise, technology, and other resources to thwart their efforts to compromise our products and the environment in which they operate. Our team keeps a single-minded focus on protecting our customer’s data and their investment in our products by strengthening our applications, underlying services, and network. Position Overview Autodesk must secure its information assets, services, and products to build stakeholder trust and protect the privacy of our customers. A Lead Network Security engineer will design, build, optimize and deploy network security controls to protect Autodesk and its customers against all types of threats and threat adversaries. The role will build, secure, and operate systems that stop and/or prevent malicious activities, security violations, vulnerabilities, and other threats against Autodesk Infrastructure. This position will understand and research the latest network security threats, for deploying controls in the prevention, detection, and response to best secure the environment. Additionally, the role will evangelize security practices to protect Autodesk against information security risks. This role will work across many security teams including infrastructure, engineering, operations, product development, incident response, and red teaming. In addition, this position will actively collaborate and share ideas, thoughts and challenges with peers both inside and outside the company. Responsibilities Serve as a subject matter expert for Network Security to identify gaps, analyze innovative technologies and recommend automations, capabilities and integrations that improve the network security posture across various parts of the Autodesk Network Develop and deploy a zero-trust security model at Autodesk using capabilities like SASE, NAC, and CASB Design, build and operate security monitoring equipment for detection, protection and response including IDS/IPS, malware sandbox, packet capture, NetFlow tools, web application firewalls, real time application protection systems, log management, and SIEM Work collaboratively with internal stakeholders to standardize campus, multi-cloud, datacenter and internet firewall deployments and security policies associated with them Assist in implementation of regulatory compliance initiatives related to Infrastructure Security Work with partner teams across Autodesk to update network security policies, standards, guidelines, and training Assist with incident response and investigations as needed as SME in the area Work with different product and service teams to enhance and evangelize security in infrastructure and drive changes needed to respond to emerging threats Perform security review on firewall configurations based on operational requirements for various parts of Autodesk Networks (corporate, commercial, multi-cloud) Provide Security requirements for configuration management of various network devices and appliances Minimum Qualifications Minimum of 5 years of experience working in one or more of the following areas: Zero trust, IDS/IPS, VPN, SSL/IPSec, DNS and other Network Security technologies Minimum of 5 years of experience working in at least three of the following areas: Firewalls and encryption technologies, certificate management, cloud networking, WAF and DDoS protection, security logging and SIEM, device security and hardening, intrusion detection, Azure and AWS native security capabilities Master's degree (M.S.) in computer science, applied information technology, or related field, or bachelor's degree (B.A.) and equivalent work experience Strong knowledge of foundational security practices, vulnerabilities, risks and threats to analyze severity and impact to Autodesk Strong understanding of Networking, SD-WAN, firewalls, VPN, IPSec tunnels, WAF Strong understanding and working knowledge of the public cloud infrastructure and managed security services/capabilities in AWS/Azure network design, debugging, testing and documentation skills Strong understanding of security technologies including host and network-based protection and detection technologies Preferred Qualifications Knowledge of SASE and cloud firewalls/VPN capabilities is a plus Knowledge of Azure Identity, proxy, CASB, network and layer-7 firewalls Strong understanding of common protocols and cryptographic standards and ability to guide secure implementations Strong interpersonal skills Ability to work independently in unstructured situations with little oversight Strong analytical and problem-solving skills At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. Job Requisition ID # 22WD65667 The Security Team @ Autodesk Our team of security experts helps Autodesk design, build, deploy and maintain secure products. We are embedding security in the full spectrum of how we build our products from inception, design, development, testing to how we are running them in the cloud as well as how we are responding to any existing or emerging threats to our products or the building blocks of our products and services. Our job is to be one step ahead of the bad guys and use expertise, technology, and other resources to thwart their efforts to compromise our products and the environment in which they operate. Our team keeps a single-minded focus on protecting our customer’s data and their investment in our products by strengthening our applications, underlying services, and network. Position Overview Autodesk must secure its information assets, services, and products to build stakeholder trust and protect the privacy of our customers. A Lead Network Security engineer will design, build, optimize and deploy network security controls to protect Autodesk and its customers against all types of threats and threat adversaries. The role will build, secure, and operate systems that stop and/or prevent malicious activities, security violations, vulnerabilities, and other threats against Autodesk Infrastructure. This position will understand and research the latest network security threats, for deploying controls in the prevention, detection, and response to best secure the environment. Additionally, the role will evangelize security practices to protect Autodesk against information security risks. This role will work across many security teams including infrastructure, engineering, operations, product development, incident response, and red teaming. In addition, this position will actively collaborate and share ideas, thoughts and challenges with peers both inside and outside the company. Responsibilities Serve as a subject matter expert for Network Security to identify gaps, analyze innovative technologies and recommend automations, capabilities and integrations that improve the network security posture across various parts of the Autodesk Network Develop and deploy a zero-trust security model at Autodesk using capabilities like SASE, NAC, and CASB Design, build and operate systems, log management, and SIEM Work collaboratively with internal stakeholders to standardize campus, multi-cloud, datacenter and internet firewall deployments and security policies associated with guidelines, and training Assist with incident response and investigations as needed as SME in the area Work with different product and service teams to enhance and evangelize security in infrastructure and drive changes needed to respond to emerging threats Perform security review on firewall configurations based on operational requirements for various parts of Autodesk Networks Job Requisition ID # 22WD65025 Position Overview Make an Impact –Join the Growing Autodesk Security Compliance Team! Come join the Security Compliance team at Autodesk as a Senior Security Compliance analyst and you will have the opportunity to gain valuable insight and experience with protecting high scale cloud services within a dynamic, energetic and rapidly changing environment. As a Security and Compliance Analyst, you will be a part of a talented team that designs, builds and deploys secure, safe and trusted solutions that protect Autodesk and its customers. against advanced adversaries. You will have the opportunity to work across many teams including Sales, Privacy, Infrastructure, Legal, Engineering, and Operations. You will also support security initiatives by engaging various process owners in the design, documentation, implementation, and monitoring of IT controls in our environments, and helping demonstrating adherence to these controls with external auditors. The Autodesk Security team is looking for someone who is a motivated self-starter who is inspired by the idea of driving change within a rapidly growing environment. Responsibilities Contribute to the maturation of Autodesk’s Security Compliance team by contributing to the development of its integrated control framework, automated test processes and evidence collection Lead the planning, scheduling and preliminary analysis for internal and external audit projects Possess the vision and ambition to grow and improve the way Autodesk performs their compliance assessments Coordinate audit activities across Autodesk, including the notification and scheduling for all affected parties of audit timing, scope, objectives, approach and deliverables Work closely with external auditors and internal audit teams on managing and supporting audits Perform compliance assessments of technology infrastructure and operational processes and controls for assigned areas Complete audit testing, inquiry, observation and other analysis required to meet objectives of audit projects Keep existing policies and procedures aligned with audit and security requirements Communicate the progress and results of audits throughout the engagement Contribute to and develop value added recommendations to address issues Automate manual tasks around Security Assurance and Audits Monitor implementation of outstanding audit recommendations and validate Minimum Qualifications Minimum 5 years of internal or external audit experience, with exposure to the following regulatory and compliance frameworks preferred: AT101 SOC2 Type 2, ISO2700x, FedRamp, Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX), PCI-DSS, etc. Knowledge base related to controlling and securing system platforms (including Unix and Windows), database platforms, endpoint platforms, and network infrastructure is preferred Knowledge of Amazon Web Services, Container and Serverless technologies. Enthusiastic about your work, self starter, and possess qualities of an innovative thinker. Have the motivation and ability to quickly acquire and apply knowledge of changing technologies implemented is essential Have the ability to use a risk-based audit approach in evaluations of and recommendations for management processes. Have the ability to use a risk-based audit approach in evaluations of and recommendations for management processes Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) and/or Certified in Risk and Information Systems Control (CRISC) strongly preferred. Other certifications add value such as Certified in Governance of Enterprise IT (CGEIT), Certified Information Security Manager (CISM), Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), CPA, and/or CIA. Privacy certifications such as CIPP(US/E) or CIPT are a plus Preferred Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems or related field, or equivalent experience The ability and desire to effectively promote ideas and collaborate between the various teams and management levels within the organization Be flexible and have the ability to adapt to a changing environment, meet deadlines and handle multiple projects Possess the tenacity to pursue difficult and sensitive issues to an acceptable conclusion Maintain excellent communication, interpersonal and time management skills Excellent analytical and organizational skills combined with the ambition, ingenuity and the ability to work as part of a team Demonstrated ability to learn quickly and take on new commitments Have the determination and ability to solve complex problems At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. jobTitle: Lead Security Engineer, IAM & Zero Trust
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD63989 Title: Lead Security Engineer, IAM and Zero Trust Location: Remote, USA Position Overview We seek a talented and driven individual to serve as Senior Security Engineer, IAM and Zero Trust. This role will drive and execute IAM strategy across products and enterprise IT at Autodesk. Partnering with security leadership, you will set the vision and direction for IAM programs, mentor the team, and champion security efforts through cross-functional collaboration with stakeholders. The ideal candidate will have experience driving and implementing IAM at scale across products, enterprise IT, and hybrid cloud in a highly dynamic and fast-changing zero trust environments. This position can be based on any of our office locations or a home office. Responsibilities Build and deploy security solutions, frameworks, automation, and orchestration to secure, automate and scale zero trust ecosystem Evolve our IAM posture in line with industry-recognized practices, frameworks, and regulations (including FedRAMP) Build and maintain critical. IAM infrastructure, including Azure AD, MFA, SSO, etc. Partner with Incident Response on investigations Mentor a team of engineers, and individual contributors Consulting on security initiatives related to a mixture of desktop, web, and mobile apps, which all leverage cloud services Drive and influence security across the organization Minimum Qualifications 5+ years of hands-on experience in IAM Experience with securing zero trust ecosystems at scale Experience with Active Directory (including Azure AD), MFA, SSO, AWS IAM, and Okta Strong security background, especially in the fields of IAM, application security, or cloud security Hands-on experience with cloud computing technologies, especially AWS (Amazon Web Services), Azure, or GCP (Google Cloud Platform) Decision maker with the ability to operate with freedom and autonomy Emphasis on a data-driven, decision-making mindset Strong written and verbal communication skills Experience working with distributed teams and other cross-functional stakeholders Highly collaborative in a fast-paced team environment Security @ Autodesk Our team of security experts helps Autodesk design, build, deploy and maintain secure products. We are embedding security in the full spectrum of how we build our products from inception, design, development, testing to how we are running them in the cloud as well as how we are responding to any existing or emerging threats to our products or the building blocks of our products and services. Our job is to be one step ahead of the bad guys and use expertise, technology, and other resources to thwart their efforts to compromise our products and the environment in which they operate. Our team keeps a single-minded focus on protecting our customer’s data and their investment in our products by strengthening our applications, underlying services, and network. Job Requisition ID # 22WD63749 Position Overview We are looking for an experienced communications professional to join our team to develop and manage communications for the Legal & Government Affairs department, and to partner with our Chief Legal Officer (CLO) on their executive communications strategy. Our ideal candidate brings strategic thinking, intellectual curiosity, energy, creativity, and is policy curious. This role reports into the Director of Legal Operations and will partner with the executive communications team. Responsibilities Develop an internal communications strategy and create content to help inform the Legal team, run by our CLO, and drive the message of the organization across the company For the legal communications plan, this may include: quarterly all hands, the department’s newsletter, promotion announcements, ask-me-anything (AMA) sessions, consistently formatted and on-brand templates, and management of internal and external facing websites for the department For the CLO executive communications plan, this may include: developing a CLO narrative in partnership with the Exec communications team, social media support, helping with external speaking opportunities, thought leadership, writing general communication to the department, and development of an editorial calendar For the Government Affairs & Public Policy team, this may include developing policy related communications and collateral for the greater Autodesk community Deeply embed in the organization and participate in meetings as requested with CLO and Legal leadership, helping shape strategy, providing a point of view (POV) on what and how news and information should be communicated, and debating that POV with direct staff Work closely with the Autodesk executive communications team and with partners across the company on communications projects as needed and in the best interests of the company and its employees Work directly with our CLO and key subject-matter experts to develop the narrative arcs for and create presentations and talks to be given to customers, shareholders, and employees Develop ways to reuse this content by other leaders within Legal and in other parts of the company Ensure internal messages are communicated through various channels in a clear, timely and effective manner, using a high-impact writing style and format Continually improve, measure, and evaluate effectiveness of communications strategy and methods Pitch in where appropriate to help teammates out on high-priority communications & events-related projects Minimum Qualifications Excellent writer, with the skills to distill complex content into clear, concise and engaging communications, and able to write with speed and accuracy Understanding of the legal and policy issues facing the software and technology space- understanding of Autodesk’s business and industries Legal knowledge/understanding of data and privacy strongly preferred Strategic and creative thinker comfortable debating and defending their ideas Strong storyteller with the ability to create compelling narratives in support of our business strategies Experience developing and executing communications strategies, plans, programs, and events Strong presence and confidence which will help build high credibility with senior executives Ability to influence without authority, across functions, geographies and levels, and the ability to work with various departments and teams to drive alignment and collaboration Ability to be flexible, proactive, work under deadlines, and ensure quality and accuracy Focused and performance-driven Strong attention to detail and project management skills 5+ years of experience in communications and/or employee communications Exceptional PowerPoint skills, knowledge of the MS Teams, Proze, and SharePoint is a plus Four-year college degree (BS or BA), preferably in English, communications or journalism; or equivalent work experience and excellent writing and communications skills Occasional travel required; will need to commute periodically into San Francisco location At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD66005 Position Overview Autodesk is looking for a qualified, eager and professional candidate for a Legal Financial Analyst role. The ideal candidate will have experience in an accounting/finance role, be very detail oriented, and have a strong work ethic. This role will be reporting to the Financial and Vendor Program Manager for Legal Operations, and you will collaborate closely with our partners in Legal, Finance, IT, and our external vendors. You have a knack for picking up technology, love numbers, and enjoy making things better. Please note that this role may be eligible for a flexible working schedule that allows for a hybrid and in-office presence. Responsibilities Data validation of accrual and forecast submissions Vendor submission follow up queries Execute the accrual reconciliation process within CounselCommand Manage the day-to-day operations of ebilling processes support including PO creation, tracking run rates, and publishing of reports for in-house counsel Improve processes by simplifying and automating manual-based efforts Summarizing and auditing of information post receipt, includes verification, producing roll-up reports, ad-hoc emails and other communications, landing quarter activities Reconcile forecast submissions with invoices processed for payment and processed QTR to date Communicate and publish final forecasts as well as roll-up reports Early period accruals and forecast clean-up through vendor/matter assessments, reconciliation of previous activity, communication, escalation Reach out to AP team for status invoice payment (to eliminate possible over accruals) Finalization and report out of performance management Analyzing our budget, forecast and accruals on a monthly basis and pointing out areas of potential consolidation/savings Work closely with inhouse and the Autodesk finance team Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, business, or related field 2 – 5 years related accounting/finance experience (legal industry a plus) Strong analytical skills and attention to detail Ability to think critically and problem solve At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Job Requisition ID # 22WD65600 Position Overview Autodesk Construction Solutions is seeking an outstanding candidate to join our Demand Generation Marketing team and participate in transforming marketing at Autodesk. Your primary focus is on developing a content strategy and tactics for email, webinars, and chatbots that drive awareness and adoption of the Autodesk Construction Solutions platform. Reporting to the Manager, Marketing Automation, the Lifecycle Marketing Specialist will own the development of targeted and relevant automated campaigns to take our prospects through our email and webinar channel and nurture them into happy customers. This role will also collaborate and work closely with growth, content, product marketing, and marketing operations to ensure successful execution across various campaign activities. The ideal candidate has experience with strategizing and developing nurture campaigns (email, webinar, chatbot, etc.), with familiarity with CRM and database functionality.   Responsibilities   Ideate and execute lifecycle marketing campaigns such as nurture flows and post-conversion communications, from copywriting, proofreading, and segmentation creation to reporting Initiate and manage email campaigns end-to-end in collaboration with internal stakeholders (marketing, sales, customer support, content, product management, etc.) Plan optimization and growth opportunities through A/B and multivariate tests to gain further insights into customer behavior Report on campaign performance, including open rates, click-throughs, unsubscribes, and lead conversion, and derive insights and learnings Project manage campaigns and communicate with external stakeholders for reviews and approvals—guide the creative, copy, and development teams to produce designs that share a cohesive and logical brand story Help set the direction for content optimization for webinar and email channel by analyzing campaign successes: webinar content, landing pages, eBooks, whitepapers, display creatives, and social creatives Work cross-functionally with other Autodesk marketing groups to ensure optimal implementation of various marketing materials within demand generation programs Minimum Qualifications   3+ years in lifecycle marketing, CRM marketing roles (Experience in the B2B SaaS industry, or in Digital Marketing agencies working with SaaS is a plus) You have a deep passion for developing and optimizing the lifecycle journeys and designing personalized campaigns that benefit and improve customer experience Proficient in Marketing Automation tools (Marketo is preferred) Detail-oriented with a high degree of organizational skills to be able to multi-task multiple programs at various stages (Asana experience a plus) Goals and results driven. Highly motivated with a sense of urgency and willingness to adjust in a fast-paced team environment Strong analytical skills and a high comfort level working with data (experience building reporting in Looker is a bonus!) Solid interpersonal skills. Must be a sharp, energetic, assertive, and results-oriented individual. Able to prioritize and focus in a rapidly evolving environment  About Autodesk Construction Solutions Autodesk has fully reimagined the construction business for the digital age, enabling company/ies to address the most important challenges they face today while preparing for new ways of working in the future. The Autodesk Construction Solutions (ACS) portfolio connects the office, trailer and field so customers can move seamlessly through each phase of a building’s lifecycle — from design and preconstruction to construction, turnover and operations — with best-in-class solutions that include Assemble Systems, BIM 360, BuildingConnected and PlanGrid. General contractors, subcontractors, and owners around the world rely on ACS to win more work, enhance collaboration, speed decision-making, reduce risk, and improve overall project outcomes. At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. The ideal candidate has experience with strategizing and developing nurture campaigns (email, webinar, chatbot, etc.), with familiarity with CRM and database functionality.   Responsibilities   Ideate and execute lifecycle marketing campaigns such as nurture flows and post-conversion communications, from copywriting, proofreading, and segmentation creation to reporting Initiate and manage email campaigns end-to-end in collaboration with internal stakeholders (marketing, sales, customer support, content, product management, etc.) Plan optimization and growth opportunities through A/B and multivariate tests to gain further insights into customer behavior Report on campaign performance, including open rates, click-throughs, unsubscribes, and lead conversion, and derive insights and learnings Project manage campaigns and communicate with external stakeholders for reviews and approvals—guide the creative, copy, and development teams to produce designs that share a cohesive and logical brand story Help set the direction for content optimization for webinar and email channel by analyzing campaign successes: webinar content, landing pages, eBooks, whitepapers, display creatives, and social creatives Work cross-functionally with other Autodesk marketing groups to ensure optimal implementation of various marketing materials within demand generation programs Minimum Qualifications   3+ years in lifecycle marketing, CRM marketing roles (Experience in the B2B SaaS industry, or in Digital Marketing agencies working with SaaS is a plus) You have a deep passion for developing and optimizing the lifecycle journeys and designing personalized campaigns that benefit and improve customer experience Proficient in Marketing Automation tools (Marketo is preferred) Detail-oriented with a high degree of organizational skills to be able to multi-task multiple programs at various stages (Asana experience a plus) Goals and results driven. Highly motivated with a sense of urgency and willingness to adjust in a fast-paced team environment Strong analytical skills and a high comfort level working with data (experience building reporting in Looker is a bonus!) Solid interpersonal skills. Must be a sharp, energetic, assertive, and results-oriented individual. Able to prioritize and focus in a rapidly evolving environment  About Autodesk Construction Solutions Autodesk has fully reimagined the construction business for the digital age, enabling company/ies to address the most important challenges they face today while preparing for new ways of working in the future. The Autodesk Construction Solutions (ACS) portfolio connects the office, trailer and field so customers can move seamlessly through each phase of a building’s lifecycle — from design and preconstruction to construction, turnover and operations — with best-in-class solutions that include Assemble Systems, BIM 360, BuildingConnected and PlanGrid. General contractors, subcontractors, and owners around the world rely on ACS to win more work, enhance collaboration, speed decision-making, reduce risk, and improve overall project outcomes. At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Job Requisition ID # 22WD65673 Position Overview At Autodesk, we believe that our success depends on our customer's success - and we deliver technology solutions to help them meet their business objectives. This is a rare opportunity to join our Named Accounts sales team where we focus on building strategic relationships with Autodesk's key enterprise customers. The Named Account Sales Executive is a key sales role that directly interfaces with large named accounts both domestically and internationally. The Named Account Sales Executive is responsible for growing the business relationship within the Account(s) to meet/exceed financial and business objectives. At the most senior levels, the Named Account Sales Executive will be responsible for achieving sales goals for one or more large global named accounts. This direct sales role, based in United States, covers a couple of the most recognized technology and media companies in the world and spans our full portfolio - AEC, PD&M and M&E. You will have the opportunity to help these influential customers navigate the challenges associated with digital transformation and industry convergence for all that they make including (but not limited to) the digital infrastructure that powers the cloud, the devices that simplify your life and the platforms behind well-known entertainment brands. Responsibilities Establish Unique Customer Business Value Develop important and effective relationships Align with executive led business initiatives Translates customer challenges and opportunities into business value Position Autodesk as a trusted advisor Account Team Leadership Develop, communicate and execute customer-specific enterprise level strategies Build an effective business plan and execute upon the plan Orchestrate and align resources across the Autodesk matrix Communicate at all levels internally (and externally), including C-level Embed continuous improvement – strong change manager Grow the opportunity pipeline Drive Results Achieve high growth revenue and consumption targets from existing and new customers Grow faster than the competition – gain market share Ensure best in class forecasting Meet/exceed targets (revenue, consumption, billings, etc.) Effectively negotiate enterprise contracts Minimum Qualifications Proven direct sales track record in quota carrying roles with large enterprises Proven track-record in managing and growing global accounts Strong sales process and account planning skills Strong team selling and leadership skills History of successfully navigating complex contract negotiation Software/SaaS experience Passion for disruptive technology Highly driven, determined, integrity focused & business-oriented “Challenger Mentality” capable of delivery “Thought Leadership” POV Basic understanding, or aptitude to quickly learn, of the AEC eco-system, BIM, Digital Twins and platform (PaaS) sales The Ideal Candidate Drives Business Results - Meets/exceeds annual and multi-year targets (Revenue, Bookings, Billings, etc.), maximizes individual sales opportunities. Able to create effective proposals that link our solution to the customer business. Able to Leverage our pricing, packaging and business models to maximize returns and unique business value. Effectively negotiates customer agreements Develops Accounts - Develops important and effective relationships within the account including Key Executives, translates customer challenges and opportunities into unique business value, ensures the Autodesk team delivers Business Value to the Account(s), builds effective Account Business plan and execute upon the plan, builds, maintains and grows opportunity pipeline within Account(s), uses sound call planning to drive business results and makes continuous improvement in moving Autodesk from vendor to trusted advisor Executes Strong Business Practices - Provides timely, accurate and detailed forecasts, effectively leverages chosen sales processes, tools and methodologies, provides effective internal information as requested (i.e. Ops reviews, customer info…), constructs internal/external presentations in an effective and professional manner Leads the Extended Sales Team - Coordinates, influences and orchestrates all of the appropriate resources for Account and/or Opportunity development, able to build and influence a global/ virtual team (sales, support and consulting), develops strong working relations across GEOs and functions (finance, operations, division, etc.) Contributes to the Broader Autodesk Team - Makes contributions to Autodesk outside of Account(s)/territory, for example participates on core team, brings new idea into business and develops sales tools or new approaches On Target earnings (Colorado / New York): $230K At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? You will have the opportunity to help these influential customers navigate the challenges associated with digital transformation and industry convergence for all that they make including (but not limited to) the digital infrastructure that powers the cloud, the devices that simplify your life and the platforms behind well-known entertainment brands. Job Requisition ID # 22WD64741 Position Overview Autodesk is looking for a Network Engineer to join the Global Network Engineering team. Come join us in our journey to provide our customers with a world class campus offices, SAAS platform, enabling imaginative and industry changing Autodesk products. As a member of the Network Engineering Team, you will be responsible for maturing campus network, designing, implementing, monitoring and managing the local and wide area networks etc. You will participate in cross-team and organizational projects, designing, documenting, and implementing new and secure networking solutions. Responsibilities Design, Configure and Deploy Network Infrastructure (LAN/WAN) - Campus and Data center Perform hardware refreshes (Firewalls, Router, Switch, SD WAN, Wifi) Implement Remote access VPN solutions Configure firewall access requests Rack/cable/label in the Campus offices as needed Create and maintain diagrams and documentation Maintain stock inventory (prod, stock) Participate in weekly scrum and cross team calls Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in CS or related field, or equivalent work experience 5+ years of experience in large-scale network and cloud-based Infrastructure CCNP and above, or equivalent experience Well-developed verbal and written communication skills Thorough understanding of LAN and WAN technologies Should be well versed in route redistribution Experience with Cisco Nexus and Catalyst switches, Cisco / Mist Wifi SD-WAN experience Proven ability to work effectively within an Agile framework Skilled at presenting technical policies, proposals, and designs Participate in organizational objective planning sessions Cross-train and mentor teammates REMOTE WORK OK Preferred Qualifications CCNA, CCNP Wifi certifications At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD65583 Position Overview Autodesk is looking for a Network Engineer to join the Global Network Engineering team. Come join us in our journey to provide our customers with a world class SAAS platform, enabling imaginative and industry changing Autodesk products. We are looking for passionate Network Engineers who are fascinated by the technologies behind the Internet, data centers and cloud computing. The team is crucial to the design & deployment of a consistent, stable infrastructure that both meets network engineering design standards and product goals. As a member of the Network Engineering Team, you will maintain advanced networking and security technologies. You will troubleshoot, implement, and improve standards, implementations, and procedures related to all cloud and data center networking technologies, including but not limited to, LAN/WAN, switches, routers, load balancers, and firewalls. You will participate in cross-team and organizational projects, designing, documenting, and implementing new and secure networking solutions. Responsibilities Improve and engage in the entire lifecycle of a network, including inception, network design, qualification, deployment, operation, and optimization Work on implementation of Autodesk’s Global Networking backbone strategic infrastructure initiatives Create and update our network standards and ensure that the network is deployed to these standards Work closely with our automation teams in defining the tools that allow us to scale at outstanding volume Automate networking related tasks and build self-service tools Develop an enterprise scale SASE solution Participate in organizational objective planning sessions Manage relationships with third party vendors Cross-train and mentor teammates Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in CS or related field, or equivalent work experience 4-6+ years of experience in Routing & Switching Knowledge of Dark Fiber and the technologies surrounding it Python, Ansible, DevOps Methodology knowledge is also preferred Experience with BGP Peering relationship management Knowledge of AWS, Azure networking design and services Able to design, secure, and automate AWS networking infrastructure Infrastructure automation proficiency (Terraform, CloudFormation, etc.) Good level of proficiency and experience with TCP/IP networking, architecture, and core technologies, such as MPLS, BGP, DNS, IPsec, etc. Knowledge of firewalls, security configurations and troubleshooting Proven ability to work effectively within an Agile framework. Skilled at presenting technical policies, proposals, and designs Clear communicator with a positive attitude Ability to manage long term, project/milestone-based work with multiple teams Preferred Qualifications Cisco CCNA Cisco CCNP At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD65107 Position Overview Autodesk is seeking a motivated and experienced Product Manager to join the Order Processing are of Core Finance Engineering team. In this role, you will be working closely with the engineering, product management teams and the System Integrator to define, test and execute the product roadmap for the platform. This is an exciting opportunity to participate in the modernization and simplification of our order capture platform and enable business model flexibility in a lean/agile environment by contributing to an organization committed to continuous improvement. Responsibilities As a Product Manager within the Core Finance team, you will be responsible for partnering with cross-functional stakeholders to define, develop and deliver the features that underlies our domain and use cases we support Must have experience creating technical user stories, roadmaps, process flows and writing detailed wiki documentation, and managing a story backlog Translates product roadmap features into well-defined product requirements including features, user stories, and acceptance test criteria Must be able to draw Project roadmap and interact with Business owner, onshore team & Global Engineering team to drive the project end to end Knowledge of software engineering disciplines, test driven development and development methodologies Works with cross-functional teams and various stakeholders, including analytics, design/user experience, engineering, and user enablement Must be well versed with best Agile practices and framework Excellent Frontline leadership and communication skills (written and oral) Clearly document, manage, and prioritize defects from multiple sources Collaborate with teams in multiple Geographies Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree or higher in computer science, engineering, business, or related field 8+ years of relevant experience in roles such as Product Manager, Quality Analyst or Project Manager for a technical product Must have experience with Order Management, Billing, Subscription Management & Sales Commissions etc. Ability to state things simply and persuasively for a variety of audiences - internal, external, business and technical Must understand the business value of engineering decisions and how they affect the life cycle of the product Experience with agile software development is MUST (particularly SCRUM) MUST have experience with one of these Technology S4 HANA, Open Text or BRIM MUST have Software or High-Tech industry experience Self-motivated/independent/resourceful At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Responsibilities As a Product Manager within the Core Finance team, you will be responsible for partnering with cross-functional stakeholders to define, develop and deliver the features that underlies our domain and use cases we support Must have experience creating technical user stories, roadmaps, process flows and writing detailed wiki documentation, and managing a story backlog Translates product roadmap features into well-defined product requirements including features, user stories, and acceptance test criteria Must be able to draw Project roadmap and interact with Business owner, onshore team & Global Engineering team to drive the project end to end Knowledge of software engineering disciplines, test driven development and development methodologies Works with cross-functional teams and various stakeholders, including analytics, design/user experience, engineering, and user enablement Must be well versed with best Agile practices and framework Excellent Frontline leadership and communication skills (written and oral) Clearly document, manage, and prioritize defects from multiple sources Collaborate with teams in multiple Geographies Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree or higher in computer science, engineering, business, or related field 8+ years of relevant experience in roles such as Product Manager, Quality Analyst or Project Manager for a technical product Must have experience with Order Management, Billing, Subscription Management & Sales Commissions etc. Ability to state things simply and persuasively for a variety of audiences - internal, external, business and technical Must understand the business value of engineering decisions and how they affect the life cycle of the product Experience with agile software development is MUST (particularly SCRUM) MUST have experience with one of these Technology S4 HANA, Open Text or BRIM MUST have Software or High-Tech industry experience Self-motivated/independent/resourceful At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD65689 Position Overview As Intellectual Property Paralegal, you will support the team of attorneys and specialists focused on protecting Autodesk’s intellectual property assets to enable Autodesk’s success. Collaborating closely with your colleagues in the Autodesk IP team, the broader Autodesk Legal Department, and other Autodesk business teams, you will provide key paralegal support for Autodesk’s trade secret, patent, and intellectual property programs. Responsibilities Work closely with the Autodesk IP team to develop and execute on Autodesk’s intellectual property strategy Establish and maintain internal practices, policies, and procedures to improve efficiency, productivity, and communication within Autodesk’s patent and trade secret programs Collaborate with legal and business teams on administration of Autodesk’s trade secret program, including creation of behavioral guidelines and adherence to protective measures Collaborate with outside counsel to support U.S. and foreign patent filing and prosecution Manage IP-related initiatives and operations, including Autodesk’s patent incentive program Proactively partner with the Autodesk Legal Operations team and other members of the Autodesk Legal team to learn and apply best practices for information sharing, knowledge-management, and collaboration tools Support interactions with business colleagues, such as communications, development of presentation materials, and meeting planning Manage and maintain IP docketing system, including enhancements to improve usability and productivity Exercise sound judgment and strong organizational and communication skills in management of projects related to trade secret and patent programs Provide general administrative support for Autodesk’s trade secret and patent programs and for internal training programs to build awareness of the importance of intellectual property and to drive best practices to both leverage and protect those assets Commutable to our SF office. Minimum Qualifications 2-4 years' experience as a paralegal or administrative specialist in the area of intellectual property law (with at least 2 years at a law firm preferred) You are organized and detail-oriented, with excellent analytical and project management skills You are tech-savvy, with the desire and ability to master databases, collaboration tools, and knowledge-management tools You have excellent written and oral communication skills You have creative problem-solving skills and are an open-minded thinker when approaching new tasks You take initiative to improve work processes and simplify tasks – you enjoy making things efficient and streamlined You are intellectually curious and love learning something new every day You approach challenges with energy and a positive attitude You are comfortable interacting warmly and professionally with everyone from the senior executives to interns – you recognize that you don’t know everything and can learn from anyone You hold yourself and others accountable and you welcome feedback You are committed to personal and professional growth You are passionate about making a positive impact Preferred Qualifications Prior in-house experience supporting trade secret or patent programs as a paralegal or administrative specialist Prior experience successfully managing projects start to finish Prior experience establishing practices, policies, and procedures to improve efficiency and productivity Prior experience supporting an individual or team with organizational tasks A desire and ability to constantly improve yourself and the programs you engage in Familiarity with IP docketing systems, such as Lecorpio At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD64980 Position Overview The Premier Expert supports sales efforts of the Named Accounts sales organizations, helping them achieve and exceed revenue goals, ensuring high standards of account data integrity, while delivering a positive customer experience. The Premier Expert ensures processing and completion of all global direct and direct-led Named Account orders in a timely and efficient manner. Location: San Francisco United States Responsibilities Office Administration Streamline customer facing back-office processes to increase and maintain a high level of customer satisfaction Through research and engagement with members of the Deal Operations Organization, anticipate potential areas of risk and proactively drive areas of opportunity Interfaces with the following internal partners when deemed necessary: Client Services Team (CS), NPI, Access Fulfilment Legal Customer Financial Services (CFS) Sales and Deal Operations Finance Business Partner Licensing and Data Management Tax Manager Product Support Team Consulting Team Revenue Recognition Team Be Proactive Build customer and sales relationship in-person or by phone. Proactively suggest solutions based on knowledge of customer’s business and past purchase history Validate quotes for Named Accounts Sales Pre-Sales, provide information regarding product availability. upgrade paths, pricing based on the customer’s agreement with Autodesk such as Enterprise Business Agreement Post-Sales, provide information regarding order status, license fulfillment, and asset status. Perform asset changes in the database to fulfill the customers’ needs Provide service within agreed upon Service Level Agreements (SLA's) to customers, both internal and external Identify and escalate sales opportunities that require an Application Engineer or Piracy involvement to Named Account Sales manager Recommend to management solutions to difficult customer issues ensuring customer needs are always met Be Investigative Ensure that direct and direct-led Named Account orders have appropriate information prior to submittal for processing, complying with Legal, G9 policies, and SOX compliance Contribute to complex direct and direct-led deals, such as Token-flex, ETRs. Ensure that deals comply with Deal Review Board (DRB), Legal, G9 policies Generate and analyze regular and ad hoc license reports for Sales representatives and/or Channel Partners Investigate and respond to customer inquiries regarding shipments, products, verifications, registration, and complaints Work closely with the Registration & Activation Team to ensure the customers’ license file needs are met. Work closely with the Technical Assistance and Customer Success Managers to fulfill any requests related to asset management Research and resolve issues concerning, chargeback, commission, missing data and Return Material Authorization (RMA) product Analyze and research historical data to solve customer issues. Log quality problems or issues Ensure high level of customer satisfaction by responding to escalations in a timely manner. By providing appropriate resolutions and identifying trends that will increase internal and external efficiency Be Engaged Participate in global initiatives for enhancing the overall Named Account experience including educating the customer on resources available including self-service tools Work closely with Sales for quarter-end activities, such as order compliance and cut-off dates Interface and partner with other departments to ensure seamless deal processing for Named Accounts As part of the Deal Support Team, drive and manage activities to support the development of enterprise deals Maintain up-to-date knowledge of Autodesk’s competitive positioning in the marketplace to ensure seamless, extraordinary service for Named Accounts Be knowledgeable of your individual and team NPS scores, drivers, and identify ways to improve experience Create/maintain global process documentation based on expertise in specific job areas. Work with worldwide Premier Team to document best practices Other duties as assigned by management Minimum Qualifications BA/BS or equivalent experience A minimum of 5 years customer service or sales support experience Preferred Qualifications Strong organizational and time management skills. Ability to juggle multiple projects and priorities Excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills Knowledge of Autodesk client-based markets Motivated by individual and team achievement Has experience providing support to sales personnel and customers Has worked with all basic transactions and record-keeping functions Able to research and respond to customer queries and requests Has assisted in developing proposals, presentations, newsletters, BC documentation, etc. Maintain customer and sales-related information in line with record-keeping requirements Compensation: 68k annually plus 8% AIP bonus EOY. jobTitle: Principal Service Design Lead, PT through ET zones
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD65034 Position Overview We are seeking a highly experienced Principal Service Design Lead reporting to the Head of Digital Customer Experience within the Digital Experience & Customer Empowerment (DXC) organization. The DXC team is responsible for ensuring delivery of a seamless experience across the full customer life cycle from discovery, consider, buy, onboard, use, and extend. Our experience team partners with marketing, sales, customer success, legal, engineering, product management, analytics, user research/insights and others to achieve success together. This role will help lead, guide, and grow our service design capabilities that shapes the end-to-end journey of our products and services, enabling users to achieve their goals, and the business to deliver on our goals and outcome. You may come from many backgrounds, and we are interested in those who, in addition to being an experienced Service Design practitioner, has depth in one or more of the following areas: Research, UX Design, Visual Design, Prototyping, Business Design and Value Proposition. As a Principal Lead Service Designer within the Experience Design and Customer Insights team, you will be a key contributor, working across departments and teams to design impactful end-to-end experiences that enhance the customer experience (CX) and help empower our employee experience (EX). You will collaborate with a multi-disciplinary team that includes researchers, UX designers, product designers, content writers, product managers, engineers, and business partners who share your passion for delivering innovative end-to-end experiences that will differentiate Autodesk in the marketplace. Responsibilities Lead holistic service design activities leveraging a variety of human-centered design methods and frameworks Map persona-based user journeys with a holistic view of the experience by identifying critical touchpoints and moments that matter, how those touchpoints are connected, and how people experience the Autodesk brand both internally and externally Identify user types, scenarios, journeys, flow/decision maps and produce relevant documentation to coordinate and deliver an end-to-end vision Co-creation: facilitate collaborative workshops with partners across functions Design and prototyping: co-create solutions ranging from a strategic level to a tactical one Produce artifacts such as journey maps, service design blueprints, service prototypes Co-facilitate design thinking training sessions to help partners across the organization from non-design backgrounds in understanding how we can co-create to collectively achieve our goals and outcomes Manage planning and delivery of your part of projects to time and quality measures Partner with research and analytics teams to refine and monitor experience metrics and voc (CSAT, NPS, and CES) to inform design solutions and improve end-to-end experience journeys Minimum Qualifications Demonstrated interest and aptitude in service design methods Team player, with user-centric empathy, championing user needs Strong visual skills, experience delivering multiple digital products from start to finish Ability to identify and communicate constraints and can work within them Capable of breaking down complex concepts clearly and persuasively communicate them across different audiences Experience working in highly collaborative engagement models that involve representation from a range of fields including business strategy, transformation, change management, process modeling, user experience, agile, marketing, product development, operations, organizational design, and others Quality facilitation skills, co-creation methods, ethnographic research, and prototyping Comfortable in both broad and undefined spaces Customer obsessed, design thinking driven, user centric with passion for excellence Skilled at imagining the future and visualizing service concepts to generate excitement across the organization Effective communicator, presenter with expertise conveying ideas and concepts through storyboarding, wireframing, and prototyping Experience using Mural, Figma and other collaboration tools to facilitate co-creating the service blueprint with cross functional teams Ability to work both independently and collaboratively with tight deadlines, and multi-task efficiently in high volume, fast paced settings An excellent communicator with strong influencing skills to advocate for being a customer-led organization Previous experience in creating a culture of collaboration and knowledge sharing Knows how to improve processes and use adaptive problem solving to optimize team performance A strategic thinker who is able to support strategic direction of a portfolio of a program of work, as well as the vision and goals at Autodesk At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. Job Requisition ID # 22WD61768 Position Overview Remote work, West Coast Autodesk is evolving its subscription business models and the Offer to Price team is helping ideate, plan, build and run the foundation of the company’s $2.5B+ business with an eye on scaling to meet the needs of its growth to $5B and beyond. We are not a traditional IT organization. We build engineering platforms that integrate with our customer-facing products and serve our partner ecosystem. We strive to embrace a leading edge yet pragmatic engineering focus on practices that provide consistent value to our customers, like Cloud and integration technologies, DevOps capabilities and a Disciplined agile delivery. To support this vision, we are looking for a strong full stack developer who has built solutions in the cloud (AWS strongly preferred). This is a great time to be a part of the team as we are in the process of building a brand new solution related to Product creation and replication, Pricing Operations and Management and Reporting & Integrations with other systems in the landscape. This is a critical role that will lead the organization with technical expertise in building systems and procedures that meet business stakeholder requirements. Responsibilities Lead backend design, development and DevOps functions of scalable, secure & cost-effective customer facing web and software applications in the AWS cloud (Lambda, ECS containers, API Gateway) Proactively work to evaluate and adopt technology solutions to build the APIs of the application Use strong Quality and DevOps practices to build maintainable and extensible solutions. The solutions that you help build are pragmatic and resilient and consider the upstream and downstream process and system impacts. You are strongly invested in Unit Testing Work to meet Autodesk’s Built with Forge pillars that encompass Engineering Excellence, Build and Deploy, Operational Excellence, Recoverability & Reliability areas Partner with business stakeholders to understand the use cases that fuel the business and translate them to functional and non-functional requirements Support the products you build in Production Mentor team members and work with team members spread in APAC, EMEA and the US Minimum Qualifications Strong architectural skills and ability to design scalable, available, resilient and cost-effective applications in the cloud (preferably AWS). The candidate should have the ability to pick out the right tech stack and tools for the problem to be solved Strong technical expertise in building Restful microservices using Node.js with an appropriate data store suited to the problem at hand (should be comfortable with both Relational and NoSQL databases) Good knowledge of API security and data encryption A nice to have is strong technical expertise in building UI using React Strong DevOps and Quality mindset with design and implementation experience in the areas of CI/CD, Observability and Test automation At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD65793 Position Overview We are seeking an experienced senior full stack engineer to join our team of smart and driven engineers who are building real-world solutions for the construction industry. Our experiences power construction teams in the office, trailer and field, enabling them to understand and execute on projects with a level of speed, safety and predictability which was never possible in pure paper workflows. On the Standards team, we are building technology platforms and customer facing product lines that tackle the widest and hardest problems in the construction industry. Our customers are both the individual product teams within Autodesk Construction Solutions (ACS) who leverage our platform, as well as end users who rely on us to provide them holistic solutions to wide ranging problems from project standardization to data federation. Fundamentally, our work is at the heart of the flagship products offered by ACS helping transition information seamlessly thru all the different phases of a project’s lifecycle. Responsibilities Building, shipping, and maintaining features on our products in a cloud environment (AWS) Driving the API designs, database schemas, and architecture of distributed backend services Understanding product and business requirements as a foundation for making technical decisions Maintaining a high standard of code quality by promoting team best practices around testing, code reviews, and design patterns Translating complex design and product requirements into discrete engineering tasks with level of effort estimates with the teammates Communicating status updates, identifying potential blockers, and resolving the root cause of slowdowns with rest of the team Participate in the on-call rotation to support the systems in the production environment Minimum Qualifications 7+ years of professional software engineering experience, including 3+ years of web development experience Strong understanding of non-trivial backend systems / micro-services Experience in writing production level code with automated tests that is resilient and scales Expertise in at least one server side framework (Flask, Django, etc.) + async processing Willingness to learn our backend stack (Python + Flask + Postgres) Ability to define and interact with RESTful APIs Experience with React and modern Javascript (ES6+) Strong written and verbal communication skills, especially around technical concepts Preferred Qualifications A strong sense of ownership Experience mentoring and providing technical leadership Product engineering mindset / customer empathy to provide the right technical solution to real users’ problems with right tradeoffs Experience with Typescript Comfortable with writing and optimizing SQL queries About Autodesk Construction Solutions Autodesk has fully reimagined the construction business for the digital age, enabling companies to address the most important challenges they face today while preparing for new ways of working in the future. The Autodesk Construction Solutions (ACS) portfolio connects the office, trailer and field so customers can move seamlessly through each phase of a building’s lifecycle — from design and pre-construction to construction, turnover and operations — with best-in-class solutions that include Assemble Systems, BIM 360, BuildingConnected and PlanGrid. General contractors, subcontractors, and owners around the world rely on ACS to win more work, enhance collaboration, speed decision-making, reduce risk, and improve overall project outcomes. At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. jobTitle: Principal Software Engineer, REACT (West Coast - Remote)
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD65769 Position Overview The Connect team is looking for a Sr. Principal/Principal Engineer with a strong experience in front-end that are interested in implementing our developer portal using Backstage, an open platform that unifies all your infrastructure tooling and services to create a streamlined development environment from end to end. Successful candidates have cloud technology (AWS) and react experience and a great sense of ownership, and can drive cross-team projects through completion. They have previous experience as tech leads and they have experience developing cloud-native REST APIs and web portals for external customers. These candidates are well versed in modern automation frameworks that will be used to build supportive services used by our internal customer base. Responsibilities Work closely with architects and technical product managers to design and architect secure, scalable and maintainable software Collaborate with technical stakeholders to understand requirements, understand use cases and build towards a cohesive technical strategy aligned to business objectives Research and analyze software code to understand the code at both the low-level and higher architectural level for making enhancements or resolving defects and performance issues within and across teams Develop technical standards and high-quality code following unit testing and test-driven development Engage in an on-call rotation to support production systems Design, code, test, debug, and document software, and enhance existing components to ensure that software meets business needs Apply deep technical expertise to resolve challenging programming projects in a distributed environment and contribute to the design and architecture to enable secure, scalable, and maintainable software Self-starter, passionate about learning new technologies and working on different services/products Lead and advocate for software design reviews, conduct peer code reviews, and provide input and feedback to other members of the development team Coach and mentor less experienced developers Minimum Qualifications 8+ years of experience as a software developer 3-5 years React (a must) 5+ years of production experience building apps on large-scale cloud-based Infrastructure AWS using services such as ECS, S3, RDS, ElastiCache, etc. Hands-on experience with web technology stacks, JS frameworks (React and Node.js) Practical experience building RESTful, Micro-services and/or front-end experiences Experience with scripting languages such as Bash, Python and PowerShell Working experience building automation and CI/CD pipelines Analytic, curious, and perseverant when facing challenges Ability to understand problems, think critically, and devise solutions Ability to perform threat modeling: analysis, design, coding and testing Hands on technical leadership experience leading project teams and setting technical direction Strong technical communication skills and experience working with technical customers Experience with application maintenance and monitoring tools Preferred Qualifications Experience with object-oriented design in at least one modern language (Java, C#, Go) Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases Experience using Docker to build containerized applications Passionate about open-source technologies Experience with load testing frameworks such as JMeter, Locust or BlazeMeter Autodesk products knowledge/experience At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. jobTitle: Principal Software Engineer, REACT (West Coast - Remote)
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD65769 Position Overview The Connect team is looking for a Sr. Principal/Principal Engineer with a strong experience in front-end that are interested in implementing our developer portal using Backstage, an open platform that unifies all your infrastructure tooling and services to create a streamlined development environment from end to end. Successful candidates have cloud technology (AWS) and react experience and a great sense of ownership, and can drive cross-team projects through completion. They have previous experience as tech leads and they have experience developing cloud-native REST APIs and web portals for external customers. These candidates are well versed in modern automation frameworks that will be used to build supportive services used by our internal customer base. Responsibilities Work closely with architects and technical product managers to design and architect secure, scalable and maintainable software Collaborate with technical stakeholders to understand requirements, understand use cases and build towards a cohesive technical strategy aligned to business objectives Research and analyze software code to understand the code at both the low-level and higher architectural level for making enhancements or resolving defects and performance issues within and across teams Develop technical standards and high-quality code following unit testing and test-driven development Engage in an on-call rotation to support production systems Design, code, test, debug, and document software, and enhance existing components to ensure that software meets business needs Apply deep technical expertise to resolve challenging programming projects in a distributed environment and contribute to the design and architecture to enable secure, scalable, and maintainable software Self-starter, passionate about learning new technologies and working on different services/products Lead and advocate for software design reviews, conduct peer code reviews, and provide input and feedback to other members of the development team Coach and mentor less experienced developers Minimum Qualifications 8+ years of experience as a software developer 3-5 years React (a must) 5+ years of production experience building apps on large-scale cloud-based Infrastructure AWS using services such as ECS, S3, RDS, ElastiCache, etc. Hands-on experience with web technology stacks, JS frameworks (React and Node.js) Practical experience building RESTful, Micro-services and/or front-end experiences Experience with scripting languages such as Bash, Python and PowerShell Working experience building automation and CI/CD pipelines Analytic, curious, and perseverant when facing challenges Ability to understand problems, think critically, and devise solutions Ability to perform threat modeling: analysis, design, coding and testing Hands on technical leadership experience leading project teams and setting technical direction Strong technical communication skills and experience working with technical customers Experience with application maintenance and monitoring tools Preferred Qualifications Experience with object-oriented design in at least one modern language (Java, C#, Go) Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases Experience using Docker to build containerized applications Passionate about open-source technologies Experience with load testing frameworks such as JMeter, Locust or BlazeMeter Autodesk products knowledge/experience At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design,
