Job Requisition ID # 22WD62080 Position Overview Do you thrive in an environment where you can work on engaging and challenging projects? Every year Autodesk hires talented engineers to join our global teams and benefit from unlimited access to our technology and industry mentors. If this sounds like you… let's talk. We are expanding our support team for the Cloud Enablement and Workplace organization, part of Enterprise Systems & Experience organization, to enhance the company’s IT systems, applications, and processes. Our engineering culture will empower you to make effective decisions, work collaboratively, and take accountability for engineering projects at the core of the company. We are seeking an experienced Principal Software Engineer to help guide our journey towards becoming a world-class engineering team. This role will have early morning meetings in EST. Responsibilities Software design and development Develop and deliver full-stack, high-value, cloud-based applications and experiences using any of these popular web frameworks (JavaServer Faces, Django, React, Wicket, Google Web Toolkit, Spring Framework, …) Work with open-source tools, rich dashboards and implement proactive monitoring solutions Develop, support, and maintain APIs and microservices using serverless architecture Integrate software components and third-party programs Transform software designs and specifications into high-functioning code in the appropriate language Develop software in support of automation and delivery of self-service capabilities for Autodesk workers Assist with troubleshooting, debugging, and upgrading existing software DevOps design and support Develop, test, and enhance all Continuous Delivery and Integration pipeline features, including automated tests, and promotion pipeline stages Define and document best practices, policies and standards that ensure a resilient and highly available service stack Design, develop, support, and deploy event-driven architectures and asynchronous messaging patterns Aid in locating and remediating issues throughout the development phase while also applying a developer’s mindset to operational issues Document interactions, processes, problems, and solutions to ensure that team members have easy access to the information Analyze metrics and log data to support better decision-making and to improve the system performance and support root cause analysis Take corrective action to avert system degradations or outages from OS and application layer Collaborate on development and platform administration efforts that are aligned with strategic goals using the Agile practices Assist and mentor L1/L2 services team members to deliver high caliber, zero-touch and automated support for Jira, Confluence, Vault, Secret Server, JetBrains, Stoplight, and other applications Minimum Qualifications Deals well with ambiguous or undefined problems; ability to think abstractly and guide others Comfortable performing requirements analysis, interfacing with stakeholders of various levels and documenting solutions Excellent interpersonal skills in written and verbal format Effectively work as a member of a highly adaptable, multi-discipline team Ability to work in a collaborative, cross-team/Geo model to ensure successful management of operational tasks (setting resolution expectations, ensuring proper escalation and/or hand-offs as needed, etc.) Proficient in articulating technical topics to non-technical audiences both in writing and in person Demonstrable IT knowledge commensurate with DevOps in an Enterprise in the public cloud (AWS) Willing to flex your behavioral style to meet the needs of the team or work at hand Confident of your skills, abilities and willing to share what you know, while learning from others Familiarity with agile methodologies and ability to work in a scrum team Preferred Qualifications 8+ years of overall software engineering experience 4+ years of programming experience in Python, Java, or JavaScript 2+ years of hands-on experience in AWS (EC2, Kubernetes, Docker) Hands-on experience with most of the following: Python, Java, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AngularJS/VueJS, Webpack, Node.js, shell scripting (/*nix), Micro-services, Serverless (FaaS) and RESTful web services Experience integrating with various libraries, third-party APIs, and SDKs such as the AWS CLI to deploy various Amazon services based on the task at hand Experience with event-driven architectures and asynchronous messaging patterns (e.g., Amazon SQS, SNS, Kinesis) Experience in API and microservices design using serverless architecture (e.g., Amazon Lambda, Amazon API Gateway, etc.) Experience automating, testing, and deploying infrastructure templates with Cloud Formation and Jenkins Experience with Databases and SQL Familiar with Agile and DevOps concepts and practices Experience with Splunk Experience with Postgres DB Experience with Vault Application support experience with Jira and Confluence Bachelor's degree, preferably in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related quantitative field At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Django, React, Wicket, Google Web Toolkit, Spring Framework, …) Work with open-source tools, rich dashboards and implement proactive monitoring solutions Develop, support, and maintain APIs and microservices using serverless architecture Integrate software components and third-party programs Transform software designs and specifications into high-functioning code in the appropriate language Develop software in support of automation and delivery of self-service capabilities for Autodesk workers Assist with troubleshooting, debugging, and upgrading existing software DevOps design and support Develop, test, and enhance all Continuous Delivery and Integration pipeline features, including automated tests, and promotion pipeline stages Define and document best practices, policies and standards that ensure a resilient and highly available service stack Design, develop, support, and deploy event-driven architectures and asynchronous messaging patterns Aid in locating and remediating issues throughout the development phase while also applying a developer’s mindset to operational issues Document interactions, processes, problems, and solutions to ensure that team members have easy access to the information Analyze metrics and log data to support better decision-making and to improve the system performance and support root cause analysis Take corrective action to avert system degradations or outages from OS and application layer Collaborate on development and platform administration efforts that are aligned with strategic goals using the Agile practices Assist and mentor L1/L2 services team members to deliver high caliber, zero-touch and automated support for Jira, Confluence, Vault, Secret Server, JetBrains, Stoplight, and other applications Minimum Qualifications Deals well with ambiguous or undefined problems; ability to think abstractly and guide others Comfortable performing requirements analysis, interfacing with stakeholders of various levels and documenting solutions Excellent interpersonal skills in written and verbal format Effectively work as a member of a highly adaptable, multi-discipline team Ability to work in a collaborative, cross-team/Geo model to ensure successful management of operational tasks (setting resolution expectations, ensuring proper escalation and/or hand-offs as needed, etc.) Proficient in articulating technical topics to non-technical audiences both in writing and in person Demonstrable IT knowledge commensurate with DevOps in an Enterprise in the public cloud (AWS) Willing to flex your behavioral style to meet the needs of the team or work at hand Confident of your skills, abilities and willing to share what you know, while learning from others Familiarity with agile methodologies and ability to work in a scrum team Preferred Qualifications 8+ years of overall software engineering experience 4+ years of programming experience in Python, Java, or JavaScript 2+ years of hands-on experience in AWS (EC2, Kubernetes, Docker) Hands-on experience with most of the following: Python, Java, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AngularJS/VueJS, Webpack, Node.js, shell scripting (/*nix), Micro-services, Serverless (FaaS) and RESTful web services Experience integrating with various libraries, third-party APIs, and SDKs such as the AWS CLI to deploy various Amazon services based on the task at hand Experience with event-driven architectures and asynchronous messaging patterns (e.g., Amazon SQS, SNS, Kinesis) Experience in API and microservices design using serverless architecture (e.g., Amazon Lambda, Amazon API Gateway, etc.) Experience automating, testing, and deploying infrastructure templates with Cloud Formation and Jenkins Experience with Databases and SQL Familiar with Agile and DevOps concepts and practices Experience with Splunk Experience with Postgres DB Experience with Vault Application support experience with Jira and Confluence Bachelor's degree, preferably in Computer jobTitle: Principal Software Engineer, Remote US & Canada
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD65313 Position Overview As a Principal Engineer on the Customer Activation team within Autodesk Construction Solutions, you will be responsible for mentoring the engineering team and leading the technical design to build features that set our customers up for success in the Autodesk Construction Cloud. The Customer Activation team is responsible for customer onboarding, product trials and evaluation, product licensing/subscription management, and much more. We communicate directly with our customers to provide solutions to some of their biggest construction management problems. You will play a critical role in bringing these solutions to life. Autodesk is changing how the world is designed and made. Autodesk Construction Solutions (ACS) leads the development of Autodesk Construction Cloud (ACC). ACC improves construction management and empowers all builders with connected teams, workflows, and data through a platform where users can interface seamlessly and efficiently across the entire construction life cycle. Our goal is to save time by eliminating redundancies and offering a single platform that entire teams can leverage to convey information effectively. We build the future of construction software. Responsibilities Design, code, test, debug and document new and existing features to ensure that the application meets business, quality, and operational needs Build high-quality, robust code and establish/maintain high standards of code quality and testing Provide guidance to team members on software development best practices Interpret and translate business needs to technical requirements and tasks Apply technical problem-solving skills to design secure, scalable architecture solutions Research and drive adoption of new technologies Identify risks and propose mitigation strategies associated with application architecture Take an active role in code reviews and pull requests Collaborate with a variety of teams in ACS, both domestic and abroad Respond on a rotation basis to escalated incidents after-hours or on weekends to ensure 24/7 availability of our platform Minimum Qualifications 8+ years of experience in software development and web technology stacks 5+ years of production experience building apps on large-scale cloud-based infrastructure Expertise building RESTful APIs, microservices, and front-end interfaces Expertise with JavaScript frameworks (Node.js, React) Expertise with SQL/Postgres DB Strong knowledge of AWS and cloud architectures Strong experience with application maintenance and monitoring tools Strong experience building automation and CI/CD pipelines Experience guiding a team of 3+ software engineers on projects Familiarity with using Docker to build containerized applications Exceptional communication skills and the ability to converse fluently with a wide range of audiences including product managers, customers, and software engineers Curiosity to understand and analyze problems, think critically, and devise solutions Remote collaboration skills to work effectively on a distributed team Flexibility under changing conditions and ability to multi-task between projects Passion for growth, learning, and mentoring others About Autodesk Construction Solutions Autodesk has fully reimagined the construction business for the digital age, enabling company/ies to address the most important challenges they face today while preparing for new ways of working in the future. The Autodesk Construction Solutions (ACS) portfolio connects the office, trailer and field so customers can move seamlessly through each phase of a building’s lifecycle — from design and preconstruction to construction, turnover and operations — with best-in-class solutions that include Assemble Systems, BIM 360, BuildingConnected and PlanGrid. General contractors, subcontractors, and owners around the world rely on ACS to win more work, enhance collaboration, speed decision-making, reduce risk, and improve overall project outcomes. At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. It’s disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. jobTitle: Principal Software Engineer, Remote US & Canada
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD60672 Autodesk is changing how the world is designed and made. Autodesk Construction Solutions (ACS) leads the development of Autodesk Construction Cloud (ACC). ACC improves construction management and empowers all builders with connected teams, workflows, and data through a platform where users can interface seamlessly and efficiently across the entire construction life cycle. Our goal is to save time by eliminating redundancies and offering a single platform that entire teams can leverage to convey information effectively. We build the future of construction software. Position Overview You will collaborate with the team by proactively and regularly connecting with them to ensure you and others are building the right thing, the right way and for the right reasons. You will be part of a growing team of passionate, eager and talented individuals. As the most senior technical resource on the team you will be responsible for developing solutions that exceed expectations and allow the team to grow by learning from your examples of excellence. Tech stack AWS, Docker, JavaScript, NodeJS, Express, Rails, Postgres, Redis, React, Jenkins, NewRelic, Splunk. Responsibilities Lead the team by demonstrating technical excellence in green field project development. Be a source of inspiration and coding best practices for junior team members. Bring tenacity for building high quality solutions that are easy to scale and offer high levels of extensibility. Own our platforms reliability, scalability and versatility. Collaborate with a variety of teams in ACC, located across the globe. Develop features and solve system bugs. Be active in code reviews and code contributions. Write tests. Validate functional specifications. Guide and mentor junior developers in best practices. Design and implement net new features leveraging creative and proficient system principles. Take on complex problems and arrive at practical solutions. Qualifications BS/MS in Computer Science/related or equivalent work experience. 8+ years of backend and distributed systems engineering experience. Led and implemented large complex systems end-to-end across multiple platforms or services. Expertise in NodeJS backend. Expertise in cloud applications. Expertise in API design. Expertise with SQL/Postgres DB. Expertise in designing scalable, resilient cloud applications. Expertise in at least several of the technologies in our tech stack. Expertise in leading from design to implementation of complex projects. Strong communication skills with an ability to converse across different horizontals and verticals. Ability to convert complex software problems into technical tasks. Ability to work well in a remote-friendly distributed team to deliver on team goals. Flexibility under changing conditions and ability to multi-task between projects. Desired Passion for growth, learning, clean code and building elegant solutions. Experience with technologies in our tech stack. Experience with distributed systems. Experience with agile processes. Passion for mentorship. Open to feedback. At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? jobTitle: Principal Software Engineer, Remote US & Canada
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD65313 Position Overview As a Principal Engineer on the Customer Activation team within Autodesk Construction Solutions, you will be responsible for mentoring the engineering team and leading the technical design to build features that set our customers up for success in the Autodesk Construction Cloud. The Customer Activation team is responsible for customer onboarding, product trials and evaluation, product licensing/subscription management, and much more. We communicate directly with our customers to provide solutions to some of their biggest construction management problems. You will play a critical role in bringing these solutions to life. establish/maintain high standards of code quality and testing Provide guidance to team members on software development best practices Interpret and translate business needs to technical requirements and tasks Apply technical problem-solving skills to design secure, scalable architecture solutions Research and drive adoption of new technologies Identify risks and propose mitigation strategies Job Requisition ID # 22WD65658 Position Overview The Autodesk Revit team is looking for an experienced software engineer to work on both desktop and cloud development. Our software is used by hundreds of thousands of architects, engineers, and other building industry professionals to design everything from the world’s tallest skyscrapers, largest airports, and new landmarks to homes and businesses that you visit every day. You will join a small cross-functional scrum team, including development, quality assurance (QA), and experience design (XD). Your day-to-day responsibilities will include development and maintenance for both Revit and the Design Automation for Revit service. You will share responsibility with your team for owning some existing and some new features of Revit. Responsibilities Join with other developers on the team to design and implement new features for our software Take the lead on technical tasks, organizing development in and sometimes outside your area of expertise Seek opportunities to reduce technical debt in our features and automate repetitive tasks Participate in the team's scrum meetings, helping the Product Owner and other team members to set priorities and estimate work Team up with QA to debug and fix issues in a large legacy codebase Work with developers from other Autodesk products to assist in maintenance of our AWS-hosted cloud service, doing deployments or improving the CI/CD pipeline Serve an on-call shift for our cloud service Work with Experience Designers to understand the best solutions to our customers' problems Collaborate with support to resolve active customer issues Write documentation for third-party developers who use our APIs Work with Product Management and the rest of the team to help translate business requirements into technical ones Minimum Requirements Have a degree in CS or a related technical field Be experienced and comfortable learning new things and working on a variety of technology stacks. This team works with AWS, C++, and C# currently. While it’s a bonus if you know one or more of these already, it’s most important that you are willing to constantly learn as the team takes on new projects and technologies” Be comfortable working in both new and legacy codebases Have good communication skills - We're looking for someone the ability to speak both with technical and non-technical people about the things that need to get done Be eager to learn on the job At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD65934 The Data Privacy & Governance @ Autodesk The Data Privacy & Governance team is responsible for implementing and maintaining a world class privacy program, supporting our products, engineering and operations work to deliver a respected and trusted experience to the Autodesk community as well as maintaining compliance with all applicable privacy and data protection laws. Position Overview This role involves operating and driving results in a highly matrixed environment. It involves both technical projects as well as development of end-to-end processes and controls. Immediate focus will be on furthering the maturity of privacy management capabilities and operationalizing value-add privacy capabilities into the enterprise. This role is based in Portland, and reports to the Director of Privacy Program who is based in Portland. Responsibilities Governance, risk, and compliance Identify, document, and implement privacy controls Perform privacy risk assessments (PIAs) and data protection risk assessments (DPIAs) Identify control improvement opportunities Advise teams on control design and implementation Provide contributions to the overall global privacy strategy, program design, implementation plan Ensure compliance and operational risks are identified, escalated to the appropriate team and take appropriate steps to remediate risk Expertise Keep up with cutting-edge privacy innovations, technologies, approaches, and techniques that can potentially be applied to Autodesk Experience in implementing guidelines & policies and with training & awareness raising sessions Build relationships and act as a evangelizer of Autodesk’s privacy principles Stay abreast of privacy regulations worldwide Project Management Experience with implementation of privacy and data protection projects Proactively identify, manage, and mitigate project risks Communicate status & timelines for cross-functional team and executive understanding Define and measure success metrics   Minimum Qualifications Possess a deep respect and passion for protecting people’s data privacy Ability to work independently with limited guidance to create structures and develop operational concepts Knowledge and experience implementing privacy principles in a complex technological ecosystem Knowledge of global data privacy legislations, industry practice and how they impact business operations and product design, could identify the potential impact/risk to business according to external regulations change Strong cross-functional leadership and analytical skills Problem identification, quantification, root cause analysis, and solving Adaptability and flexibility Outstanding organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills (verbal/presentation/written) Preferred Qualifications 7-10 years in a combination of privacy, security, and risk management, and project management Experience in information security, data governance and privacy, and GRC Privacy or security certifications (e.g., CISA, CIPP, CIPM, CISM) Consulting experience Education: Bachelor’s degree, Masters a plus The Ideal Candidate Takes end-to-end ownership in the implementation of new regulations: gap analysis, impact analysis, process definition, bridge the gap between the business, IT & legal, and arrange for implementation in distribution/service models and business processes and operations Is not afraid to take charge, but you do so in a way that demonstrates finesse, emotional intelligence, and business savvy. Job Requisition ID # 22WD65252 Position Overview As a Product Manager within Autodesk Construction Solutions at Autodesk, you are responsible for building tools that are transforming the construction industry. Product Managers on our team sit at the intersection of software development, design, and business strategy. We shape high-level product goals but also get our hands dirty. On an average day, you might present a product concept to customers, work with designers to conduct user research, prototype a new feature, iterate on a spec, analyze usage data, assist group leads to pitch a concept to senior leadership, collaborate with internal teams on new initiatives and pair with an engineer on implementation. We have the ultimate responsibility for understanding our client needs, influencing business strategy, feature specification, and working with engineering to develop our software. To ensure that the growing product family and ecosystem delivers best-in class, analytics and insights, Autodesk is seeking a passionate and experienced product manager to join our Data Delivery group. As the Product Manager in the Data Delivery group, you will be responsible for the customer-facing insight platform that enables analytics capabilities across the Autodesk Construction Cloud ecosystem. This role requires you to develop and maintain roadmap, and detailed execution plans that prioritize requirements across a complex set of stakeholders including small to large customers, and internal product teams. Responsibilities Own and execute a product area that solves business problems and delivers delightful experiences to our customers Understand Autodesk's strategic position and deliver innovative products that align with this strategy Work directly with customers to unearth pain points and understand their most pressing needs Collaborate with leadership to develop overall product strategy and define the vision, goals, and prioritized roadmap for the product Interpret customer requirements, and write detailed user stories, acceptance criteria, and Jira tickets to ensure that your team can execute effectively Work closely with the cross-functional team leads including design and engineering to manage execution and delivery Manage the product backlog, do weekly scrum planning with team, and validate that all new features meet functional, performance, and experience requirements Work closely with internal stakeholders including product teams from various parts of the organization, marketing, support, customer success etc. to drive the research, launch, and adoption of product features Work with support to resolve any escalated customer support issues that require engineering intervention Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in a technical field or equivalent and demonstrated practical experience 2+ years of product management experience, prior engineering experience is preferred Experience analyzing customer needs and workflows and identifying gaps and solutions Experience delivering commercial SaaS products Passionate about building and delivering resilient platforms/services Experience with agile software development and scrum processes Experience working with a cross-functional team including UX and engineering Customer-driven, open minded with a propensity to rapidly explore multiple options with engineering and design before driving alignment on an execution plan Excellent communication and interpersonal skills – interface with our customers as well as internal stakeholders, fellow product managers, product designers, technical writers, engineers, sales, customer success, product marketing, etc. Highly collaborative team player who is motivated by working on hard problems with smart people Preferred Qualifications Advanced degree in computer science, information systems, MBA, engineering or related discipline Experience in one or more areas: cloud infrastructure, big data platforms, BI and visualization tools About Autodesk Construction Solutions Autodesk has fully reimagined the construction business for the digital age, enabling companies to address the most important challenges they face today while preparing for new ways of working in the future. The Autodesk Construction Solutions (ACS) portfolio connects the office, trailer, and field so customers can move seamlessly through each phase of a building's lifecycle — from design and preconstruction to construction, turnover, and operations — with best-in-class solutions that include Assemble Systems, BIM 360, Building Connected and PlanGrid. General contractors, subcontractors, and owners around the world rely on ACS to win more work, enhance collaboration, speed decision-making, reduce risk, and improve overall project outcomes. At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD65361 Position Overview Autodesk gives you the power to make anything. If you’ve ever driven a modern car, admired a towering skyscraper, used a smartphone, or watched a great film, chances are you’ve experienced something amazing that was made with Autodesk software. Our Product Managers have unyielding passion when it comes to shaping the future of design and engineering. We act as the critical connection between customer needs and business strategy, solution design, software development, and go-to-market execution. Our insight fuels creation of compelling strategies, elegant solutions, and inspired results for our customers. While developing high level vision is an important part of our role, we also like to get our hands dirty. On a given day you may deliver a pitch to a senior executive, extract new meaning from analytics data, address a customer issue, or work through a challenging design question with your team. We thrive on finding simple solutions to the toughest problems and take pride in getting important things done for the customer and our business. In this role you would focus on the new Fusion Data Platform to empower internal and external partners to create new collaboration workflows in the entire Design to Make process. The ideal candidate will work closely with Customers, Partners, Product Development, User Experience, Sales and Marketing to determine prioritization of data platform capabilities to allow internal and external partners to extend and enrich workflows and the value of data in the Fusion 360 ecosystem. Location: Remote Work ok Responsibilities Be the voice of our customers by understanding their unique points of view and effectively communicating their needs back within our teams Define product requirements based on market, technology trends and customer needs Manage a backlog and prioritize development efforts Communicate progress through continuous product roadmap updates to internal stakeholders and customers Help define platform pricing/packaging/open-source strategy Manage the integration of new services and technology into the platform with the aim of becoming a world class data platform that will drive innovation and broad adoption of Fusion 360 Manage growth and success of the Fusion 360 developer ecosystem Lead the integration with showcase applications built internally and externally Maintain customer/partner relationships and be the voice of the customer Serve as the solution expert when dealing with thought leaders, analysts, and press Influence and actively participate in marketing and go-to-market plans Minimum Qualifications 3+ years of experience in software, SaaS, or eCommerce industries Background in Business, Engineering, or Data Science Excellent communication skills Ability to effectively collaborate with a global team Strong interpersonal skills Good listener Excellent problem solving and analytical skills At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD66048 Position Overview Do you want the opportunity to be part of a startup-like environment and have a big impact on a brand-new product? Are you looking to be at the forefront of innovative new technology that will ultimately help people imagine, design, and make a better world? If so, come join the Autodesk Tandem team! Our mission is to create Digital Twin technology and solutions that will transform how buildings are designed, built, and operated. We are seeking a Product Manager who has extensive experience with building automation systems or IoT to drive our engagement with operational technology. As Product Manager, you will partner with business stakeholders to understand, analyze, refine, prioritize and communicate the right market needs, and then work with the product team to execute them. Doing this successfully requires customer engagement, subject matter expertise, efficient decision making, relationship building, clear backlog definition, excellent communication skills, and passion. Remote position: location East Coast or Central U.S. Responsibilities Leverage subject matter expertise and customer engagement to specify the outcomes and priorities for product investments by agile development teams Apply technology expertise in collaboration with the team to craft the product experiences that meet those investment outcomes Lead the ongoing agile process of the scrum teams, utilizing agile software planning tools, and ensuring that development work meets the investment outcomes Build partnerships with Experience Design team and stakeholders to refine and communicate overall product strategy to engineering, product leadership, and customers Understand product usage trends through qualitative and quantitative analytics methods in order to inform product investment decisions Minimum Qualifications Experience in Building Management Systems (BOS)/Building Automation Systems (BAS) or IoT Experience with Owner/Operator relationship management and project delivery practices Knowledgeable in smart building systems, performance measurement, visualization, and analytical practices Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with ability to adapt style to a varying audience Preferred Qualifications Experience with digital twin technology Experience in agile product management Strong analytical and decision-making skills Ability to understand large problems, and decompose the solution into incremental pieces At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD65441 Position Overview Do you want the opportunity to be part of a startup-like environment and have a big impact on a brand-new product? Are you looking to be at the forefront of innovative new technology that will ultimately help people imagine, design, and make a better world? If so, come join the Autodesk Tandem team! Our mission is to create Digital Twin technology and solutions that will transform how buildings are designed, built, and operated. The Tandem Marketing Team is looking for a Technical ­Marketing Manager that will play a key role in creating stories to enhance the visibility of this innovative new technology. Location: Boston or US Remote, , Responsibilities Create a rich, continuous pipeline of compelling marketing content to engage potential and existing customers, including but not limited to white papers, web pages, workflow videos, presentations, webinars, case studies, blogs, and social media content Partner, develop, and maintain relationships with other professionals at Autodesk, including Product managers, Customer Success Managers, Product Marketers and Thought Leaders Learn and quickly understand sophisticated technical details and engage in alpha and beta releases to gain early insights into upcoming software releases Define content roadmap, build, and fulfill content marketing plans in pursuit of business objectives around awareness and product adoption Review content performance, report on successes, and continuously iterate on what isn’t working Minimum Qualifications BS/BA in Architecture, Engineering, Construction, or marketing-related fields 5-7 years of professional experience in AEC-O related fields and huge plus if you have experience in the owner/ operations space Ability to create and write clear stories on a wide range of AEC-O, digital transformation, and digital twin topics for targeted audiences TED talk level communication skills. Must be able to give a presentation rather than reading content from PowerPoint Self-starter able to manage your projects autonomously with excellent follow through Utilize technology for storytelling, mainly through copywriting, static imagery, videos, and novel tools The Ideal Candidate Inspirational and enthusiastic. You can inspire audiences with your genuinely positive outlook on new technologies Experience or knowledge with the following Autodesk applications: Autodesk Revit, Autodesk Docs, Autodesk Tandem Proficiency in Camtasia and Adobe creative cloud Experience with managing social media channels such as LinkedIn and Twitter Experience with email marketing and campaign management tools such as Sales Force campaign manager People describe you as a technical marketer who can create fun stories out of complex materials A storyteller that is grounded in expertise in industry and is credible to customers, while being fun, engaging, and appropriate for all levels of audiences Candidates must provide work or portfolio samples upon submission. , At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD65377 The ESG & Impact Team @ Autodesk Join our multidisciplinary team that is driving Autodesk's three-pronged Impact Strategy: 1) to maintain sustainability leadership through our internal operations, 2) to help our customers achieve sustainable outcomes through our technology, and 3) to invest in the innovation that will transform our customer industries to be more inclusive, resilient and sustainable. Position Overview This is a key role on our ESG & Impact team that focuses on the first prong of our Impact Strategy - our internal operations and leading Autodesk's GHG emissions reduction commitments. Autodesk has committed to SBTi approved targets to reduce our carbon footprint across Scopes 1, 2, and 3 by 2030 (see our FY22 Impact Report). This is an exciting opportunity for an impact driven professional to oversee our decarbonization roadmap through collaboration across all areas of our business. You will manage the program that upholds rigorous data quality and transparency as a key input to the dynamic ESG and climate disclosure landscape. In the process, you will also help build and grow our team and help realize Autodesk's Impact Strategy. Responsibilities Climate and ESG Strategy Own the internal decarbonization plan/roadmap including relevant models and dashboards Determine where and how to invest to achieve internal decarbonization, including leveraging Autodesk's Carbon Fund, structuring innovative decarbonization vehicle such as VPPAs, etc. Research, develop, and implement best practices and programs that accelerate Autodesk’s leadership and performance in sustainability, from our supply chain to our facilities and cloud Explore opportunities to connect our ESG strategy with Autodesk's core business Represent Autodesk externally within the corporate sustainability and climate ecosystem Program Management Oversee sustainable operations program that is underpinned by our GHG inventory and data platform. Manage the relevant collaborators, consultants and data management platforms to ensure visibility and accountability to meeting our GHG and renewable energy targets Cultivate co-ownership for GHG reduction through stakeholder engagement in business and operational units including travel, facilities, supplier management, etc. Support ESG reporting and audits, including owning key climate disclosures such as CDP Help build team and infrastructure that can adapt in an ever shifting business environment Minimum Qualifications 8+ years of program management or consulting experience, preferably in corporate sustainability, energy, ESG or climate change Extensive knowledge of greenhouse gas accounting methodologies, emissions reduction strategies across Scopes 1-3, and familiarity with emerging standards Strong analytical and project management skills, including the ability prioritize and drive outcomes towards sustainability and climate goals Willingness to be hands on with the details, balanced with desire to build a team as we grow Excellent written and verbal communicator, with experience translating complex technical concepts for non-technical audiences Familiarity and experience with Autodesk customer Industries - AEC and Design & Manufacturing - a plus CO Salary range $110-140K base At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Job Requisition ID # 22WD65634 Position Overview Reporting to the Director of Design Operations, the Project Manager will support the Design Operations work that spans across the Architecture, Engineering & Construction (AEC) Design software organization. The Project Manager will focus on managing special projects, enhancing team communications and driving efficiency in our operations. Our ideal candidate will be a detail-oriented, independent problem solver and an excellent communicator. They will be a lifelong learner who embraces challenge, who is comfortable with ambiguity and adaptable to changing priorities. They should exhibit sound judgement and an ability to identify new and improved processes for accomplishing program goals when necessary. Success in this role is measured by the ability to put plans into action, grow independence in problem solving, and build strong relationships. This role requires a willingness and ability to execute the details with a “do what it takes” mentality. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are critical, with an ability to explore and implement best-in-class communication strategies for the team. The candidate should have excellent relationship and networking skills and a deft ability to influence without authority. Preference for Portland hybrid/remote candidates. Open to considering fully remote in Pacific Time zone. Responsibilities Manage specific programs/projects that may have a distinct beginning and end, or they may span across many years Develop and maintain project plans and schedule Assist team members in planning, estimating, and controlling tasks Develop action plans to mitigate risk Identify and implement alternative solutions Deliver a variety of presentations in support of the program objectives Monitor projects to ensure completion within defined schedule, budget, and quality parameters Prepare and distribute various reports and updates on the status of the program to various audiences, including executive management, functional management Facilitate team meetings to ensure time is spent wisely and outcomes are clear Assist the DesignOps team in implementing standards, best practices, playbooks, and overall sophisticated operations Own and manage team recognition, onboarding, and ongoing education Contribute to planning and executing a strategic plan for improving team communications Write newsletters, Sharepoint sites, and various other internal communications in partnership with stakeholders Ensure clear and consistent information is distributed to stakeholder Minimum Qualifications 3+ years project management experience Experience in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, with some experience in software or user experience Ability to travel as needed Experience working with cross-functional teams on the development and execution of projects Experience maintaining project plans, schedules, and project control tools utilizing standard PM software Ability to anticipate, understand and actively mitigate project risks Strong writing, reporting, and interpersonal communications skills Preferred Qualifications Bachelor’s degree Experience with Sharepoint, Wiki and MS Office tools At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD64774 Position Overview  We are seeking a talented and motivated individual who will strategize and support opportunities to further mature Autodesk’s security posture for the Infrastructure security domain. The ideal candidate will thrive on partnering with Product and Services teams to develop and implement secure solutions that will ensure customer trust. The Product Security Engineer will partner with teams across Autodesk to achieve the security needs of our traditional and cloud environments using automation. This role will allow you to develop, advise and implement technical and process solutions to mitigate risk to our environment. Responsibilities Partner with stakeholders and your team to develop capability roadmaps, identify and deliver key results to achieve roadmap milestones Identify and lead new projects and initiatives that make it seamless for developers to onboard and better utilize our security solutions.   Leverage data to monitor capability execution to identify opportunities for improvement and to mitigate risk. Partner and collaborate with internal stakeholders on assisting with their overall security posture. Work across product and business systems teams to enhance and evangelize security in infrastructure and drive changes needed to respond to emerging threats Research emerging technologies and maintain awareness of current security risks in support of security enhancement and development efforts As a Security Engineer, you should have a good understanding of cloud security from the service configuration perspective. Good understanding of how policies impact product development. Administrate, configure, build and automate systems and processes that support Security Team Minimum Qualifications Bachelor in Computer Science, Information Security, or equivalent professional experience. Up to 5 years experience in Computer security domain Experience working with technologies hosted via cloud computing environments (e.g., Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform) Ability to build on forming strong relationships and being a team player Work with security stakeholders to create and update the security standards Proven ability to communicate technical issues to technical and non-technical audience Knowledge of project management and data visualization solutions such as JIRA, Wiki, Confluence, PowerBI, Tableau Strong experience securing infrastructure running in cloud environment such as AWS, Azure Proficiency with building, maintaining CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins, Docker, Terraform and modern deployment methodologies. Strong development skills in Python Demonstrate courage, inclusiveness, and pragmatism   Preferred Qualifications Familiarity with multiple security domains, such as application security, asset security, network security, incident response, and/or regulatory compliance and certifications Experience with cloud computing technologies Familiar with OS hardening standards and CIS benchmarks Experience with Chef and scripting language like Powershell and python At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD64783 Security @ Autodesk Our team of security experts helps Autodesk design, build, deploy and maintain secure products. We are embedding security in the full spectrum of how we build our products from inception, design, development, testing to how we are running them in the cloud as well as how we are responding to any existing or emerging threats to our products or the building blocks of our products and services. Our job is to be one step ahead of the bad guys and use expertise, technology, and other resources to thwart their efforts to compromise our products and the environment in which they operate. Our team keeps a single-minded focus on protecting our customers’ data and their investment in our products by strengthening our applications, underlying services, and network. At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Position Overview Apply your well-seasoned multi-role Security skills to enable Autodesk Builders to make best-practice security decisions so they can quickly navigate the rapidly-changing security domain. You will use your background in numerous Security and technology disciplines, including systems architecture, software architecture, cloud systems or network and software engineering to deliver foundational standards, design patterns, and references as well as impactful guidance for Autodesk applications and supporting technologies. You will work horizontally across Autodesk to ensure multi-domain Security Strategy navigation for the Security division and its initiatives. Your work will enable security in the full spectrum Autodesk product lifecycles--from inception, design, development, testing, all the way to operation and response. Come practice and grow your security expertise at scale to keep Autodesk one step ahead of our adversaries! Responsibilities Collaborate to create and drive new security standards, reference designs, templates, and other architecture artifacts for application, network, system, and cloud patterns Curate and lifecycle valuable security architectural documentation and artifacts Provide security consultation to identify and guide product stakeholders and teams through Security requirements and best-practice considerations Gap analyze and model security need vs implementation in products, product environments, and business-systems Explore new and emerging technologies to identify security solutions to fill gaps or enhance capability and security value Apply and convey risk calculations to security data at scale to enable strategic decision making Apply systems design and thinking to organize and make sense of Security at scale Provide security advocacy to staff through professional excellence Minimum Qualifications 5-7+ years in security-focused, cloud-focused engineering, devops, or architecture roles Preferred familiarity with systems design and architectural constructs such as: TOGAF, SABSA, COBIT, ESA BS or higher in Computer-related discipline preferred Experience with at least 7/10 of the following: Vulnerability management Public cloud IaaS engineering/architecture System engineering Network engineering Application engineering DevOps/DevSecOps Standards and reference architecture creation Risk or Compliance assessment Penetration testing Threat modelling At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD60731 Virtual and augmented reality are transforming design and creation through new immersive and collaborative experiences that will impact how major segments like entertainment, architecture, engineering, construction, and manufacturing converge. The industry is being transformed by XR technology growth, creating new ways of working to review, collaborate and create. As a Senior Backend Developer, you will be part of the exciting AR/VR/MR (XR) team responsible for building and delivering XR workflows to the Architecture, Engineering, and Construction industry (AEC). This multi-disciplinary team is operating in a start-up mode within Autodesk with autonomy on product of course, but also sales, strategy, marketing, and operations. In this role, you will be reporting to one of the engineering development managers. Do you have a passion for XR and are excited about the opportunity to influence Autodesk’s point of view and position on the topic? You want to be part of a swift and mighty team exploring and prototyping XR ideas with the latest technology platforms and shape the future of XR for Autodesk? If so, we want to talk with you. Responsibilities Work with the product managers, the technical leads, the experience designers and other software developers to do research, and implement XR workflows. This includes user interaction and software solutions, leveraging third-party tools and partners (Nvidia, Unity, etc.) Implement the cloud and microservices stack for our XR workflows, connecting Autodesk cloud platforms and tools to partner and customer ecosystems Design, prototype, implement, test and troubleshoot XR workflows according to market requirements and product specifications Continuously integrate test, debug, and profile software and cloud services on supported XR devices Develop new tools and applications Minimum Qualifications 5+ years of experience as a developer (particularly on backend development) and must be proficient in either Go or Node.js for backend Proficiency in Databases (SQL or noSQL) Strong experience with AWS services like EC2, Lambda and S3 Experience with full stack models, services, and cloud deployment Ability to work in a start-up fashion even within a big company (things will move fast) Experience in an agile development environment Problem solving abilities and good communication skills Git/Github knowledge Jenkins, Travis, or other CI/CD system knowledge Basic knowledge of Linux BS Degree or equivalent in Computer Science or similar technical field Preferred Qualifications MS Degree or equivalent in Computer Science or similar technical field Basic knowledge of 3D math and modern graphics pipeline Experience with Docker Interest in AR, VR and MR #AutodeskXR At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? This multi-disciplinary team is operating in a start-up mode within Autodesk with autonomy on product of course, but also sales, strategy, marketing, and operations. In this role, you will be reporting to one of the engineering development managers. Do you have a passion for XR and are excited about the opportunity to influence Autodesk’s point of view and position on the topic? You want to be part of a swift and mighty team exploring and prototyping XR ideas with the latest technology platforms and shape the future of XR for Autodesk? If so, we want to talk with you. Responsibilities Work with the product managers, the technical leads, the experience designers and other software developers to do research, and implement XR workflows. This includes user interaction and software solutions, leveraging third-party tools and partners (Nvidia, Unity, etc.) Implement the cloud and microservices stack for our XR workflows, connecting Autodesk cloud platforms and tools to partner and customer ecosystems Design, prototype, implement, test and troubleshoot XR workflows according to market requirements and product specifications Continuously integrate test, debug, and profile software and cloud services on supported XR devices Develop new tools and applications Minimum Qualifications 5+ years of experience as a developer (particularly on backend development) and must be proficient in either Go or Node.js for backend Proficiency in Databases (SQL or noSQL) Strong experience with AWS services like EC2, Lambda and S3 Experience with full stack models, services, and cloud deployment Ability to work in a start-up fashion even within a big company (things will move fast) Experience in an agile development environment Problem solving abilities and good communication skills Git/Github knowledge Jenkins, Travis, or other CI/CD system knowledge Basic knowledge of Linux BS Degree or equivalent in Computer Science or similar technical field Preferred Qualifications MS Degree or equivalent in Computer Science or similar technical field Basic knowledge of 3D math and modern graphics pipeline Experience with Docker Interest in AR, VR and MR #AutodeskXR At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD64621 Position Overview Autodesk is looking for a Senior Business Analyst to join the Digital Employee Experience (DEX) Automation Services team within the Enterprise Systems & Experience (ESE) organization. This team leverages Software Engineering and DevOps principles to optimize the company’s business critical systems and processes through delivering products and reusable platforms that enrich and improve the overall Autodesk employee experience. As a Senior Business Analyst, you will work closely with partners and stakeholders from various organizations, such as IT, HR, Procurement, Legal, and more, to implement strategies to translate raw usage data across internal employee experience platforms into valuable reporting and business insights to EX product teams, business stakeholders, and service delivery owners. You will work closely with business stakeholders to distill your analysis into actionable insights and recommendations. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, technical expertise in data mining and exploration technologies, and the ability to work across our organization to inspire action. Do you thrive in an environment where you can work on engaging and challenging products and insights? Do you have a startup mentality? If this sounds like you, let’s talk. Responsibilities Partner with leadership from various organizations including IT, HR, Procurement, Legal, and others., to identify, define, and track key metrics to be used in planning, reporting, and decision-making for digital employee experience platforms Develop insightful business intelligence reports (KPIs, metrics), self-service dashboards, and/or ad-hoc analyses that are repeatable and scalable Clean and transform data from multiple DEX sources (intranet, knowledge repositories, internal cases, enterprise search, chatbot, etc.) as needed for analysis and delivery of actionable insights and information Provide insight on data trends and anomalies, making recommendations where appropriate to improve DEX products Support DEX business stakeholders with in-depth analysis, insights, and recommended actions, continually mining for insights to help inform strategic roadmaps Assess impact of business strategies and provide clear articulation of analysis to support decision-making for senior management Execute sophisticated qualitative and quantitative analyses, that translate raw data into insights that can be turned into actionable recommendations and built into reports and dashboards Generate and communicate findings to all stakeholders regarding key takeaways and actionable insights Minimum Qualifications 3+ years of proven experience as a business data analyst Solid experience in data analysis and reporting Knowledge of Excel, R, and SQL Familiarity with Mixpanel and ServiceNow reporting Excellent decision-making and communication (both verbal and written) skills Analytical skills and strong organizational abilities Preferred Qualifications Prior DEX reporting experience PowerBI certification At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD65380 Position Overview Come work at one of the best-kept secrets in Denver and Forbes’ 5th most sustainable company in the world in 2020. Autodesk is one of the oldest and most influential tech companies in the world: If you’ve ever driven in a car, admired a skyscraper, used a smartphone, or watched a film, chances are you’ve experienced what our customers are building with our software. While we’ve been around for a few decades, we still maintain a startup attitude and culture, just with a little more clout. We’ve consistently expanded our Denver presence over the last half-decade and just opened a 2nd downtown office with no signs of slowing down! Midmarket Business Development Representatives are not transactional- we are strategic, tip-of-the-spear, budding sales superstars. You will collaborate with some of the best outside sales professionals in the industry to navigate complex enterprise sales environments. You will develop, refine, and execute account plans in companies with household names. You will master the art of prospecting to find the next mammoth deal and expand our footprint in some of our highest priority accounts. Why? Because the top 25% of our team has been promoted in the last 2 years to run their own full-cycle territory. Responsibilities Collaborate with Account Executives (Inside/Field Sales) and Demand Generation counterparts to develop a qualified sales pipeline of customers Drive additional revenue opportunities by applying incremental programs or projects initiated by sales management Qualify leads and pass opportunities to the Autodesk Account Executives in the territory business (pipeline + revenue) Interact with clients and prospects of all seniority levels, including C-Suite, in a variety of industries, across a broad geographical region Map key stakeholders, technical requirements, and business processes on all sales deals Contact customers via phone, email, Outreach, LinkedIn, by leveraging outbound techniques/technologies to position the value of Autodesk software solutions Create and manage a database of leads in Salesforce.com, efficiently processing all opportunities, tracking, reporting, and maintaining to close or transferring to the appropriate team Maintain a strong understanding of promotions and campaigns related to doing business with Autodesk Transition qualified opportunities to the appropriate sales representative while learning sales process, sales skills, and industry knowledge Manage a database of leads in Salesforce.com, efficiently processing all opportunities, tracking, reporting, and maintaining them until they are established in the sales pipeline Preferred Qualifications Passion to pursue a career in sales with specific interest in SaaS and technology Curious and constantly seeking to learn something new Self-aware and understand your own strengths and weaknesses Quick to adapt to new challenges and find the best path through them Eager to prospect and cold call new logos and existing strategic clients Confident in managing a pipeline of leads and opportunities Strong ability to communicate effectively, verbally and written Experience with Salesforce other similar CRM Knowledge on how to manage your schedule and prioritize your day Target Salary for This Position (Colorado): $89,000 OTE Click below to learn more about our benefits in the US. https://benefits.autodesk.com/ At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD64551 Position Overview Autodesk Construction Solutions (ACS) is seeking an exceptional data engineer to transform, optimize, test and maintain architectures, for our construction/ customer databases, data pipelines and processing systems, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. This position will allow ACS to serve relevant data to all stake holders, internally and externally, and will maintain the infrastructure, so the data science and analytics teams can present their work to the organization. Responsibilities Maintain/ develop a scalable database/ data warehouse through connecting disparate data housed across numerous organizational systems and different business lines Maintain/ develop the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and AWS technologies Optimize/ maintain workflows/ scripts on present data warehouses and present ETL Maintain data sources and workflows/ data pipelines across different systems Maintain different data/ analytics outlets including SFDC, Domo, Power BI, etc. to ensure data delivery to team members and ad-hoc reporting requirements Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, applied mathematics or a related discipline 4-5+ years of experience Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases Experience of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management Experience with salesforce administration Experience with BI tools such as Domo, Looker, PowerBI and/ or other tools Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc. Expertise in gathering data through multiple sources through API calls and scripting languages About Autodesk Construction Solutions Autodesk has fully reimagined the construction business for the digital age, enabling companies to address the most important challenges they face today while preparing for new ways of working in the future. The Autodesk Construction Solutions (ACS) portfolio connects the office, trailer and field so customers can move seamlessly through each phase of a building's lifecycle - from design and preconstruction to construction, turnover and operations - with best-in-class solutions that include Assemble Systems, BIM 360, BuildingConnected and PlanGrid. General contractors, subcontractors, and owners around the world rely on ACS to win more work, enhance collaboration, speed decision-making, reduce risk, and improve overall project outcomes. Responsibilities Maintain/ develop a scalable database/ data warehouse through connecting disparate data housed across numerous organizational systems and different business lines Maintain/ develop the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and AWS technologies Optimize/ maintain workflows/ scripts on present data warehouses and present ETL Maintain data sources and workflows/ data pipelines across different systems Maintain different data/ analytics outlets including SFDC, Domo, Power BI, etc. to ensure data delivery to team members and ad-hoc reporting requirements Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, applied mathematics or a related discipline 4-5+ years of experience Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases Experience of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management Experience with salesforce administration Experience with BI tools such as Domo, Looker, PowerBI and/ or other tools Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc. Expertise in gathering data through multiple sources through API calls and scripting languages About Autodesk Construction Solutions Autodesk has fully reimagined the construction business for the digital age, enabling companies to address the most important challenges they face today while preparing for new ways of working in the future. The Autodesk Construction Solutions (ACS) portfolio connects the office, trailer and field so customers can move seamlessly through each phase of a building's lifecycle - from design and preconstruction to construction, turnover and operations - with best-in-class solutions that include Assemble Systems, BIM 360, BuildingConnected and PlanGrid. General contractors, subcontractors, and owners around the world rely on ACS to win more work, enhance collaboration, speed decision-making, reduce risk, and improve overall project outcomes. Job Requisition ID # 22WD64094 Senior Director, Business Operations As the leader of the Business Operations team, you will manage the teams that deliver operational programs in support of global sales and customer success organizations. Reporting to the leader of Global Revenue Operations, you are a member of the leadership team and will actively participate in annual planning cycles. In this highly visible role, you will be leading a globally dispersed team focused on helping drive sales and customer success activities spanning the customer lifecycle from first acquisition through renewal. Our goal as a global revenue operations organization is to improve performance by finding process inefficiencies and developing programs that can amplify sales and customer success activities. You will partner with the leadership of the different sales and customer success organizations to understand their goals and objectives and work with your peers on the Global Revenue Operations team to leverage their resources to help meet those objectives. The Business Operations team is at the forefront of all requests and helps to define business requirements and translate them into functional requirements (policies, programs, and procedures) that inform our technical and enablement teams. Using your experience in working with revenue operations, you will help guide your leaders to define and develop not only the programs but also the metrics that measure their success. Your success depends on understanding the desired outcomes of your global business partners in sales and customer success and ensuring that they have visibility into current programs and how we are to prioritize investments to meet their needs. You will help manage their expectations, highlight tradeoffs, and ensure that our employee and customer experience is top of mind when making decisions. You will be leading a high-performing team and your ability to create a compelling vision that keeps them motivated while retaining and developing employees will be critical to the team’s ongoing success. This is a role for someone who can see both the forest and the trees, enjoys collaborating with many different teams and thrives in a fast-paced environment. A successful candidate for this role will have a deep passion for optimizing GTM motions that deliver excellent customer experiences and understands the value of enterprise architecture and aligning organizational investments. What You Bring To The Table Proven multi-level management experience in revenue operations with an enterprise SaaS solution provider. Curiosity, passion, and a willingness to dive in to get the job done quickly and with precision. Experience in designing and implementing sales and success programs for technology, channel, and services partners. Ability to manage global programs including strategy refinement, policy and process definition, enablement, and implementation. An analytical, data-driven mindset that uses business insights to inform and educate others on opportunities. Comfortable in making tough decisions based on analysis, wisdom and experience Possess the ability to break down siloes and leverage ideas from across the business to create more efficiency. Ability to demonstrate courage by challenging how things are done and take the best from the past to build something new and better for the future. Ability to be decisive and transparent ensuring your team understands what their top priorities are, and why. Requirements Minimum of 10 years management experience in SaaS software. A world class written and verbal communicator with the ability to present at all levels. A proven history of being able to influence and rally diverse stakeholders using both qualitative and quantitative insights. Ability to not only dive into details to drive execution but also zoom out to contextualize specific recommendations/initiatives within the broader company strategy. Ability to multi-task by prioritizing work and coordinating required support across various functions to achieve project goals and objectives. Experience implementing and scaling initiatives across globally dispersed teams. Experience working cross-functionally with multiple departments with teams that are globally dispersed. You are willing and able to travel 20%, including internationally At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world.
