Job Requisition ID # 22WD63621 Position Overview The Senior Director, Content Creation Engineering, will be responsible for leading a team of software developers and development managers to design and build future animation and VFX pipeline capabilities for our content creation products. Autodesk’s Media & Entertainment (M&E) division, one of the company’s three product solutions verticals, includes industry-leading software tools that build a powerful and scalable 3D animation pipeline for complex simulations, effects, and rendering. Top animation, VFX, and games studios use the Media & Entertainment Collection to create many of today’s hottest games, TV shows, and blockbusters. This is a net new role within a brand-new division of Autodesk. The Content Creation team is responsible for industry leading tools including Maya, 3ds Max, Arnold, Bifrost, and Flame. Responsibilities Lead the Content Creation animation and VFX pipeline core technologies engineering teams to execute against product roadmaps and our transformation to platform content creation tools Partner closely with M&E’s Chief Architect, as well as with other technology leaders across the company, including the platform development team in the office of the CTO Build and lead a team with the skills and experience necessary to build modern compelling content creation core technology to be deployed in our platform tools (desktop and cloud) Assume a leadership role on M&E’s Content Creation team, making broad contributions to the team and its strategies Leadership Capabilities An ability to create loyalty, trust, and following. A motivating and inspirational leader who can energize people and teams and facilitate cross-functional cooperation Leads the team in a hands-on and entrepreneurial style where one takes an idea and builds it from the ground up in an agile and iterative way Seek to develop strong senior managers with a history of growing and building a high-performing team Ability to actively collaborate, influence without authority, communicate, inspire, and motivate across all levels of the organization Ability to translate broad company strategies into clear, specific objectives and actionable plans, building passion and buy-in across teams Minimum Qualifications Proven track record of defining, building, launching, and managing animation and/or VFX pipeline tools in an organization that utilizes the Agile development methodology. Implement software development methodologies that will focus on software quality and rapid development iterations designed to improve speed-to-market Demonstrated success leading complex software development with large teams and multiple products. The successful candidate should have experience in designing and developing products that deploy on multiple platforms A visionary leader with the ability to lead and inspire engineering professionals to succeed in a fast changing and highly competitive market, keeping the team focused on breakthrough strategies and tactics to best leverage the resources of a growing company Demonstrated experience leading teams to develop innovative solutions that meet market needs with respect to functionality, performance, scalability, reliability, implementation schedules, and adherence to development goals and principles Excellent communication skills are essential. The successful candidate must have demonstrated presentation skills and be motivated to participate at speaking engagements, industry forums, and conferences Preferred Qualifications Experience leading teams through a platform transformation into the cloud that is focused both on technology and organizational change. Ensure a superior cloud service experience that provides high overall customer satisfaction and a platform that can scale to meet rapid customer adoption and growth Présentation du poste Le directeur principal ou la directrice principale en ingénierie de création de contenu devra diriger une équipe de développeur(se)s de logiciels et de directeur(trice)s et développement afin de concevoir et de mettre en place les prochaines capacités de pipeline d’animation et d’effets visuels pour nos produits de création de contenu. La division Média et divertissement d’Autodesk, l’un des trois secteurs verticaux de solutions de produits de l’entreprise, comprend des outils logiciels de pointe qui permettent de créer un pipeline d’animation 3D puissant et évolutif pour des simulations, des effets et des rendus complexes. Les plus grands studios d’animation, d’effets visuels et de jeux utilisent la collection Média et Divertissement pour créer la plupart des jeux, des émissions de télévision et des superproductions les plus populaires d’aujourd’hui. Il s’agit d’un nouveau rôle au sein d’une toute nouvelle division d’Autodesk. L’équipe de création de contenu est responsable des outils de pointe, notamment Maya, 3ds Max, Arnold, Bifrost et Flame. Job Requisition ID # 22WD65109 Senior Director, Customer Experience Design We are looking to hire a Senior Director of Customer Experience Design reporting to the VP of Experience Design within the Digital Experience & Customer Empowerment (DXC) organization. The DXC team is responsible for ensuring delivery of a seamless digital experience across the full customer life cycle from discovery to onboarding to using our products. Our experience team partners with marketing, sales, customer success, legal, engineering, product management, analytics, user research/insights and others to achieve success together. This is a critical executive role to help scale and continue to expand on our customer experience capabilities- helping to drive our customer and business outcomes. S(he) will help drive cultural change and improvement of our end to end digital cx design approach, techniques and tools within a culture that cares deeply about our customer experience. S(he) will operate as a strategic leader and manage a team of CX specialists to leverage the customer voice and ensure teams deliver a seamless differentiated E2E customer experience. S(he) will help drive aligned understanding of customer needs across functions to ensure the CX vision, strategy and portfolio continually achieves greater customer satisfaction and ultimately brand loyalty. This role is a trusted advisor to senior leadership and will focus on strategy, operational efficiency, and organizational alignment. This includes managing and driving the service design process to ensure rapid data-informed decision making, coordinated E2E execution, and visibility to key initiatives within the team all while incorporating the Autodesk Culture. Candidates need to demonstrate a successful history of challenging the status quo, driving team collaboration across different business units, developing cx strategy and realization plans, and staff development. Must be passionate about contributing to an organization focused on continuously improving consumer experience through data. Key Attributes A strategic thinker to design the future: Proven ability to develop and lead execution of successful self-service experiences aimed at decreasing customer effort. Experience with CX Strategic thinking and experience design principles. You have the ability to clearly understand and envision the full end-to-end customer experience. This includes development and design of customer experience strategies, journeys and workflow mapping, and analyzing data specific to VOC and VOE. An expert in customer journey design: Passionate about providing customers an effortless experience at every touchpoint. Experience with UX design thinking - understands the principles of good user experience and can apply those to product flows across web, mobile and other channels. Process and data driven: Knowledge of process improvement methodologies. Passionate about taking a data-driven and human-centered approach that leverages research-based insights, experimentation, and data-informed decision making. Able to distill complex analyses and present a compelling vision for change. A proven people leader: Build, lead and develop a team of CX experts with the skillsets needed to deliver your cx strategy, iterate and improve it Globally minded and comfortable with huge scale: Experience working within a globally distributed organization and large scale teams Strong stakeholder management and influencing skills to ensure a cohesive customer journey: Establish cross-functional team effort to deliver goals ranging from content optimization to inventing new digital experiences. Track record of managing large, global, and cross-functional initiatives. Proven capabilities to build trust and orchestrate effective collaborations with various stakeholders to shape E2E experience strategies and customer experience outcomes. Responsibilities With a customer mindset and business focus, identify and prioritize cx opportunities along the various digital touchpoints to deliver continuous improvement across the phases of the customer journey as measured through customer effort (CES) and loyalty (NPS) Leveraging customer insights and executing a feedback process that regularly meets with customers and prospects for actionable information about what they need, want, and expect across the entire e2e journey Develop short and long-term cx strategies in partnership with senior team members and provide the leadership necessary for the successful coordination, development, and execution of that strategy Directly responsible for various audience experiences (personas), process flows, and related activities to ensure our e2e experiences align with brand and stakeholder expectations Able to orchestrate experience harmony across the entire e2e customer journey with deep knowledge of Visual Design, Service Design, User Experience, Brand Management Building user journeys, identifying pain points and opportunities to envision brand experiences across the entire digital journey Create artifacts as reusable tools to create internal alignment with key relationships (e.g. current and future state journey maps, service blueprints, future state concepts, personas and mindsets) Establishes goals and metrics for gauging E2E customer experience, including operationalizing NPS/CES and identifying key experience indicators based on desired customer outcomes In partnership with other leaders, continually optimizes key customer-facing processes that are both differentiated and scalable Required Experience Bachelor's degree in design, experience, or related field 12 + years of experience with user experience design, cx design, and service design 8+ years of experience with Design Thinking, Service Design, Design Strategy, user-centered design methodologies 5+ years of experience leading a team of designers, experience coaching, and mentoring designers Strong interpersonal and leadership skills to influence across the organization Demonstrated ability to influence outcomes, build relationships, engage with key stakeholders inside and outside the organization to drive value Demonstrated thought leadership and the aptitude to think innovatively and creatively to develop differentiated customer experiences Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and ruthlessly prioritize to focus on most important items and must haves that maximize client value Deep expertise and proven track record in designing and executing CX or VoC programs in large enterprise Experienced in bringing the customer voice into the design and shaping the digital E2E experiences Knowledge of UX industry tools such as Sketch, InVision, Figma, Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator, Zeplin, etc to create wireframes, mock-ups, and prototype is desirable Experience with Qualtrics or other customer insights platforms is a big plus Domain specific knowledge of CX/service design and a proven track record of building delightful and effortless digital experiences Strong data analysis and problem-solving skills, with demonstrated analytical rigor and attention to detail Ability to absorb and process large amounts of information (from research or analytics) and synthesize into key insights and actionable recommendations Superior written and verbal communication skills with ability to develop compelling narrative and vision of desired future state for different audiences Strong presence and ability to work collaboratively in an Agile environment, and with cross-functional and distributed teams Ability to influence executives and peers to make compelling cases for future Job Requisition ID # 22WD65109 Senior Director, Customer Experience Design We are looking to hire a Senior Director of Customer Experience Design reporting to the VP of Experience Design within the Digital Experience & Customer Empowerment (DXC) organization. The DXC team is responsible for ensuring delivery of a seamless digital experience across the full customer life cycle from discovery to onboarding to using our products. Our experience team partners with marketing, sales, customer success, legal, engineering, product management, analytics, user research/insights and others to achieve success together. This is a critical executive role to help scale and continue to expand on our customer experience capabilities- helping to drive our customer and business outcomes. S(he) will help drive cultural change and improvement of our end to end digital cx design approach, techniques and tools within a culture that cares deeply about our customer experience. S(he) will operate as a strategic leader and manage a team of CX specialists to leverage the customer voice and ensure teams deliver a seamless differentiated E2E customer experience. S(he) will help drive aligned understanding of customer needs across functions to ensure the CX vision, strategy and portfolio continually achieves greater customer satisfaction and ultimately brand loyalty. This role is a trusted advisor to senior leadership and will focus on strategy, operational efficiency, and organizational alignment. This includes managing and driving the service design process to ensure rapid data-informed decision making, coordinated E2E execution, and visibility to key initiatives within the team all while incorporating the Autodesk Culture. Candidates need to demonstrate a successful history of challenging the status quo, driving team collaboration across different business units, developing cx strategy and realization plans, and staff development. Must be passionate about contributing to an organization focused on continuously improving consumer experience through data. Key Attributes A strategic thinker to design the future: Proven ability to develop and lead execution of successful self-service experiences aimed at decreasing customer effort. Experience with CX Strategic thinking and experience design principles. You have the ability to clearly understand and envision the full end-to-end customer experience. This includes development and design of customer experience strategies, journeys and workflow mapping, and analyzing data specific to VOC and VOE. An expert in customer journey design: Passionate about providing customers an effortless experience at every touchpoint. Experience with UX design thinking - understands the principles of good user experience and can apply those to product flows across web, mobile and other channels. Process and data driven: Knowledge of process improvement methodologies. Passionate about taking a data-driven and human-centered approach that leverages research-based insights, experimentation, and data-informed decision making. Able to distill complex analyses and present a compelling vision for change. A proven people leader: Build, lead and develop a team of CX experts with the skillsets needed to deliver your cx strategy, iterate and improve it Globally minded and comfortable with huge scale: Experience working within a globally distributed organization and large scale teams Strong stakeholder management and influencing skills to ensure a cohesive customer journey: Establish cross-functional team effort to deliver goals ranging from content optimization to inventing new digital experiences. Track record of managing large, global, and cross-functional initiatives. Proven capabilities to build trust and orchestrate effective collaborations with various stakeholders to shape E2E experience strategies and customer experience outcomes. Responsibilities With a customer mindset and business focus, identify and prioritize cx opportunities along the various digital touchpoints to deliver continuous improvement across the phases of the customer journey as measured through customer effort (CES) and loyalty (NPS) Leveraging customer insights and executing a feedback process that regularly meets with customers and prospects for actionable information about what they need, want, and expect across the entire e2e journey Develop short and long-term cx strategies in partnership with senior team members and provide the leadership necessary for the successful coordination, development, and execution of that strategy Directly responsible for various audience experiences (personas), process flows, and related activities to ensure our e2e experiences align with brand and stakeholder expectations Able to orchestrate experience harmony across the entire e2e customer journey with deep knowledge of Visual Design, Service Design, User Experience, Brand Management Building user journeys, identifying pain points and opportunities to envision brand experiences across the entire digital journey Create artifacts as reusable tools to create internal alignment with key relationships (e.g. current and future state journey maps, service blueprints, future state concepts, personas and mindsets) Establishes goals and metrics for gauging E2E customer experience, including operationalizing NPS/CES and identifying key experience indicators based on desired customer outcomes In partnership with other leaders, continually optimizes key customer-facing processes that are both differentiated and scalable Required Experience Bachelor's degree in design, experience, or related field 12 + years of experience with user experience design, cx design, and service design 8+ years of experience with Design Thinking, Service Design, Design Strategy, user-centered design methodologies 5+ years of experience leading a team of designers, experience coaching, and mentoring designers Strong interpersonal and leadership skills to influence across the organization Demonstrated ability to influence outcomes, build relationships, engage with key stakeholders inside and outside the organization to drive value Demonstrated thought leadership and the aptitude to think innovatively and creatively to develop differentiated customer experiences Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and ruthlessly prioritize to focus on most important items and must haves that maximize client value Deep expertise and proven track record in designing and executing CX or VoC programs in large enterprise Experienced in bringing the customer voice into the design and shaping the digital E2E experiences Knowledge of UX industry tools such as Sketch, InVision, Figma, Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator, Zeplin, etc to create wireframes, mock-ups, and prototype is desirable Experience with Qualtrics or other customer insights platforms is a big plus Domain specific knowledge of CX/service design and a proven track record of building delightful and effortless digital experiences Strong data analysis and problem-solving skills, with demonstrated analytical rigor and attention to detail Ability to absorb and process large amounts of information (from research or analytics) and synthesize into key insights and actionable recommendations Superior written and verbal communication skills with ability to develop compelling narrative and vision of desired future state for different audiences Strong presence and ability to work collaboratively in an Agile environment, and with cross-functional and distributed teams Ability to influence executives and peers to make compelling cases for future experiences Ability to manage ambiguity and demonstrates resilience when faced with obstacles Bias for action, self-starter mentality and growth mindset At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex,

jobTitle: Senior Director, Platform Engineering Developer Ecosystem
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD62739 Position Overview The Senior Director, Platform Engineering Developer Ecosystem will lead the development of our Forge External Developer Ecosystem. Autodesk Forge is our connected developer cloud platform that spans all Autodesk distributed and desktop apps and services. Autodesk Forge operates in a common data environment and leverages Autodesk industry expertise, technology, and global network of partners to enabling companies to build customized and scalable solutions that solve today's design, engineering, construction, manufacturing, and media & entertainment challenges. It is an exciting time for Autodesk as we transform into a platform company serving Architecture, Engineering, and Construction (AEC), Manufacturing, and Media & Entertainment industries. Core to the success of Autodesk’s future as a platform company is a customer-centric, thriving third-party ecosystem. In this role you will lead a global engineering team to build out the App Store, Developer Portal, SDKs, and Developer Support. As an organization leader, you will partner closely with all aspects of Go-To-Market, including building and aligning strategy. This role reports into the VP of Forge Developer Enablement and has extensive exposure to Autodesk leadership. In this role, you will help guide how Autodesk utilizes its unique intellectual property to create innovative solutions to some of the most challenging problems our customers and partners face. Responsibilities Champion and execute a holistic platform vision for the team    Attract and develop talent to grow an engineering team that drives business value while promoting Autodesk's cultural values Align with Autodesk partners and internal teams in developing a strategy and roadmap Engage with executive leadership to set expectations and manage risks, dependencies, and tradeoffs within complex project delivery Balance long-term vision and big picture thinking with guidance and support of work currently in process; ensure that today's projects inform the vision for the future Promote collaborative leadership across multiple cross-product initiatives Nurture a culture of rapid iteration based on insights gleaned from customer research and data analytics  Demonstrate an understanding of and ability to execute Autodesk's strategic vision Drive thought leadership by representing innovative methods and approaches that delight the team and our customers Pursue emerging technologies and trends and partner with user experience design for state-of-the-art design methodologies Identify and build critical relationships with third-party vendors Minimum Qualifications 10+ years of engineering experience in a relevant industry 5+ years managing, developing, and coaching a team of engineering managers Experience in managing platforms, both cloud and technology components Demonstrated leadership of large B2B software and engineering management teams Prior experience building, nurturing, and leading teams of engineering managers and designers in highly collaborative Scrum/agile environments Ability to set priorities and evangelize the ecosystem vision with a wide range of audiences at all levels of the organization, including senior executives Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to distill complex ideas to their essence, influence senior audiences and a wide array of external stakeholders Experience working with cloud platforms, preferably Amazon Web Services Understanding of security best practices Preferred Qualifications Manufacturing or/and AEC (Architecture Engineering & Construction) experience Run or built a platform and ecosystem Experience developing cloud-based applications and services Strong SaaS experience Experience designing and building Service Oriented Architecture (SOA), high availability, scalable web services At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It’s disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital artists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.

Job Requisition ID # 22WD65220 Position Overview The Platform Services and Emerging Technology (PSET) Finance team is looking for a Senior Financial Analyst to support and work with the finance business partners and assist with the financial management processes and consolidation. The Senior Analyst will help in the planning, forecasting, quarterly close and recurring reporting and help drive efficiencies through automation and standardization of existing processes and deliverables. The ideal candidate should have an eagerness to learn, ability to work effectively with cross-functional stakeholders, and excellent analytical skills. This individual contributor role will report to the Senior Manager, FP&A PSET and can be a remote role located in the AMER region. PSET Finance is committed to ongoing skills development, process excellence, and work-life balance for the team. Responsibilities Support the finance business partners with their financial management processes Manage quarter-end activities, reporting landing positions, consolidating, corporate submissions and compliance Provide financial modeling and analysis support to annual planning process Analyze, and report spend and headcount trends to ensure forecast accuracy Manage business unit budgets and partner with key stakeholders on business and financial decisions Ensuring compliance with GAAP as defined by our Corporate Accounting team Prepare periodic reporting and ad-hoc analyses to ensure data driven business decisions Drive automation, identify opportunities to drive efficient, consistent processes, partnering across functions and leveraging best practices where possible Minimum Qualifications BA/BS degree in finance, accounting, business, or economics, 3-5 years of related finance experience or business analysis background Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel (including financial modeling) and PowerPoint Excellent quantitative and analytical skills Growth mindset and ability to learn quickly Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills Excellent communication skills Organized, resourceful and a strong team player Comfortable working in a cross-functional, dynamic environment, managing multiple, sometimes competing, priorities and tight deadlines Prior experience in a technology/software/SaaS company is a plus Experience using planning and reporting software (e.g., Anaplan, BusinessObjects) is a plus The Ideal Candidate Comfortable working with large data sets, business intelligence tools and across multiple teams at all levels of management Ability to model and interpret large volumes of complex data to identify trends and insights At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. jobTitle: Senior Frontend Engineer, Remote - US & Canada
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD64953 Position Overview Our team within Autodesk Construction Solutions is looking for a senior web developer to help us build document markup and collaboration functionality for Autodesk Build, PlanGrid, and BIM360. We help customers throughout the construction lifecycle add annotations, visualize changes, and collaborate on blueprints and 3D models. This is your chance to dive deeper into the web platform’s graphics stack, learn about collaborative editing tools, and contribute to making software that helps thousands in the construction industry build the future of the cities and towns we all live in. As a web developer on the team, you’ll be responsible for building markup functionality on top of Autodesk’s Forge Viewer, a 2D and 3D model viewer build using WebGL and THREE.js. The rest of our stack is standard for modern front-end development: React, Typescript, and an in-house design system. To share code with our native mobile apps, we use Kotlin Multiplatform. Prior experience with Kotlin isn’t needed, and we’ve found that web developers pick it up quickly and enjoy collaborating with mobile developers on the multiplatform libraries. In addition to building out core markup functionality, our team operates as a platform for about half a dozen other teams with markup-related features. If you enjoy serving both the needs of customers as well as other teams across Autodesk, this could be a good role for you. We’re looking for engineers who care about not just customer experience, but the developer experience of their peers too. If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you! Responsibilities Write technical specs and develop new markups and collaboration features Write technical specifications for new features and document architectural decisions Break apart medium term initiatives into interim milestones and help with tracking progress Collaborate with designers, product managers, and other developers Minimum Qualifications 4+ years of professional software engineering experience, including 3+ years of web development experience Understanding of data structures and algorithms, including an ability to analyze their performance Good written and spoken communication skills; an ability to explain and discuss technical decisions and trade offs Empathy and respect for coworkers Preferred Qualifications Experience or a demonstrated interest (e.g., course work or side projects) in computer graphics Experience with web graphics APIs, such as WebGL, Canvas 2D, or SVG Experience with React and Typescript At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. Job Requisition ID # 22WD65016 La description de poste en français suivra* Location : any location in Canada remote but you are welcome to work at the Montreal or Toronto office with your colleagues Position Overview Participate in creating the next Autodesk Platform for the Media and Entertainment industry. Utilizing an Autodesk cloud-based toolset supporting production pipelines in Film, VFX, and Game industries, we envision a future in which the Film, VFX, and Game industries operate more effectively and with greater creative agility. This is an opportunity to utilize your skills as you help us impact the productivity of hundreds of Studios while learning leading edge practices and technologies. As part of the "Production Tracking - ShotGrid" team, you will help improve how major customers like Netflix, ILM (Industrial Light & Magic ), Epic, Weta, and Warner Brothers track their productions (VFX, Games, 3D animation, etc.) using our Emmy-winning product, ShotGrid. You will also help us to evolve toward using micro services on our future M&E (Media and Entertainment) platform, using state-of-the-art technologies. If you want to become an expert in full stack development, this team is for you! You won't find many opportunities like this one. Responsibilities An amazing problem solver! Motivated by making our customers happy Excited to work on a collaborative team of engineers, designers, and product managers Comfortable with working in both the back-end and front-end sides of our application Excited at learning and increasing our React footprint in the front-end side Adopting high engineering standards of excellence, including performance and security Excited at the opportunity of transforming a classic application into a set of micro-services Keep abreast of technology industry trends, best practices, standards, and methodologies Minimum Qualifications 7+ years of professional experience as a developer with SaaS On the back-end: strong knowledge of the Ruby-on-rails language (Or any equivalent that confirms you are a strong back-end developer!) On the front-end: strong knowledge of the Javascript language along with HTML/CSS (Or you are a strong back-end dev and JavaScript does not scare you) Experience with revision control systems (GitHub) Experience with applying Agile software development methodologies Ability to learn quickly and to adapt to frequent change Ability to communicate effectively and to collaborate across organizations Must be willing to pivot regularly and accept/execute a wide variety of projects Written and verbal communication skills in English (and verbal skills in French for any location in Quebec) Development experience on Mac Preferred Qualifications Experience with React programming Experience with ES6+ versions of Javascript Experience with other languages such as: Python Development experience in large software applications Experience in libraries and component services development (Cloud) 3 + years of ShotGrid production experience (bonus: Film, VFX or Games pipeline) Emplacement : Télétravail possible au Canada et vous êtes la/le bienvenu(e) au bureau de Montréal ou de Toronto Présentation du poste Participez à la création de la prochaine plateforme Autodesk pour le secteur des Médias et du divertissement. Jeu d’outils infonuagiques d’Autodesk destiné à étayer les pipelines de production dans les secteurs du Film, des Effets visuels et des Jeux. Nous envisageons un avenir dans lequel les industries du Film, des Effets visuels et des Jeux fonctionnent plus efficacement et avec une plus grande agilité créative. Ce sera pour vous l’occasion de développer vos propres compétences en nous aidant à accroître notre influence sur la productivité de centaines de studios tout en apprenant des pratiques et des technologies de pointe. En tant que membre de l'équipe « Suivi des Productions - ShotGrid », vous nous aiderez à améliorer la façon dont des clients majeurs comme Netflix, ILM, Epic, Weta et Warner Brothers suivent leurs productions (Effets visuels, Jeux, Animations 3D, etc.) en utilisant notre produit ShotGrid qui a remporté un Emmy Award. Vous nous aiderez aussi à évoluer vers l'utilisation de micro-services sur notre prochaine plateforme de Médias et divertissement en utilisant des technologies de pointe. Si vous souhaitez devenir un(e) expert(e) en développement Full Stack, cette équipe est pour vous! Vous ne trouverez pas beaucoup d’occasions comme celle-ci. Responsabilités Passionné(e) par la résolution de problèmes Être motivé(e) à l’idée de satisfaire les clients Travailler au sein d'une équipe collaborative d'ingénieur(e)s, de concepteur(trice)s et de gestionnaires de produits À l'aise avec le travail à la fois sur le « back-end » et le « front-end » de notre application Apprendre et augmenter notre empreinte React du côté du « front-end » Adopter les normes élevées d'excellence en matière d'ingénierie Transformer une application classique en un ensemble de micro-services Traiter tous les aspects de la programmation de logiciels, y compris la performance et la sécurité Se tenir au courant des tendances de l'industrie technologique, des meilleures pratiques, des normes et des méthodologies Exigences minimales 7 ans (ou plus) d’expérience professionnelle en tant que développeur(se) avec SaaS Sur le « back-end » : solide connaissance du langage Ruby-on-rails (ou tout autre équivalent qui confirme votre expertise du « back-end ») Sur le « front-end » : solide connaissance du langage Javascript ainsi que des langages HTML et CSS (ou vous êtes un expert du « back-end » qui saurait très bien se débrouiller avec le « front-end » et JavaScript!) jobTitle: Senior Fullstack Engineer (Node.js, React) | US, Canada (West Coast Remote)
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD65341 Position Overview Autodesk is evolving its subscription business models and the Offer to Price team is helping ideate, plan, build and run the foundation of the company’s $2.5B+ business with an eye on scaling to meet the needs of its growth to $5B and beyond. We are not a traditional IT organization. We build engineering platforms that integrate with our customer-facing products and serve our partner ecosystem. We strive to embrace a leading edge yet pragmatic engineering focus on practices that provide consistent value to our customers, like Cloud and integration technologies, DevOps capabilities and a Disciplined agile delivery. To support this vision, we are looking for a strong full stack developer who has built solutions in the cloud (AWS strongly preferred). This is a great time to be a part of the team as we are in the process of building a brand new solution related to Product creation and replication, Pricing Operations and Management and Reporting & Integrations with other systems in the landscape. This is a critical role that will lead the organization with technical expertise in building systems and procedures that meet business stakeholder requirements. Remote work, West Coast Responsibilities Lead backend design, development and DevOps functions of scalable, secure & cost-effective customer facing web and software applications in the AWS cloud (Lambda, ECS containers, API Gateway) Proactively work to evaluate and adopt technology solutions to build the APIs of the application Use strong Quality and DevOps practices to build maintainable and extensible solutions. The solutions that you help build are pragmatic and resilient and consider the upstream and downstream process and system impacts. You are strongly invested in Unit Testing Work to meet Autodesk’s Built with Forge pillars that encompass Engineering Excellence, Build and Deploy, Operational Excellence, Recoverability & Reliability areas Partner with business stakeholders to understand the use cases that fuel the business and translate them to functional and non-functional requirements Support the products you build in Production Mentor team members and work with team members spread in APAC, EMEA and the US Minimum Qualifications Ability to design scalable, available, resilient and cost-effective applications in the cloud (preferably AWS). The candidate should have the ability to pick out the right tech stack and tools for the problem to be solved Strong technical expertise in building Restful microservices using Node.js with an appropriate data store suited to the problem at hand (should be comfortable with both Relational and NoSQL databases) Good knowledge of API security and data encryption A nice to have is strong technical expertise in building UI using React Strong DevOps and Quality mindset with design and implementation experience in the areas of CI/CD, Observability and Test automation At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It’s disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital artists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.

Job Requisition ID # 22WD65656 Position Overview Do you want the opportunity to be part of a startup-like environment and have a big impact on a brand-new product? Are you looking to be at the forefront of innovative new technology that will ultimately help people imagine, design, and make a better world? If so, come join the Autodesk Tandem team! Our mission is to create Digital Twin technology and solutions that will transform how buildings are designed, built, and operated. We are seeking a seasoned Manager of the Customer Adoption team with experience in the Architectural, Engineering, Construction, and Owner (AEC-O) industry segments. You are an organization leader who is a relentless advocate for customer needs and have the desire to lead a high performing team to build product and technology awareness among customers, partners, and stakeholders together. To be successful in this role, you need to have demonstrable team management experience and be passionate about AEC-O and the transformation that Digital Twin technologies will bring to the industry. Responsibilities Lead a high-performing global Customer Adoption team, managing organic growth as adoption scales Develop a best-in-class team through coaching and training based on current and anticipated demand in skills in alignment with individual career growth aspirations Contribute improvements to the workflow and deliverables that increase the team’s efficacy to deliver outstanding customer success Develop innovative ways to engage with customers using a variety of platforms to drive Tandem adoption/usage ensuring high customer satisfaction and success at all stages of implementation and growth Partner closely with product managers, engineering managers, UX and other stakeholders to advocate for customer needs identified throughout the customer adoption lifecycle Establish relationships with customers, learning and understanding their workflows to help ensure their success in the onboarding, implementation, and adoption of Autodesk Tandem Partner and collaborate with marketing to procure, articulate, and publish customer success stories in innovative ways to various target audiences Coordinate content development for usage internally with sales, consulting teams, and partners Qualifications BA/BS or graduate degree in Technology Management, AEC-O Industry, or similar experience in the AEC-O segments, the built asset lifecycle and BIM 3+ years’ experience managing a team of highly technical resources Demonstrated strong leadership skills Senior lev experience in customer-facing roles with increasing responsibility Exemplary communication skills, both written and verbal Ability to present and engage with both internal and external stakeholders at various organization levels Strong analytical, problem solving, decision-making, and facilitation skills Strong work ethic, high-quality standards, and a passion for great customer experiences The Ideal Candidate You get work done together; As a team leader, you easily build collaborative relationships with technical and non-technical colleagues You enjoy working with globally distributed teams You are diplomatic and influential and excel at negotiation and consensus-building You are driven, eager to learn, adapt, and grow. You enjoy ideating new and improved ways of working You are people centric; you want to help and serve our customers You have empathy for customers, understand their pain points, and able to identify solutions Salary Midpoint for this Position (Colorado/New York): $154,000 At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD63074 Position Overview The Autodesk Employee Communications team is on a mission to connect Autodeskers globally through authentic storytelling and engaging experiences that shape our culture, business, and world. We are strategic global communicators and advocates of our company culture, and as part of Autodesk's People & Places organization, we are champions of the employee experience. We collaborate with leaders, stakeholders, and communications partners across the company to deliver data-driven content, compelling stories and immersive experiences that bring our company's strategic priorities to life. We are seeking an exceptional Senior Manager of Employee Communications with a focus on enterprise communications to join our team. This is an exciting opportunity to drive the vision, development, and execution of strategic communications for the Autodesk’s mission, vision, and strategic objectives. Our team is looking for a strong leader who has a proven track record of building and executing global employee communications and leading and collaborating with a team of communicators to achieve innovative and strategic results. Additionally, you’ll work closely with the Director of Employee Communications to develop Autodesk’s internal voice, narrative, and holistic communications strategy. Responsibilities Oversee a team leading detailed communication strategies that support Autodesk’s mission, vision, and strategic objectives Lead employee communication strategy (vision, framework, and roadmap) to drive awareness of Autodesk’s business, customer, and product goals Oversee content strategy for Autodesk’s intranet home page and weekly newsletter Proactively work with agency and business partners to publish engaging content Collaborate with global cross functional teams to identify unique stories, build compelling communication campaigns, and encourage employee engagement across all our digital channels Advise and influence senior management and provide thought leadership on internal communications practices, linking them to overall business strategy Actively participate in and be seen as the enterprise employee communications thought leader to the extended communications cohort Lead/oversee an internal “newsroom” to align on an enterprise narrative and content strategy across all audience groups (candidates, customers, and employees) Design, develop and launch our internal, global, and accessible communication channel strategy in partnership with our digital technology team Lead governance of company-wide channel distribution inclusive of email distribution lists and send authorization Oversee the strategy and governance of Autodesk’s employee digital and visual production, event production and internal brand identity Design, develop and launch key elements of our employee content strategy inclusive of internal voice/tone/audience personas and insights Minimum Qualifications You have 8+ years or equivalent experience in communications You are a strategic and creative thinker comfortable debating and defending your ideas A strong storyteller with the ability to create compelling narratives in support of business strategies You can influence across functions, geographies and levels, and the ability to work with various stakeholders and teams to drive alignment and collaboration You are an Innovative self-starter who can drive results both independently and in collaboration with others You are a strong leader who is passionate about empowering and growing their team members Have strong organizational skills, attention to detail and a strategic mindset Can effortlessly manage your workload, are flexible, proactive, work well under deadlines, and above all, have an optimistic spirit and “make it happen” attitude At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. jobTitle: Senior Manager of Engineering, Salesforce Service Cloud and Contact Center Technology (Remote US/Canada)
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD65791 Position Overview Autodesk is seeking a highly motivated Senior Engineering Manager to lead our talented Contact Center Engineering team. The Contact Center Engineering team is a critical domain chartered with designing and delivering robust, efficient, and capable Cloud Contact Center platforms that orchestrate Customer and Autodesk Agent interactions across all modalities including Voice, Chat, Video, Email/Cases and SMS. The Contact Center Engineering team produces meaningful positive impact on customer effort, agent effort, agent efficiency, team efficiency and platform effectiveness. We are a global Contact Center with internal users in 25+ countries and customers in many more global markets. Location: Bay Area Hybrid, Novi Hybrid, Atlanta Hybrid, Portland Hybrid, Remote US and Canada Responsibilities Responsible for the successful technology strategy, design, and evolution of Contact Center Platform Effectively communicate technology vision, roadmap priorities, risks, roadblocks, interdependencies, and constraints strategically with leadership teams and stakeholders Develop and implement metrics for Contact Center platform that inform actions that positively influence the success of Customers, Agents and Teams Drive continuous improvement and automate tools, processes, and technology to allow for greater engineering throughput, quality, capabilities, skills and delivery Work closely with enterprise architects, product management and department leadership teams to explore new technologies and promote an agile culture Review and participate in key architecture and technical design decisions. Advance architecture, process, and tools through innovation, cutting edge technology and research Responsible for deliverables including, but not limited to: technology roadmap, project delivery, platform improvements, release schedule, product quality and documentation and status reports Able to measure organizational progress and health through metrics and results People management responsibilities including hiring talent, professional growth of direct reports, and vendor resource management Enhance engineering efficiency, identifying opportunities and influencing the improvement Provide technical guidance, mentorship to the teammates Support and troubleshoot production issues Work with IT Operations to advance existing DevOps strategy for the build and deployment of software solutions Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science / Information Systems or equivalent experience 10+ years of software development & architecture experience, with at least 4 years of managerial experience in engineering delivery with Agile/SCRUM practices Must have Salesforce CRM implementation experience preferably in Service Cloud. Experience in Salesforce Products like Live Agent(Chat), OmniChannel is a plus Knowledge in Contact Center domain Strong practical knowledge of Salesforce configurations, Lightning, VisualForce, Flex, Apex classes, Web services, APIs Experience working with internal and outsourced staffing models Strong Diagnostic & Analytical Capabilities Excellent Written & Oral Communication Skills with all levels of management Ability to define the system landscape, to identify gaps between current and desired end-states, and deliver contact center solutions Ability to prepare formal management presentations, along with organizing and conducting effective meetings Thrive and lead effectively in a highly dynamic, rapidly changing, and fast-paced environment At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. jobTitle: Senior Manager, Revenue Accounting Operations- Revenue Automation
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD57382 Position Overview If you are passionate about the fusion of revenue accounting and reporting with automation of financial systems, then this is the role for you. The Accounting Operations team supports company-wide strategic initiatives such as those revolving around digital financial transformation, launching new business models to market, and mergers and acquisitions. Autodesk is in the midst of a digital financial transformation and this is your chance to help transform the back office and create a new platform to replace years of technical debt. You will lead the initiative of upgrading our revenue automation platform as well as own the platform as the primary business owner post go live. In this role you will partner with finance stakeholders, IT developers and external vendors to succeed in the critical revenue automation goal for overall digital financial transformation at Autodesk. Location: United States, Any, Flexible Responsibilities Partner with finance, IT, operations and reporting teams to drive the implementation of a new revenue automation tool. This role is accountable for all project phases from initial conceptualization, requirements, technical development, testing, go live and ongoing post-production support Support ongoing maintenance of existing revenue automation platform while new platform is being built. This involves supporting related initiatives around the ERP upgrade, new business models and M&A. Plan and organize eventual decommissioning of existing platform Develop strong stakeholder relationships and maintain effective communication channels Provide and prioritize requirements across finance stakeholder groups and weigh costs and benefits of development work vs. manual processes Oversee the development of thorough test scripts and manage user acceptance testing Analyze the impact of the new tool on existing processes, controls, policies and procedures as compared to Autodesk standards. Drive necessary changes to ensure post-production success Manage current revenue automation team and new project support team. Influence cross-functional team members to achieve project goals Commit to continuous improvement of the new revenue automation platform by managing backlog and updating the platform to increase efficiency Minimum Qualifications Deep knowledge of revenue (ASC 606) and other general accounting concepts. Ability to discuss these topics with non-finance stakeholders Experience with revenue automation systems (RevPro, RAR, RevStream, RevSym, or other) Ability to manage a team of cross functional stakeholders, proactively organize and plan project activities and dependencies to achieve success Ability to juggle multiple tasks, establish appropriate priorities and meet deadlines Mindset of streamlining manual processes reducing technical debt Ability to grasp the big picture and drill down into details when needed Confidence, good judgment, energy and personality to work in a dynamic, multi-business unit environment across all levels of management, business functions and geographies Desire for continuous learning and growth Preferred Qualifications Understanding of quote-to-collect processes and go-to-market initiatives Experience with SAP S4 Hana, Business Objects and QlikView, a plus At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. The Accounting Operations team supports company-wide strategic initiatives such as those revolving around digital financial transformation, launching new business models to market, and mergers and acquisitions. Autodesk is in the midst of a digital financial transformation and this is your chance to help transform the back office and create a new platform to replace years of technical debt. You will lead the initiative of upgrading our revenue automation platform as well as own the platform as the primary business owner post go live. In this role you will partner with finance stakeholders, IT developers and external vendors to succeed in the critical revenue automation goal for overall digital financial transformation at Autodesk. Location: United States, Any, Flexible Responsibilities Partner with finance, IT, operations and reporting teams to drive the implementation of a new revenue automation tool. This role is accountable for all project phases from initial conceptualization, requirements, technical development, testing, go live and ongoing post-production support Support ongoing maintenance of existing revenue automation platform while new platform is being built. This involves supporting related initiatives around the ERP upgrade, new business models and M&A. Plan and organize eventual decommissioning of existing platform Develop strong stakeholder relationships and maintain effective communication channels Provide and prioritize requirements across finance stakeholder groups and weigh costs and benefits of development work vs. manual processes Oversee the development of thorough test scripts and manage user acceptance testing Analyze the impact of the new tool on existing processes, controls, policies and procedures as compared to Autodesk standards. Drive necessary changes to ensure post-production success Manage current revenue automation team and new project support team. Influence cross-functional team members to achieve project goals Commit to continuous improvement of the new revenue automation platform by managing backlog and updating the platform to increase efficiency Minimum Qualifications Deep knowledge of revenue (ASC 606) and other general accounting concepts. Ability to discuss these topics with non-finance stakeholders Experience with revenue automation systems (RevPro, RAR, RevStream, RevSym, or other) Ability to manage a team of cross functional stakeholders, proactively organize and plan project activities and dependencies to achieve success Ability to juggle multiple tasks, establish appropriate priorities and meet deadlines Mindset of streamlining manual processes reducing technical debt Ability to grasp the big picture and drill down into details when needed Confidence, good judgment, energy and personality to work in a dynamic, multi-business unit environment across all levels of management, business functions and geographies Desire for continuous learning and growth Preferred Qualifications Understanding of quote-to-collect processes and go-to-market initiatives Experience with SAP S4 Hana, Business Objects and QlikView, a plus At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It’s disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital artists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.

Job Requisition ID # 22WD65276 Position Overview Want to help make a better world? As a Senior Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) Autodesk you can do just that. How is this possible? As a member of the team responsible for operating critical customer facing services. You will have the opportunity to contribute to and drive improvements in the operation of mission critical components that make up and are dependencies of hundreds Autodesk desktop, mobile and web applications. These services are key business enablers serving millions of customers every day. The responsibilities of this role are part of the foundation for attaining and maintaining our customers trust to build their business around Autodesk’s commercial offerings. As a Senior Site Reliability Engineer you will serve as a primary point responsible for building the SRE practice that is focused on the overall health, availability, performance, and capacity of one or more of our production services. In addition you will be responsible for building and operating our “Gameday” practices that will ensure our systems operate as designed and identify opportunities for continuous improvement. The role will also partner with development teams through the various stages of development to ensure systems are designed with both function and scaled operations in mind. The ideal candidate will be passionate about operations and with an “Automation first” mindset to drive scale. This role is eligible for remote work. Responsibilities Build, maintain the site reliability practice which includes the mentorship of SREs in the organization Scale and enhance our gameday practice by growing the scope and complexity of a critical program to validate and improve our reliability and customer trust Serve as a primary point responsible for the overall health, performance, and capacity of one or more of our services Work closely with development teams to ensure that platforms are designed with "operability" in mind Gain deep knowledge of both our complex internally developed applications and enterprise-class services Operate and maintain highly available production systems Develop tools to improve our ability to rapidly deploy and effectively monitor custom applications in a large-scale Linux and Windows environment Participate in a 24x7 rotation for second-tier escalations Continuously look for opportunities to automate changes and implement them Keep supported services compliant with the company and regulatory requirements including but not limited to security, privacy, SOC2, FedRamp Implement and improve monitoring and alerting Build, automate, and improve observability dashboards to provide better visibility in the operational aspects of the systems Function well in a fast-paced, rapidly-changing environment. Job Requisition ID # 22WD64367 Position Overview Autodesk is seeking a passionate and experienced product manager to join the Analytics Data group. We are dedicated to building out a world-class secure data platform that is used daily by thousands of people across Autodesk to make data-driven decisions about product design, power machine learning efforts, advance experimentation, deliver delightful customer experiences and more. As a Senior Product Manager, you will collaborate and draft the vision and strategy for getting the most value of Data and Insights, to our customers in the Discover, Buy, Manage, Use lifecycle of Autodesk products. You will also own a roadmap that captures and balances the needs of a broad set of technical and non-technical users including designers, engineers, product managers, analysts, data scientists, and executives. You’ll work closely with colleagues in Engineering, Experience Design and Customer Research, as well as stakeholders in various functions and organizations across Autodesk to understand requirements, drive execution and ensure adoption of the platform. You’ll also play a key role ensuring that we maintain privacy and security standards respecting and safeguarding our customers’ data. You’ll work in a cross-functional and highly collaborative environment alongside forward-thinking colleagues who are equally excited and passionate about the value that data and Insights can bring to the business and to our customers for the better use of Autodesk products. Responsibilities Work with and manage the needs of a range of stakeholders to create product strategy and manage execution working with engineering, UI and platform teams that are global Work with stakeholders across various data sets and build visualization capabilities into the platform Work with teams, users and stakeholders across the company to deeply understand the use of our products, to ingest and process data at scale, and to derive meaningful Insights for our customers Partner with platform architects and engineering teams to deliver compelling solutions that meet the demands of stakeholders and users Work with the engineering team, driving the execution of the product strategy following principles of agile methodology Work with cross-functional partners in product, engineering, business and operations to achieve Analytics Data team goals Partner with stakeholders and product management in planning, execution and management of road map and releases, and facilitate communications of the same Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in a technical field (Computer Science or Information Systems preferred) or equivalent and demonstrated practical experience 7 - 10 years of product management experience Knowledge of data aggregation across desktop, web and mobile surfaces to draft the strategy for scaled execution in collaboration with engineering teams Experience defining product vision and strategy, identifying user personas and use cases, and documenting requirements and specifications Experience in one or more areas: Big data, distributed computing, BI and visualization tools, machine learning tools and frameworks, recommendation engines Experience in Agile methodologies and working with Engineering Teams to execute on Product Strategy Experience with building a Cloud platform, or products based on distributed Cloud based technologies, a plus Experience with big data technologies such as Snowflake, Looker, PowerBI or similar preferred Able to communicate and work effectively with engineering teams and stakeholders Comfortable working in a fast-paced, agile and collaborative cross-functional environment Able to influence decision-making at all levels Good communicator and storyteller, able to explain technical topics to a non-technical audience At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. Job Requisition ID # 22WD66148 Position Overview We are looking for an experienced product professional to join our high functioning, highly visible product team. The right person will bring deep strategic thinking, technical expertise, communications proficiency, intellectual curiosity, energy and creativity. Our ideal candidate should have experience working with engineering, product, user experience design, and marketing organizations or for a global technology company. And finally, the perfect person is highly proficient in solving tough problems across a variety of cross-functional teams, is action-oriented to get things done, and is able to navigate complexity. Dynamic communicators encouraged to apply! Responsibilities Effectively develop, socialize, execute, track and communicate mission-critical product initiatives in the digital customer lifecycle Work with internal and external stakeholders including Product Managers, Experience Designers, Software Architectures, senior leadership, and scrum teams to translate business and technical requirements into a workable and prioritized backlog Inspire and motivate by painting a vision for both the short and long terms and recognize development progress Identify and document detailed condition of satisfactions for User Stories Manage and prioritize backlog and stay on top of priority questions, ensure incremental delivery of business value over time Participate in internal testing and engage with customers to validate deliverables and drive product iteration towards long term vision Create demos for internal and external stakeholders Communicate release plan, project status and deliverables to stakeholders in both oral and written format proficiently Create analytics to measure success and identify continuous improvement opportunities Minimum Qualification Bachelor’s degree in relevant area (IE, engineering, computer science, business, or equivalent) 5+ years of product management or product owner or equivalent experience on commercial web products Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Proactive, accountable with a strong understanding of Agile and Scaled Agile development practices/tooling and a broad knowledge of full software development lifecycle An active listener with the strong interpersonal skills and open mind to work with various stakeholders An excellent communicator, both in written and verbal form, with the ability to present to large audiences and lead group activities A multitasker capable of prioritizing and managing your time and multiple priorities simultaneously in a fast-paced, time-sensitive, results-oriented environment Experience building complex modern web functionality that are localized, accessible and responsive You’re a consummate planner, that’s cool and calm in situations of high stress / high stakes, and thrive at taming complexity A self-starter with a strong sense of ownership, a bias for action, and a willingness to roll-up your sleeves An enthusiastic and dedicated approach to connecting cross-functional teams and stakeholders, ensuring clear goals, jobTitle: Senior QA Engineer, XR (Remote Canada & US)
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD64321 Position Overview Are you interested in pushing software until it breaks, then making sure the pieces have been picked up? Is it satisfying to have the metrics that prove a product is highly robust and stable? Are you looking for a product that is exciting to work on, in an industry that will define the future? We're looking for someone like you to join our multi-disciplinary AR/VR (XR) team responsible for building and delivering XR workflows to the Architecture, Engineering, and Construction industry (AEC). As a Senior QA Engineer, you'll spend your time continually improving our ability to verify the quality of our products and services. You will be responsible for learning enough about the system to develop testing strategies and tools throughout the stack. You will help educate and train team members on the latest tools and techniques in code testing. Responsibilities Work with the Product team to understand functional requirements Work with the Engineering team to increase unit testing and verify product quality during the development cycle Write test strategies and plans Perform exploratory testing to uncover new bugs Script automated tests across the software stack Maintain and monitor test runs Measure and report product quality and performance metrics Keep the team educated on the latest testing frameworks and tools Create and maintain documentation Minimum Qualifications 5+ years of experience in SW QA with experience testing Unity or Unreal Engine You want to be excited about the product you’re helping build. We love what we're creating at Autodesk and want you to love it, too You have experience in multiple test frameworks across different languages You keep current on the latest trends in testing, and will happily talk about the differences between TDD and BDD You have experience designing test process around the bug life cycle You are interested in solving testing challenges in a complex environment of graphics and multiuser behaviors You are data-driven and want hard numbers proving your tests are effective You're eager to do your best work using all the tools you've gained through your career. We’re excited to see what you do! Preferred Qualifications A development background and interest in writing custom testing frameworks Experience in AEC and CAD software such as Revit or Navisworks Ideas around testing games and other applications without traditional user interfaces Experience with load and stress testing on a network Experience with performance testing and evaluation #AutodeskXR At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers.
