Job Requisition ID # 22WD65743 Position Overview We are seeking a talented and motivated individual who will strategize and support opportunities to further mature Autodesk’s security posture on the vulnerability management team. The ideal candidate will thrive by partnering with Product and Services teams to develop and implement secure solutions that will ensure customer trust. The Senior Vulnerability Management Engineer will partner with teams across Autodesk to achieve the security needs of our traditional and cloud environments. This role will allow you to develop, advise and implement technical and process solutions to mitigate risk to our environment. The ideal candidate will be a problem solver that has extensive experience using vulnerability scanning tools, prioritizing risk, and remediation. This position can be based on any of our office locations or a home office. Responsibilities Partner with stakeholders and your team to develop capability roadmaps, identify and deliver key results to achieve roadmap milestones Identify and lead new projects and initiatives that make it seamless for developers to onboard and better utilize our security solutions Leverage data to monitor capability execution to identify opportunities for improvement and to mitigate risk Mentor a team of engineers and individual contributors Partner and collaborate with internal stakeholders on assisting with their overall security posture Work across product and business systems teams to enhance and evangelize security in infrastructure and drive changes needed to respond to emerging threats Research emerging technologies and maintain awareness of current security risks in support of security enhancement and development efforts Review outstanding vulnerabilities with product teams and assist in remediation efforts to reduce risk Handle zero-day events by determining affected assets, prioritizing remediation, producing ad hoc reports, identifying compensating controls, and escalating issues when necessary Minimum Qualifications 5+ years of hands-on experience in Information Security with a concentration in Vulnerability Management BS in Computer Science, Information Security, or equivalent professional experience Experience working with technologies hosted via cloud computing environments (e.g., Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform) Understanding of various security tools such as InsightVM, Nessus, and Qualys Ability to form strong relationships and be a team player Proven ability to communicate technical issues to technical and non-technical audience Knowledge of project management and data visualization solutions such as JIRA, Wiki, Confluence, PowerBI, Tableau Highly collaborative in a fast-paced team environment Preferred Qualifications Familiarity with multiple security domains, such as application security, asset security, network security, incident response, and/or regulatory compliance and certifications Penetration testing experience and understanding of remediation techniques for common misconfigurations and vulnerabilities Master's in computer science, Information Security, or equivalent professional experience. Relevant security or cloud certifications The Ideal Candidate You are a perpetual learner and often find yourself ideating about new and improved ways of doing things and are confident to share your ideas with the rest of the security team As a team player and effective communicator, you establish collaborative relationships with technical and non-technical colleagues You enjoy working with distributed team members At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. The Senior Vulnerability Management Engineer will partner with teams across Autodesk to achieve the security needs of our traditional and cloud environments. This role will allow you to develop, advise and implement technical and process solutions to mitigate risk to our environment. The ideal candidate will be a problem solver that has extensive experience using vulnerability scanning tools, prioritizing risk, and remediation. This position can be based on any of our office locations or a home office. Responsibilities Partner with stakeholders and your team to develop capability roadmaps, identify and deliver key results to achieve roadmap milestones Identify and lead new projects and initiatives that make it seamless for developers to onboard and better utilize our security solutions Leverage data to monitor capability execution to identify opportunities for improvement and to mitigate risk Mentor a team of engineers and individual contributors Partner and collaborate with internal stakeholders on assisting with their overall security posture Work across product and business systems teams to enhance and evangelize security in infrastructure and drive changes needed to respond to emerging threats Research emerging technologies and maintain awareness of current security risks in support of security enhancement and development efforts Review outstanding vulnerabilities with product teams and assist in remediation efforts to reduce risk Handle zero-day events by determining affected assets, prioritizing remediation, producing ad hoc reports, identifying compensating controls, and escalating issues when necessary Minimum Qualifications 5+ years of hands-on experience in Information Security with a concentration in Vulnerability Management BS in Computer Science, Information Security, or equivalent professional experience Experience working with technologies hosted via cloud computing environments (e.g., Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform) Understanding of various security tools such as InsightVM, Nessus, and Qualys Ability to form strong relationships and be a team player Proven ability to communicate technical issues to technical and non-technical audience Knowledge of project management and data visualization solutions such as JIRA, Wiki, Confluence, PowerBI, Tableau Highly collaborative in a fast-paced team environment Preferred Qualifications Familiarity with multiple security domains, such as application security, asset security, network security, incident response, and/or regulatory compliance and certifications Penetration testing experience and understanding of remediation techniques for common misconfigurations and vulnerabilities Master's in computer science, Information Security, or equivalent professional experience. Relevant security or cloud certifications The Ideal Candidate You are a perpetual learner and often find yourself ideating about new and improved ways of doing things and are confident to share your ideas with the rest of the security team As a team player and effective communicator, you establish collaborative relationships with technical and non-technical colleagues You enjoy working with distributed team members At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? jobTitle: Senior Software Development Engineer, Frontend (Remote/Hybrid) East Coast
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD63947 Position Overview Please note we are looking for candidates in East Coast time zone. As a Frontend Software Development Engineer building high-quality scalable services for MEP fabrication content management, you will have a direct impact on the MEP fabrication modeling workflows in Revit. The Autodesk Building Design team, the makers of Autodesk Revit is looking for a highly motivated and experienced full-stack engineer who will work as part of a cross-functional agile team. Your responsibilities will range across the stack as you work with the product owner, experience designer, and other engineers to develop and maintain this new secure, scalable, available, and performant service. As a senior engineer on the team, you will be highly involved in the system design of the service, evaluate implementations, and code reviews. Responsibilities Design and develop new capabilities end to end and improve existing code. Focus on quality, including writing unit/integration tests Contribute to software design and architecture by leveraging cloud design patterns and injecting your cloud expertise into the entire development lifecycle. Contribute to processes and deliverables improvements that increase the team's effectiveness and efficiency in responding to customer and business needs. Conduct research and make recommendations on tools, services, and standards to use for engineering efforts. Document and present your ideas and solutions accurately and thoroughly. Coordinate change deployment and release testing effort. Work closely with customers to support production services in an on-call rotation and be an escalation contact for service incidents. Actively engage with various stakeholders and participate in agile team meetings Minimum Qualification 3+ years of relevant experience building large-scale web applications based on AWS using services such as ECS, S3, Lambda, etc. Strong experience and fluent with web technology stacks, JS frameworks (Angular, Node.js), and TypeScript Experience in at least one Object Oriented programming language e.g. C#, Java, C++ Experience creating secure and scalable web services with a solid understanding of the foundational communication protocols such as TCP/IP, HTTP, and Web Sockets. Experience with Test Driven Development Experience with CI/CD concepts and working with a deployment pipeline. Experience with basic network infrastructure and components (load balancing, NAT, scaling, etc.) Comfortable with working in Linux and Windows environments Self-motivated, autonomous, empathetic, and with great communication skills Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent work experience Preferred Qualifications Experience with scripting languages such as Python, PowerShell, etc. Experience with microservices and working with Docker containers Experience with Jenkins Experience with cross-platform desktop application frameworks like Electron Experience in working with Unit and End to End testing frameworks e.g. Jest, Cypress, XUnit Experience working in an Agile or Scrum environment At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Job Requisition ID # 22WD64976 Position Overview Help Autodesk users imagine, design and make a better world by contributing to development of Autodesk Revit, the leading building information modeling software. ­Our software is used by hundreds of thousands architects, engineers, and other building industry professionals to design everything from the world’s tallest skyscrapers, largest airports, and new landmarks to homes and businesses that you visit every day. Revit’s engineering team brings intelligence and efficiency to the building design and development process by solving hard software problems. As a software engineer, you will work collaboratively with a cross-functional team that is responsible for the entire software development process from analyzing market needs through the delivery of working software. Autodesk Revit is a complex product and we are looking for a candidate who is as enthusiastic about re-factoring, optimizing, and enhancing existing code and algorithms as they are about designing and developing new code and services. Responsibilities Work collaboratively with a cross-functional agile team that is responsible for the entire software development process from analyzing market needs through the delivery and monitoring of software and services Develop new state of the art functionality and services that push the envelope for Building Information Modeling (BIM) around the world Re-factor, optimize, and enhance existing code, algorithms, and services Keep up with current and new research in the field of computational geometry Minimum Qualifications Degree in Computer Science, Math, Applied Math or a related field (Master’s or PhD preferred) C++ experience, including good memory management practices Strong knowledge of good software architecture practices including design patterns, object-oriented programming practices, and service architecture patterns Strong background in Math, Geometry and Linear Algebra. Experience with relevant numerical algorithms Strong understanding of algorithmic complexity and how it impacts system performance – experience using performance analysis tools is a plus Demonstrated ability to proactively and creatively evaluate and address issues related to systems stability, scalability, and extensibility Great communication skills that enable effective communication with both technical and domain experts Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team – experience with agile processes is a plus Preferred Qualifications Working knowledge of C# Experience working in a very large code base, including enhancing and resolving issues in pre-existing code Experience working with a geometry kernel of a software package Experience with BIM, CAD, or modeling software and / or working with the APIs for such products Experience with building-related industries such as architecture or structural engineering At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Job Requisition ID # 22WD61901 Position Overview This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a dynamic team at Autodesk Toronto, Canada. We are looking for Engineers who love finding efficient, scalable and thoughtful solutions to a variety of technical and product challenges. As A Senior Backend Engineer, you will work to deliver top quality Web and Cloud Software. Responsibilities Develop high-level designs and implement high scalable web and cloud solutions Collaborate with architects, product designers, product managers, engineers to implement high-quality solutions Proactively and continuously evaluate and address issues related to performance, stability, scalability, and extensibility of the systems Research and prototype new ideas, technologies and patterns relating to the task Work with other Senior Engineers of the initiative and deliver it end to end solution Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in any Engineering discipline from reputed engineering college 5+ years of strong programming skills in Web and Cloud Technologies Strong in OOAD concepts and methodologies Hands-on experience in Java 8+, Spring, Spring Boot Hands-on experience of developing RESTful web services and integrating the same with heterogeneous clients Hands-on experience with Relational and NoSQL database technologies e.g. MySQL, DynamoDB Hands-on experience with object caching technologies such as Redis Hands-on experience with event streaming platform/cluster like Kafka, RabbitMQ and Zookeeper Hands-on experience with Build and CI/CD tools like Ant, Gradle, Docker, Jenkins Hands-on experience with unit and automation testing tools such as Junit, Rest Assured, JMeter, etc. Preferred experience with log aggregation and operational event monitoring technologies like Splunk or New Relic or ELK Stack Proficient in web servers, application servers like Tomcat, Nginx and scripting in Linux environment Working knowledge of UML, software design patterns, distributed systems, resiliency and security Familiarity with the software development process, including specification, quality assurance, and documentation Strong communication skills with the ability to converse fluently with multiple types of audiences ranging from managers, architects, and partners Flexibility under changing conditions and the ability to multi-task between projects Nice to have experience with Amazon web services - ECS, Lambda, Batch, Step Function, API Gateway, Cloud Front, S3, SQS, etc. Nice to have experience with Python and Groovy Nice to have experience with search technologies like Lucene, Solr, Elasticsearch Nice to have experience with JavaScript frameworks like AngularJS, React.js, Redux Experience in Agile Scrum development methodology is a plus Keen interest in new technologies and their timely adoption Ability to work in a heterogeneous environment consisting of multiple languages and technologies Ability to convert complex software solutions into well-written technical design documents At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and jobTitle: Senior Software Engineer, Frontend (Remote West Coast)
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD60641 Position Overviews The Connect team is looking for Senior Software Engineer, Frontend with a strong interested in implementing our developer portal using Backstage, an open platform that unifies all your infrastructure tooling and services to create a streamlined development environment from end to end. This role requires recent Web Technology background React and Node. The successful candidates have a great sense of ownership, and they can drive projects through completion. They have experience developing APIs and web portals for external customers, and they are candidates well versed in modern automation frameworks that will be used to build supportive services used by our internal customer base. You will work within an inclusive culture that offers competitive and equitable salaries, generous benefits, exciting career growth opportunities and work-life balance. Responsibilities Design, code, test, debug, and document software, and enhance existing components to ensure that software meets business needs. Apply technical expertise to resolve challenging programming projects in a distributed environment and contribute to the design and architecture to enable secure, scalable, and maintainable software. Build high quality code following unit testing and test-driven development. Self-starter, passionate about learning new technologies and working on different services/products. Collaborate with several stakeholders to understand requirements, understand use cases and build towards a cohesive technical strategy. Minimum Qualifications 5+ years of experience as a software developer. 2+ years of production experience building apps on large-scale cloud-based Infrastructure AWS using services such as ECS, S3, RDS, ElastiCache, DynamoDB, Lambda, CloudFormation, etc. Hands-on experience with web technology stacks, JS frameworks (React, Node.js) Practical experience building RESTful, Micro-services and/or front-end experiences. Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases. Working experience building automation and CI/CD pipelines. Analytic, curious, and perseverant when facing challenges. Ability to understand problems, think critically, and devise solutions. Experience with Agile software development practices. Preferred Qualifications Passionate about open-source technologies (Backstage experience is a big plus). Experience using Docker to build containerized applications. Deep understanding of object-oriented design and at least one modern backend framework (Java, C#, Python). Experience with scripting languages such as Bash, Python and PowerShell. Experience with load testing frameworks such as JMeter, Locust or BlazeMeter. Strong technical communication and experience working with technical customers. At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? They have experience developing APIs and web portals for external customers, and they are candidates well versed in modern automation frameworks that will be used to build supportive services used by our internal customer base. You will work within an inclusive culture that offers competitive and equitable salaries, generous benefits, exciting career growth opportunities and work-life balance. Responsibilities Design, code, test, debug, and document software, and enhance existing components to ensure that software meets business needs. Apply technical expertise to resolve challenging programming projects in a distributed environment and contribute to the design and architecture to enable secure, scalable, and maintainable software. Build high quality code following unit testing and test-driven development. Self-starter, passionate about learning new technologies and working on different services/products. Collaborate with several stakeholders to understand requirements, understand use cases and build towards a cohesive technical strategy. Minimum Qualifications 5+ years of experience as a software developer. 2+ years of production experience building apps on large-scale cloud-based Infrastructure AWS using services such as ECS, S3, RDS, ElastiCache, DynamoDB, Lambda, CloudFormation, etc. Hands-on experience with web technology stacks, JS frameworks (React, Node.js) Practical experience building RESTful, Micro-services and/or front-end experiences. Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases. Working experience building automation and CI/CD pipelines. Analytic, curious, and perseverant when facing challenges. Ability to understand problems, think critically, and devise solutions. Experience with Agile software development practices. Preferred Qualifications Passionate about open-source technologies (Backstage experience is a big plus). Experience using Docker to build containerized applications. Deep understanding of object-oriented design and at least one modern backend framework (Java, C#, Python). Experience with scripting languages such as Bash, Python and PowerShell. Experience with load testing frameworks such as JMeter, Locust or BlazeMeter. Strong technical communication and experience working with technical customers. Job Requisition ID # 22WD63566 Position Overview Do you want to create engaging, helpful, attractive websites and eCommerce platform that are frequented by millions of visitors worldwide? Autodesk’s Ecommerce Engineering team is looking for a talented engineer who is passionate about building and delivering innovative solutions into our common platform. As part of the Ecommerce Engineering team, you will be implementing exciting new features that engage and influence Autodesk customers worldwide. Our team faces a variety of unique and interesting challenges, from creating new tools and components, implementing critical services, creating new and engaging end-user experiences, to digging into low-level performance details and streamlining processes. Strong hands on coding experience 5+ years of relevant industry experience in Javascript , ReactJS Experience in working on REDUX 5+ years of relevant industry experience in Node.js Good to have Experience in Adobe AEM Experience on deployment process using Jenkins Experience in writing unit test, integration test, cypress test Advanced knowledge of public cloud service platforms such as Amazon Web Services (AWS) Experience in using GIT, splunk, rest clients Preferred Qualifications experience with key technologies and tools such as CI/CD good knowledge of relational databases REMOTE WORK At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. jobTitle: Senior Software Engineer. Full Stack. Remote US.
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD63387 Position Overview We are searching for a Software Engineer, full stack to join us in developing the next-generation, AI-powered architecture design tool. Your contributions will have a direct impact on shaping our platform. It will enable our users to discover smart, urban solutions and gain valuable insights to build better cities. According to the UN, more than 90% of future population growth will occur in cities. We need to find ways to maximize the potential of building sites to keep up with this development. At Spacemaker, we are developing software to find the best and most sustainable ways to unlock that potential considering living quality, the environment, and project profitability. We are well underway in reaching our goals with Spacemaker, and the enormous customer base and the wealth of resources that Autodesk provides will speed up our growth. We now aim to take our product globally and become the leading tool for early-stage design. To learn more about our journey and the way forward, check out our blog. As a Software Engineer, you will play a vital role in developing product features that shape the way our users do their work. You will find yourself working with a wide range of technologies, including web-based 3D frameworks, large-scale systems, and cloud computing. We work in cross-functional and autonomous teams, where decisions are made using a bottom-up approach. We believe the people best equipped to determine an approach for a specific problem are the same people working hands-on with that very challenge every day. Enthusiasm for learning new technologies is critical; while this job’s title is software engineer, we try to promote personal and professional growth by resisting siloed skills, tasks, and projects. We’re looking for someone eager to contribute to full-stack development. We also strongly believe in servant leadership and team accountability. As a Software Engineer, we expect you to follow the servant leadership guiding principles and share your knowledge and expertise with other engineers. We also see great strengths in allowing you as an individual to define how you work to be most successful. To learn more about what we believe great engineering is, take a look at our tech core beliefs and product core beliefs. Responsibilities Set up and maintain services and databases in our cloud-based infrastructure Create and contribute to Spacemaker’s front-end code and web components Contribute to Spacemaker’s backend codebase Develop and deploy frameworks that enable machine learning model training and predictions Develop our team’s tech culture through knowledge sharing Minimum Qualifications Ability to work autonomously and in a cross functional team Significant experience developing in JavaScript/TypeScript & React 1 to 2 years experience with AWS (Lambda, DynamoDB, SQS, ECS) At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. Job Requisition ID # 22WD63067 Position Overview We are looking for a Sr. Software Engineer to join the Strategic Technologies group in the PSET (Platform Services and Emerging Technologies) organization. Help us build Autodesk’s Forge platform to empower developers achieve the new possible. You will be part of the team responsible for designing and building critically important interoperability software components used in CAD applications like AutoCAD, Inventor, Revit and 3DS Max. You will have a unique opportunity to immerse in a full software development life cycle and enjoy delivering happiness to our valued customers. We are a globally distributed diverse group of engineers who embrace teamwork and collaboration using Agile practices. Location: Novi, MI (USA) or Cambridge, UK Responsibilities Design and implement reusable software components and APIs as part of an Agile team Take ownership of the implementation of CAD data exchange software components and features, with high emphasis on quality and sound software engineering practices Participate in software design reviews, conduct code reviews, and provide input and feedback to other members of the development team Create documents and diagrams to outline relationships between subsystems and participate in reviews of those designs Cross-team collaboration and coordination with stakeholders to ensure reliable, secure, available and scalable releases Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or similar experience (Masters or Ph.D, preferred) 3+ years of hands-on software development experience using Modern C++ Strong mathematical background in geometric modeling, linear algebra, numerical methods, spline curves and surfaces, computational geometry Knowledge of good software architecture practices including design patterns, object-oriented programming, and complex software systems Experience with commercial CAD software like Inventor, Revit, Fusion 360, NX, Solidworks, CATIA Proven team leadership, interpersonal skills, and ability to get things done Strong analytical capability and ability to learn new technical domains quickly Preferred Qualifications Experience with solving data exchange and interoperability problems in the CAD industry Experience with designing and developing robust and performant APIs, libraries and reusable components Experience with cross platform software development Multithreaded programming, performance profiling and optimization Experience with Test Driven Development and unit testing At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Job Requisition ID # 22WD65527 Position Overview Autodesk Construction Cloud (ACC) is a single platform for all phases of major global construction projects. ACC Includes Architecture and Design, Pre-Construction Collaboration, Data Storage, and On-Site tools. The Bidding Team is responsible for the pre-construction experience that allows general contractors to share their project information and files with sub-contractors who can create and deliver proposals for jobs. As a Senior Software Engineer on the Bidding Team, you will be responsible for the care, ingenuity and growth of the Building Connected and BidBoard applications. You will contribute to integration efforts that connect the value of our bidding platform into the larger Autodesk Construction Cloud family of products. This includes developing new APIs, integration with existing Autodesk Cloud APIs, integration with Autodesk Docs, automation and management of cloud infrastructure. Responsibilities Document architectural decisions and code design specifications Break apart complex initiatives into manageable chunks Collaborate with UX Designers, Product Managers, SDETs, and other Software Engineers Work within a small, agile team, following a sprint methodology Participate actively in code reviews and contribute to technical discussions Effectively communicate technical challenges within and across teams Focus on quality, including writing unit/integration tests and refactoring when appropriate, debug, and solve defects in implemented software solutions Participate in On-Call responsibilities Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience/certifications 3-5 years of experience working in a collaborative software engineering environment Experience delivering production quality code at scale Preferred Qualifications Working knowledge of frontend frameworks like React and Redux Experience developing scalable backend services with frameworks like Node.js Database management and administration (MongoDB, Redis, Elasticsearch) Experience writing SQL or similar data querying languages Familiarity with infrastructure tools like Docker, Kubernetes, Swarm Application and service monitoring and debugging with tools similar to DataDog, Splunk CI/CD experience (Jenkins) Target Salary For This Position(Colorado): $145,000 At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Job Requisition ID # 22WD65527 Position Overview Autodesk Construction Cloud (ACC) is a single platform for all phases of major global construction projects. ACC Includes Architecture and Design, Pre-Construction Collaboration, Data Storage, and On-Site tools. The Bidding Team is responsible for the pre-construction experience that allows general contractors to share their project information and files with sub-contractors who can create and deliver proposals for jobs. As a Senior Software Engineer on the Bidding Team, you will be responsible for the care, ingenuity and growth of the Building Connected and BidBoard applications. You will contribute to integration efforts that connect the value of our bidding platform into the larger Autodesk Construction Cloud family of products. This includes developing new APIs, integration with existing Autodesk Cloud APIs, integration with Autodesk Docs, automation and management of cloud infrastructure. Responsibilities Document architectural decisions and code design specifications Break apart complex initiatives into manageable chunks Collaborate with UX Designers, Product Managers, SDETs, and other Software Engineers Work within a small, agile team, following a sprint methodology Participate actively in code reviews and contribute to technical discussions Effectively communicate technical challenges within and across teams Focus on quality, including writing unit/integration tests and refactoring when appropriate, debug, and solve defects in implemented software solutions Participate in On-Call responsibilities Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience/certifications 3-5 years of experience working in a collaborative software engineering environment Experience delivering production quality code at scale Preferred Qualifications Working knowledge of frontend frameworks like React and Redux Experience developing scalable backend services with frameworks like Node.js Database management and administration (MongoDB, Redis, Elasticsearch) Experience writing SQL or similar data querying languages Familiarity with infrastructure tools like Docker, Kubernetes, Swarm Application and service monitoring and debugging with tools similar to DataDog, Splunk CI/CD experience (Jenkins) Target Salary For This Position(Colorado): $145,000 At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. jobTitle: Senior Software Engineer - Remote, US & Canada
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD62834 Position Overview Autodesk's pre-construction bidding application is powered by the builder's network, a searchable graph database that connects general contractors' projects or jobs to subcontractors. This network is the heart of the successful Building Connected product inside the Autodesk Construction Cloud services. As a Senior Software Engineer on the Network team, you will be responsible for the care and growth of this valuable dataset, including implementing new features either for end-users or data consumers (internal or external), integrating new functionality from Autodesk's shared platforms, crafting APIs, designing and tuning data models and collections, writing tests and documentation, and automating & managing the operations to the different technology stacks. Primary technology stack: React, MongoDB, Nodejs and Cloud technologies. Responsibilities Design and develop new features Document architectural decisions and code design specifications Break apart complex initiatives into manageable chunks Focus on quality, including writing unit/integration tests and refactoring when appropriate, debug, and solve defects in implemented software solutions Perform on-call duties Collaborate effectively with UX Designers, Product Managers, SDETs, and other Software Engineers Work within a small, agile team, following a sprint methodology Participate actively in code reviews and contribute to technical discussions Effectively communicate technical challenges within and cross-teams Keep yourself up-to-date with evolving technologies and showcase it with an implementation Empathetically help other developers grow Minimum Qualifications 3+ years of experience in React, Redux, REST APIs (preferably using Node.js) 5+ years of experience developing software professionally MongoDB or similar databases experience Full-Stack Mindset Preferred Qualifications Elasticsearch or similar search technology background, especially building new indexes or queries for production systems Familiar with virtual computing pipeline stages, e.g. building (GitHub, Docker), testing and deploying (Jenkins, CI/CD), hosted runtimes (AWS, Heroku, ElasticCloud, MongoDB Atlas), etc. Target Salary For This Position(Colorado): $145,000 At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. jobTitle: Senior Software Engineer - Remote, US & Canada
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD62817 Position Overview As an engineer on the Admin API team, your mission will be to productionize our APIs to be exceptionally performant, usable and extendable. You will collaborate on a team of excellentengineers to accomplish this mission. The Mission Control team owns the tier 1 core APIs the all ACS products depend on. The API team is responsible for making the API lifecycle story as excellent and simple to manage as possible. At Autodesk Construction Solutions, we solve real problems. Construction productivity has lagged the rest of labor industries for decades. The technological advances we've made had not translated into more efficiency in construction. We build the Autodesk Construction Cloud. The opportunity to reduce financial and time cost in construction projects would have a massive impact on making construction more accessible and successful. Responsibilities You will research, conceive, design and develop backend components and tools to extend, improve, stabilize and scale the MC team's APIs Collaborate with a variety of teams in ACS, both domestic and abroad Create tools and frameworks to make developing, testing, publishing, communicating and EOLing Mission Control APIs as easy as possible for our feature teams Take an active role in code reviews & pull requests, get your own code reviewed by the team and become a better developer overall Minimum Qualifications BS or MS in a technical field, or significant equivalent experience 5+ years of backend and distributed systems engineering experience 3+ years developing backend solutions using Node.js or a desire to learn Expertise with SQL/Postgres DB Strong ability to design scalable, available, resilient and cost-effective applications in the cloud (preferably AWS). The candidate should have the ability to pick out the right tech stack and tools for the problem to be solved Strong communication skills with the ability to converse fluently with multiple types of audiences ranging from managers, customers, and software developers Ability to convert complex software problems into technical tasks Ability to work well in a remote-friendly distributed team to deliver on team goals Flexibility under changing conditions and ability to multi-task between projects About Autodesk Construction Solutions Autodesk has fully reimagined the construction business for the digital age, enabling company/ies to address the most important challenges they face today while preparing for new ways of working in the future. The Autodesk Construction Solutions (ACS) portfolio connects the office, trailer and field so customers can move seamlessly through each phase of a building’s lifecycle — from design and preconstruction to construction, turnover and operations — with best-in-class solutions that include Assemble Systems, BIM 360, BuildingConnected and PlanGrid. General contractors, subcontractors, and owners around the world rely on ACS to win more work, enhance collaboration, speed decision-making, reduce risk, and improve overall project outcomes. Our GTM organization brings together our Sales, Customer Success, Marketing and GTM technology teams under one group. Job Requisition ID # 22WD57399 Position Overview Autodesk has an exciting opportunity within Customer Success for a position focused on helping our Automotive and Manufacturing Customers. As a Technical Consultant, your strong Alias and Dynamo knowledge will help our customers put innovative solutions into real world practice. You will define and validate software requirements and develop software applications to meet specifications that drive better business outcomes for our customers. You will act as a subject matter expert on customizations leveraging Autodesk product APIs. Using industry standard methodologies, you will produce technical design documentation, develop code, test applications, document user experience, and provide technical coaching and mentoring to customers and partners. You will analyze existing workflows and processes in the context of the customer’s business and project goals. Working with key business unit stakeholders and project teams, you will assist in defining new workflows, configuring software, training users, and mentoring project teams to ensure successful implementation. By documenting your engagement and applying a “train-the-trainer” approach, you will help our customer’s scale impactful solutions across their organization to achieve meaningful business results. You will also work closely with the Autodesk product teams to provide feedback based on client experiences and stay up to speed on product development roadmaps. Location is Remote anywhere in North America. Responsibilities Analysis of existing workflows and processes Process definition, planning, and implementation of new technologies and workflows Provides innovate solutions to meet customer and industry challenges based on Autodesk product solutions Lead implementation consulting engagements with customers Apply Autodesk product sets to detailed industry requirements and workflows Guide customers in the best application of Autodesk products; define and document detailed use cases Configure solutions based on product capabilities and customer requirements Define migration approach of customer data and standards into Autodesk products Collaborates with customers (external), partners and internal stakeholders consulting groups (internal) to resolve technical issues Provides feedback to product development groups on client experience for product and process improvements Provide coaching and mentoring to customers to drive adoption and consumption Provide coaching and mentoring to partners to enable the scalable delivery of packages service offerings Contributes task estimation and task description in Scopes of Work as well as scope clarification with customers Define software requirements specifications, validate architecture and software design Develop software applications per standard development practices and architecture design Document user experience and test developed applications Assess customer’s current business process, recommend and implement Autodesk technology based custom solutions to meet customer’s needs Produce written specifications to capture functional and non-functional requirements for proposed solutions and configuration activities, supporting solution development and deployment activities including delivery, acceptance testing, training and user-support Estimates effort, resources required, documents implementation tasks, work breakdown structures, and risks associated to proposed solutions Produce technical design documentation including diagrams in standard notations Develop code using various technical skills including strong programming knowledge, as per agreed standards with built-in annotations for maintainability Use software development tools to implement solutions using standard techniques like Agile, Waterfall etc. Act as subject-matter expert on integrations and customizations leveraging Autodesk Product APIs Lead and/or supervise and/or consult technical teams of varying sizes, including internal and external resources and project personnel, in order to facilitate project implementation. (May) manage subcontracted resources as necessary May be required to engage in technical consulting activities at customer site. Test and troubleshoot solutions to ensure successful implementation Provide input to sales and proposal presentations, identify additional product/services opportunities in customer organization and provide inputs to product team as customer’s champion Maintain overview and understanding of Customer support case data Provide technical advice to Account team with regards to customer product escalations Travel up to 50% Minimum Qualifications Bachelor of Science in Engineering, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Industrial Design, Transportation Design, or Equivalent Experienced user of Autodesk Alias and Dynamo Preferably Experienced in VRED, Shotgun, Maya, 3D StudioMax Strong Facilitation skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to convey complex technical details logically, build relationships, and influence Strong customer service skills including video communications and conflict resolution Strong troubleshooting and analytical skills Ability to define plausible solution definitions based on product and industry expertise Ability to lead Customers in consulting engagements Proven record of seamless execution of complex projects Ability to present technical information to a live or virtual audience Ability to set priorities of various assignments and complete them within allocated deadlines with little or no supervision Excellent team player supporting and interacting with other members of a shared responsibility team Self-motivated and proactive, possessing strong desire to learn Resourceful, flexible, and adaptable Excellent analytical, quantitative reasoning and strategic skills Target Pay for this Position (Colorado): $126,900 At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Requisition ID # 22WD57399 Position Overview Autodesk has an exciting opportunity within Customer Success for a position focused on helping our Automotive and Manufacturing Customers. As a Technical Consultant, your strong Alias and Dynamo knowledge will help our customers put innovative solutions into real world practice. You will define and validate software requirements and develop software applications to meet specifications that drive better business outcomes for our customers. You will act as a subject matter expert on customizations leveraging Autodesk product APIs. Using industry standard methodologies, you will produce technical design documentation, develop code, test applications, document user experience, and provide technical coaching and mentoring to customers and partners. Working with key business unit stakeholders and project teams, you will assist in defining new workflows, configuring software, training users, and mentoring project teams to ensure successful implementation. You will also work closely with the Autodesk product teams to provide feedback based on client experiences and stay up to speed on product development roadmaps. jobTitle: Senior Technical Program Manager, Architecture & Operations (Remote Canada)
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD65028 Position Overview As a Senior Technical Program Manager, you’ll be working with leaders in product, design, and engineering to manage product development, delivery and go-to-market execution for two Centers of Excellence (COE), made up of a total of ~8 product development teams. You’ll lead programs and projects within the COEs, being the glue that holds them together and takes them to the finish line. Excellent collaboration and communication with other product teams and stakeholders will be a critical part of your success to ensure that dependencies are understood and managed well, and any discovered overlaps are resolved across the Autodesk construction products ecosystem. You’ll be a central point of contact for the COEs to help them understand and adopt organizational standards and practices that enable teams to track their own progress, collaborate across COEs and gain insight into how we can be more efficient. You’ll also work with the COEs to develop processes that cater to them in helping them deliver business objectives and iterate to continually improve the way we work together. Our team builds products that products that create and leverage accurate data to automate manual processes and deliver actionable insights, and we expect highly accurate data, and actionable insights, and we expect you to mirror those values in our team’s process as well. A great program manager will be highly organized, communicative, and detail-oriented, with a sharp focus on on-time delivery and efficiency at all levels of the COE. Responsibilities Lead programs and projects within the COE to ensure successful delivery/outcomes Work with remote development teams and facilitate collaboration across globally dispersed teams Build and maintain timelines, project plans, and communication artifacts (such as dashboard reports, visual documents) to ensure everyone is operating from the most recent and accurate information Track and report on our performance metrics – perform weekly audits of project schedule and task accounting, ensuring this info rolls into our weekly/monthly/quarterly reporting cadences Surface issues proactively for timely resolution Identify decisions required to move a project forward, determine the decision-makers, and ensure decisions are made Roll out new team dashboards to radiate information on schedule and other key product metrics Own periodic communications to the R&D organization around major product releases Ensure effective collaboration and communication with other product teams throughout the Construction Solutions organization, as well as within the Technical Program Management team Own, contribute and socialize best practices and tooling standards to improve productivity, communication, and documentation across the R&D organization Coach team leads on ways to streamline and improve internal team processes for cross—functional teams Minimum Qualifications 7+ years of experience managing complex software projects spanning multiple teams Experienced with standard software engineering methodologies, lifecycles, and development practices, and able to apply the appropriate framework to support a given team’s needs Track record of successful project deliveries with teams who are either remote and/or offshore Team player and diplomat with the ability to organize and partner with all roles at all levels of the organization. Whether it’s a conversation or an email, you communicate thoughtfully and effectively Experience working with Jira and Confluence Preferred Qualifications Technical background or skill set When you see something awry, you fix it. Being proactive and taking initiative comes naturally to you, and you love taming chaos with organization. Simply amazing when it comes to time management, organization and scheduling. Your friends are convinced you have a flying DeLorean parked somewhere. Adept at navigating dependencies with teams that have different priorities About Autodesk With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It’s disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital artists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world. Présentation du poste En tant que responsable principal(e) de programme technique, vous travaillerez avec des chefs de file des produits, de la conception et de l’ingénierie pour gérer le développement, la livraison et l’exécution de la mise sur le marché pour les deux Centres d’excellence, constitués par un total de huit équipes de développement de produits. Vous dirigerez des programmes et des projets au sein des Centres d’excellence. Vous serez la force motrice qui les soudera et les mènera à bon port. L’excellence de la collaboration et de la communication avec les autres équipes de produits et les intervenants sera un élément essentiel de votre réussite pour faire en sorte que les dépendances soient comprises et bien gérées et que tout chevauchement découvert soit résolu dans l’écosystème des produits de construction d’Autodesk. Vous serez un point de contact central pour les Centres d’excellence afin de les aider à comprendre et à adopter les normes et pratiques organisationnelles qui permettent aux équipes de suivre leurs propres progrès, de collaborer entre les Centres d’excellence et de comprendre comment nous pouvons être plus efficaces. Vous travaillerez également avec les Centres d’excellence pour développer des processus qui les aideront à atteindre leurs objectifs commerciaux et à améliorer continuellement la façon dont nous travaillons ensemble. Notre équipe conçoit des produits qui créent et exploitent des données précises pour automatiser les processus manuels et fournir des renseignements exploitables. Nous attendons aussi des données très précises et des renseignements exploitables, et que vous reflétiez également ces valeurs dans le processus de notre équipe. Un(e) excellent(e) gestionnaire de programme sera très organisé(e), communicatif(ve) et soucieux(se) des détails et portera une attention particulière au respect des délais et à l’efficacité à tous les niveaux des Centres d’excellence. Responsabilités Diriger les programmes et les projets au sein des Centres d’excellence pour assurer la réussite de la prestation et des résultats Travailler avec des équipes de développement à distance et faciliter la collaboration entre des équipes dispersées dans le monde entier Créer et maintenir des calendriers, des plans de projet et des outils de communication (comme des rapports de tableau de bord et des documents visuels) afin de s’assurer que chacun(e) dispose des renseignements les plus récents et les plus précis Suivre et rendre compte de nos statistiques de rendement; effectuer des audits hebdomadaires du calendrier des projets et de la comptabilité des tâches, en veillant à ce que ces informations soient intégrées dans nos rapports hebdomadaires, mensuels et trimestriels Soulever les problèmes de manière proactive pour une résolution rapide Identifier les décisions nécessaires pour faire avancer un projet, déterminer les décideur(se)s et s’assurer que les décisions sont prises Mettre en place de nouveaux tableaux de bord pour diffuser des informations sur le calendrier et d’autres statistiques clés sur les produits Lancer des communications périodiques à l’organisation R&D autour des principales versions de produits Assurer une collaboration et une communication efficaces avec les autres équipes de produits au sein de l’organisation des Solutions de construction, ainsi qu’avec l’Équi

jobTitle: Senior Technical Program Manager - Cloud Infrastructure/DevOps (Canada Remote)
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD65262 Position Overview As a Senior Technical Program Manager, you’ll be working with leaders in product, design, and engineering to manage product development, delivery and go-to-market execution for the Field Workflows, and Service Infrastructure Centers of Excellence (COEs). You’ll lead programs and projects within the COEs, being the glue that holds them together and takes them to the finish line. Excellent collaboration and communication with other product teams and stakeholders will be a critical part of your success to ensure that dependencies are understood and managed well, and any discovered overlaps are resolved across the Autodesk construction products ecosystem. You’ll be a central point of contact for the COE to help them understand and adopt organizational standards and practices that enable teams to track their own progress, collaborate across COEs and gain insight into how we can be more efficient. You’ll also work with the COE to develop processes that cater to them in helping them deliver business objectives and iterate to continually improve the way we work together. A great program manager will be highly organized, communicative, and detail-oriented, with a sharp focus on on-time delivery and efficiency at all levels of the COE. Location: Canada Remote Responsibilities Proactively lead programs and projects within the COE to ensure successful delivery/outcomes, leveraging deep knowledge of planning and coordination styles Proactively contribute to complex projects that span across ACS R&D Build and maintain timelines, project plans, and communication artifacts (such as dashboard reports, and visual documents) to ensure everyone is operating from the most recent and accurate information Track and report on our performance metrics – perform regular audits of project schedule and task accounting, ensuring this info rolls into our weekly/monthly/quarterly reporting cadences Independently identifies project risks and blockers and proactively seeks out mitigation and remediation actions Identify decisions required to move a project forward, determine the decision-makers, and ensure decisions are made and documented Roll out new team dashboards to radiate information on schedule and other key product metrics Ensure effective collaboration and communication with other product teams throughout the Construction Solutions organization and throughout Autodesk, as well as within the Technical Program Management team Own, contribute and socialize best practices and tooling standards to improve productivity, communication, and documentation across the R&D organization Can effectively coach COE/Group/Team leads to navigate project management communications/updates effectively on their own for Deliverables TPM is not involved in Minimum Qualifications 7+ years of experience managing complex software projects spanning multiple teams Technical background or skill set Experienced with standard software engineering methodologies, lifecycles, and development practices, and able to apply the appropriate framework to support a given team’s needs Track record of successful project deliveries with teams who are either remote and/or offshore Team player and diplomat with the ability to organize and partner with all roles at all levels of the organization. Whether it’s a conversation or an email, you communicate thoughtfully and effectively. Experience working with Jira and Confluence Preferred Qualifications When you see something awry, you fix it. Being proactive and taking initiative comes naturally to you, and you love taming chaos with the organization Simply amazing when it comes to time management, organization, and scheduling. Vous dirigerez des programmes et des projets au sein des COE. Vous serez la force motrice qui les soudera et les mènera à bon port. L'excellence de la collaboration et de la communication avec les autres équipes de produits et les parties prenantes sera un élément essentiel de votre réussite pour faire en sorte que les dépendances soient comprises et bien gérées, et que tout chevauchement découvert soit résolu dans l'écosystème des produits de construction d'Autodesk. Vous serez un point de contact central pour les COE afin de les aider à comprendre et à adopter les normes et pratiques organisationnelles qui permettent aux équipes de suivre leurs propres progrès, de collaborer entre les CE et de comprendre comment nous pouvons être plus efficaces. Vous travaillerez également avec les COE pour développer des processus qui les aideront à atteindre leurs objectifs commerciaux et à améliorer continuellement la façon dont nous travaillons ensemble. Job Requisition ID # 22WD65488 Position Overview Have you been craving the opportunity to sell something that really makes a difference in the world? Our sales teams have the pleasure of selling a massive suite of incredible products to a community of revolutionary imaginers, makers, builders, engineers, architects, digital game designers and so many more! Our end users do some simply incredible things with our products-quite simply-they are designing and creating the future. You may be responsible for helping find the right product fit for a team of young inventors that are working on a “bionic” hand that can be designed with Autodesk Software and made with a 3-D printer or an architect designing green eco-friendly friendly buildings and homes or even a 3D Games Designer designing games that can help solve the climate challenge. If you are a successful sales professional who has experience finding new accounts as well as developing and maintaining existing accounts in a B2B consultative selling environment this is a great fit for you! Territories are assigned based on experience and career level. A successful individual will be managing the full sales cycle from prospecting to closing (new accounts) and identifying areas for providing additional value (existing accounts). As well as orchestrating sales via channel partners and resellers. Supportive- Success Driven- Sales culture—excellent sales career development and compensation opportunities based on success, on-going training, collaborative team selling, great sales tools, and a commitment to fun, respect and integrity. This is an individually contributing sales position that requires a high-energy/high activity salesperson Sell within one of Autodesk’s key industry verticals: AEC (Architecture, Engineering & Construction), Manufacturing or Media & Entertainment Uncover and Understand customer requirements in order to recommend and effectively sell Autodesk product or industry solutions Evangelize and average deal sizes by up-selling add-on and cross-selling a proven and customer-loved portfolio of Autodesk products Develops and maintains territory account plans and detailed financial forecasts Create and present accurate sales forecasts, and achieves sales targets Demonstrates Company's values, maintains a positive open demeanor, encourages different points of view, contributes positively to team and colleagues by fostering teamwork and collaboration Account planning (including account profiling, account positioning strategy, customer needs analysis, business justifications, sales opportunity development, service improvement planning, and long-range account management strategies Minimum Qualifications 5+ years’ quota-carrying sales experience selling complex technology solutions- SaaS experience strongly preferred but not required Previous B2B Sales experience selling to SMB or Enterprise Accounts Previous experience using Salesforce.com Sound business acumen Demonstrated track record of success: consistently exceeding quota in a structured, disciplined, sales environment that includes strategic and collaborative/team selling Experience selling via channel build strong relationships for business planning with each partner and with the partner management team to extend the impact of channel partners on your sales Preferred Qualifications Education Level: jobTitle: Senior User Experience Designer, US Remote or Hybrid/Remote ET Zone
jobDescription: Job Requisition ID # 22WD65093 Position Overview Designers at Autodesk can think across the system, champion design ideas, collaborate with stakeholders, advocate for the customer, and deliver impactful data-driven designs. Our designers use creative and innovative solutions to deliver high-quality experiences our customers will love. In this position you will be part of a multi-talented experience design community, working with cross-functional products teams to create outstanding user experiences for our portfolio of Building Design products, including our flagship, Autodesk Revit. You will be contributing to the development of products that help architects, engineers, and construction professionals to design and make better, more efficient, more sustainable buildings. In this role, you’ll be applying your design skills to create ever-better experiences for our customers, helping to improve the lives of the hundreds of thousands of people worldwide who use our tools to imagine, design, and make a better world. Preference for candidates in commutable distance to Boston to work hybrid/remote, open to considering candidates fully remote within Eastern Time zone. When applying you must include your resume and portfolio with password if needed. Responsibilities Work with product managers, developers, researchers, and customers to define new and improved capabilities from initial concept through successful implementation Design workflows, mockups, and prototypes with varying levels of fidelity to communicate with peers and stakeholders Use insights derived from research, testing, and analytics to help inform business and product development decisions Collaborate closely with one or more agile scrum teams to deliver value continuously and iteratively Lead customer interaction and research in various forms, from interviews to usability testing, to evaluate solutions and make iterative improvements Participate in – and sometimes lead – design thinking exercises to facilitate exploration of new ideas, build shared understanding, and collaboratively solve complex design problems Contribute to the company's evolving global Design System by proposing reusable interaction patterns and component designs Engage in an active global design community, participating in design critique sessions and offering constructive feedback to your peers Minimum Qualifications 3+ years, with 5+ preferred, of related professional UX design experience Demonstrated experience wireframing, prototyping, and communicating intended solutions using a range of tools and formats, at various levels of fidelity Up-to-date expertise in human-centered design best practices, including UX research methods such as user interviews and usability testing Ability to work collaboratively with development teams and product managers to deliver usable and desired value to customers continuously and iteratively Excellent visual and verbal communication skills with the ability to distill complex ideas, large amounts of data, and diverse opinions to their essence Ability to solve complex problems and drive projects from concept to implementation Demonstrated experience of collaborating with multi-disciplinary and global product development teams Preferred Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or above in Interaction Design or a related field Experience in AEC industry or working with architecture products and services Experience with Agile software development practices At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Job Requisition ID # 22WD64556 Position Overview At Autodesk Construction Solutions, our mission is to help teams meet the world’s rapidly expanding building and infrastructure needs, while making construction more predictable, safe and sustainable. Over $100 billion in new construction is managed on our platform every month. From major stadiums to local schools and hospitals, our tools are helping cities grow and communities come together. As a Senior UX Designer, you will collaborate with your Product Management and Engineering partners to support our Takeoff & Estimating products in the Autodesk Construction Cloud ecosystem. You will help shape the tools that enable our customers to efficiently and safely build the world around us. We’re looking for someone who is a champion for human-centered design, a relentless advocate for user needs, and has a track record of driving design strategy in complex problem spaces to deliver compelling user experiences. This position can be based in the United States or Canada. Please include resume, portfolio and password when applying. Responsibilities Partner with product managers, engineers, researchers and other designers to define great experiences from initial concept through successful implementation Visualize and prototype intended solutions at various levels of fidelity including high-level wireframes, conceptual designs, design presentations and detailed specifications Collaborate closely with one or more local or remote Agile Scrum teams, working iteratively to deliver customer value Use customer insights that come from analytics and customer interactions to help inform business and design decisions Help to facilitate and participate in user research like interviews and usability testing to validate designs and make iterative improvements Contribute to efforts to create scalable experience design standards and improve design processes Participate in and lead design-thinking exercises to break through organizational silos and collaboratively solve complex design challenges Minimum Qualifications 5+ years of related professional experience Quality portfolio of recent work Excellent communication and storytelling skills, with the ability to distill complex ideas to their essence Demonstrable experience utilizing a variety of human-centered design methods and best practices Understanding of task analysis, experience mapping, low-fidelity prototyping, user testing and more. And you know how to choose the right tool at the right time to drive results Experience leveraging research and data to inform design decisions, and comfortable defining performance metrics to measure results Experience leading user research - interviews, ethnography, user testing, etc. Comfortable in a highly collaborative, fast-paced environment with multiple stakeholders, and can adjust to changing priorities Preferred Qualifications BA/BS or graduate degree in HCI, interaction design, or equivalent experience Experience with agile software design methods Experience supporting a complex ecosystem with multiple products Comfortable working on a distributed team and collaborating remotely The Ideal Candidate Passionate about designing things people love to use Brave in the face of complexity and adversity Positive, can-do approach that invites collaboration Takes the lead on projects with minimal oversight Leans into complex problem spaces and proactively engages with teammates to drive towards shared understanding and clarity Brings expertise and experience to the team and makes others around them better by sharing best practices, ideas and feedback Naturally curious and proactively asks questions to increase understanding of customer needs and business strategy Works to develop empathy for customers and is a strong advocate for their needs A systems thinker – loves exploring how different parts of a complex system fit together and can be made to work seamlessly Seeks feedback on designs, and provides thoughtful feedback to others At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Job Requisition ID # 22WD65267 Position Overview Autodesk is seeking a highly self-motivated and experienced Software Development Manager to lead one of our Inventor/Fusion 360 SW Development teams within our Design and Manufacturing organization. Inventor is a Windows based 3D CAD software that provides professional-grade mechanical design, documentation, and product simulation tools with 1 million+ users worldwide. Fusion 360 is Autodesk’s newest cloud-based 3D CAD software. This team is responsible for the development of multiple modeling, configurations, and workflow improvement efforts. As an ideal candidate, you will excel at being a mentor and coach to engineers at all points of their career. You are comfortable in an agile environment and know how to build a highly effective team. You will be leading a group of talented software developers as we continue to perfect Inventor workflows and build core CAD capabilities in Fusion 360. Responsibilities Promote a culture of continuous improvement and personal growth through goal setting, ongoing feedback, coaching, and tracking of performance. Support individual career development and provide necessary training opportunities Work with Product Managers, Product Owners, Software Architects, and other key stakeholders to build meaningful release plans and make critical decisions that balance customer value delivery and technical needs for both short- and long-term success Lead a globally distributed team with talented team members in a hybrid/remote work setting and Scrum framework to deliver high quality solutions in response to corporate strategy and customer requirements. In this role, it is likely that you’ll also play one of the key Agile roles (Product Owner, Scrum Master, or Technical Project Manager) Foster collaborative relationships across teams to accomplish holistic organizational goals Be the spokesperson for the team and champion their accomplishments with upper management and adjacent teams Foster a culture that promotes Autodesk values. Inspire and motivate team members by connecting to purpose and foster creativity while maintaining healthy work-life balance Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience 7 years of experience leading, managing, and mentoring teams in an Engineering discipline and record of delivering large scale C++ commercial software on Windows and Mac (Less experience will be considered for filling at less senior grade level) 3 years of experience leading tech leads, senior software engineers, and agile roles like Product Owner and Scrum Master Proven ability to manage and resolve complex and ambiguous issues Experience working with cross-functional stakeholders Solid understanding of all phases of software development lifecycle from analyzing the needs to delivery of working software Work with team to breakdown complex technical requirements into logical execution slices Experience with scrum and agile development processes and methodologies Proactive, inclusive, quick decision maker with excellent communication and written skills Comfortable working within, and managing, a globally distributed team within a hybrid/remote working model At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world.
